NAME: Methodology
TEACHERS: Sebera, M. - Bozděch, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Topic - Search and Selection, Archive of Final Thesis at MU Brno and UK Prague.
    Citation standard, creation of bibliographic records, citation managers.
    Structure and design of the project (research, problem, goal, research questions (hypotheses), methodology, studied subjects / objects, data source, data acquisition method, data analysis, study definition, study limits).
    Structure of theoretical, theoretical and empirical work. Methods and techniques, tools and variants of research.
    Methods of data collection (observation, methods, experiment, quaziexperiment).
    Data Processing Methods - Analysis, Synthesis, Review, Thinking and Logic Methods, Statistics.
    Basic statistical characteristics - mean, median, standard deviation, frequency, basic graphs - histogram, box graph.
    Statistics sw.
    Statistical and Effect Size
    Interpretation of results.
    Assessment and defense of the bachelor thesis.
OBJECTIVES: The aim is to prepare the student for the necessary steps in the bachelor thesis. Adoption of principles of professional work, access to the world of professional literature, methods of selecting topics and methods of professional work, work with literature and information sources. They will be acquainted with citation methods and bibliographic references. Basic research strategies, research plans and methods of data collection and analysis.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Written test from terminology - the test consists of 30 questions, 66% of correct answers is needed to pass.
    Project of bachelor thesis at chosen topic.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of the course students should be able to:
    to define science branch Kinantropologie
    to make a bachelor's thesis topic
    to create a structure of thesis
    to find relevant resources and create a research
    to determine the research problem, goals, questions and hypotheses
    to describe the research plan (strategies, methods of data acquisition and processing)
    specify the sample file and the method of selection
    specify the research file and the method of selection
    to analyze and interpret the results
LITERATURE:

NAME: English
TEACHERS: Dlabolová, D. - Prucklová, R. - Vyorálková, J.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: 1st block: My field of study, occupation. Winter sports - ice hockey, skiing, figure skating, snowboarding. Stadium team games - football. Grammar: use of articles, countable and uncountable nouns. Writing emails. 2nd block: Court games - volleyball, basketball, tennis. Water sports - swimming. Athletics. Conditional clauses, passive voice. 3rd block: Gymnastics, Adventure sports - combat sports, boxing. Fitness, anatomy. Relative clauses. Revision.
OBJECTIVES: The course is designed to provide students with knowledge of various sports disciplines and related topics while developing their reading comprehension, and oral and written skills in English. By the end of the course, students are expected to have reached the B2 level of the CEFR.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: B1+ level of English according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages is expected
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The course is taught in the form of seminars. Students will find topics for each week in the interactive syllabus section ("interaktivní osnova"), and prepare them for the following classes. After a proper registration, class-attendance becomes compulsory, 1 missed attendance is accepted.
TEACHING_METHODS: Language seminar: speaking,reading, listening, writing, presenting
TEACHER_INFO: The exam at the end of the course comprises testing all language skills: speaking, reading, wiriting, listening. the exam can be recognized on the basis of FCE, the corresponding examination from another university or on the basis of an internationally recognized certificate
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Graduates of this course will acquire basic command of professional terminology in sport science, health, anatomy and various sport disciplines. In addition, students will gain better command of professionally relevant grammatical phenomena, where the improvement of mainly reproductive communication skills (proper pronunciation, correct spelling, apt use of stylistic registers in written communication and acquisition of basic lexical knowledge) will be emphasized and their eventual mastery expected.
LITERATURE: MURPHY, Raymond. English grammar in use : a self-study reference and practice book for intermediate learners of English : with answers. Fourth edition. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2012, x, 380. ISBN 9780521189064. info

NAME: Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Jůva, V. - Možná, T. - Szemla, F.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: 1. The concept of education. Education and socialization; value orientation of education; the relationship of education, genetics and the environment. 2. Basic features of contemporary education. Features of democratic education. Formal, non-formal and informal learning. 3. The concept of pedagogy. The origins of pedagogy (Aristotle, Quintilianus, Comenius, Herbart). Contemporary concepts of pedagogy. Relation of pedagogy to other disciplines. Relation of pedagogy, kinanthropology and sports sciences. 4. Structure of pedagogy (system of pedagogical disciplines) and its importance in society. 5. Elements of the educational process (objectives, participants, conditions and resources). 6. Selected historical education models (Comenius, Locke, Rousseau, Dewey). 7. Educational goals - current goals of contemporary education. Preparing an individual for social roles (education for the life of H. Spencer, requirements of postmodern society). 8. Education as a development of basic qualities of personality. Education and training. Content of education - education and culture. 9. Teacher (educator, teacher, coach, teacher assistant, ...) - his education, competencies and personality characteristics. 10. Education of an individual (child, pupil, student, client, athlete, ...). Selected research of contemporary youth. 11. Forms of education (school, out-of-school, family). Education and leisure. 12. The system of pedagogical principles and their application.
OBJECTIVES: Encompassment of basic pedagogical categories, concepts and theories, with an emphasis on creating the basics of pedagogical competencies.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Basics of Social Sciences.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation, preparation and presentation of the individual home work, written test, oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, group discussion, individual home work

Myth and Philosophy.
    Philosophy of classic Greece.

NAME: Basic and Rhythmic Gymnastics
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Vaculíková, P.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_gym2 )
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Terminology of physical exercises
    Warm ups (main principles and individual parts of warm up)
    - joint-mobilisation exercises
    - dynamic warm up
    - coordination exercises
    - toning exercises
    Stretching (different kinds of stretching and its use in practise)
    Strengthen exercises:
    - abdominal muscles
    - back muscles
    - arms and trunk muscles
    - gluteus and legs
    - complex strengthening exercises For all exercises the correct terminology of physical exercises will be applied, the function of muscle groups and the correct execution of the individual exercises explained and the problems of breathing clarified.
    Music-movement theory – what is rhythm, rhythmic ability, why is it important to develop coordination skills, including rhythmic. What is counting time and metric impulse, or master beat
    - Use of music in movement activities – music as a basis or delimitation of movement content, movement exercises according to the presented rhythm, overlap into socio-emotional development and diagnostics of the climate in the group
    - Development of coordination skills – principles and creation in pairs, trios, basics of learning movement combinations and practice of giving feedback
    - Practice of individual dance steps and step connections – approach, transformation, polka, hop step, arm movements, scissors, long jump, stag jump, cadet, waltz step. Demonstration of various methodological procedures for teaching coordination-demanding exercises and combinations
    - Rhythmic games and exercises for different age groups
    - Basic dances – waltz, polka, jive, cha-cha, street dance
    - Basic and more advanced jumps and exercises with a skipping rope – creating a group combination
OBJECTIVES:
The aims of the subject (part Basic gymnastics) are following:
    - Familiarization with methodological and didactic procedures during warm up (without/with accompaniment of music)
    - Application of joint-mobilisation exercises
    - Interconnection of theoretical and practical knowledge from the area of the stretching and the strengthening and their use in individual parts of the exercise unit
    - Familiarization with the Czech gymnastics terminology of physical exercises and graphic recording of the motion
    The aims of the subject (part Rytmic gymnastics) are following:
    master the basics of music and movement theory and be able to apply them in practice (rhythm, tempo, beat, counting time, metric impulse)
    - learn the meaning of using music in movement activities and sports (development of coordination, social-emotional development, building cooperation of participants in movement activities)
    - learn the importance of developing coordination and movement memory
    - learn to perceive the quality of movement and learn to give feedback to others
    - master basic dance elements, steps, jumps and turns and learn to create short movement sequences
    - become theoretically and practically acquainted with individual types of dances (folk, country, street dance)
    - learn to apply musical accompaniment to teaching or training units in individual sports and movement activities
    - master the basic and more advanced technique of jumping rope exercises by musical accompaniment
    - learn to compose simple movement combinations for musical accompaniment
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
- active participation in classes (permitted absence - 4 absences regardless of whether they are excused or unexcused, in case of a larger number of absences, compensation is allowed only after prior agreement with the teacher of the seminar group).
    Part Basic gymnastics - written and graphic preparation of warm-up (12-15 exercises), main part or final stretching processed according to the instructions presented in the lessons
    - microteaching - warm-up, main part, or final stretching during the semester
    video - warm-up, main part, or final stretching
    - peer assessment of chosen videos (6x)
    - feedback

    - practical requirements:
    pull-ups - men 10 reps, women 5 reps
    push-ups - men 20 reps, women 10 reps
    hanging leg raises - men 5 reps, women 3 reps
    reverse plank - lifting right/left leg - holding the position for 10s each leg  
    standing forward bend, fingers on the mat - holding the position for 10 s  
    sitting with legs apart, arms raised - holding the position for 10 s  
    - active participation in classes, fulfillment of partial tasks on time and in high quality
    part Rhythmic gymnastics
    Feedback during the semester
    - active participation in classes (permitted absence - 2 hours)
    - complete two partial tasks during the semester:
    Create a part of a dynamic warm-up to musical accompaniment
    Create a combination with a skipping rope to musical accompaniment
    During the exam period, choose from two options
    - movement task with your own musical accompaniment, any style, mandatory elements in IO
    - Preparatory exercise for at least 3 people - preparatory exercise for a certain sport (organize, motivate, teach participants)
    Details about credit requirements can be found in the interactive curriculum.
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical exercises supplemented with theoretical explanations Pair work, group work Didactic games Simulation techniques
TEACHER_INFO:

    V případě opakovaného zápisu předmětu je student povinen předmět opakovat v plném rozsahu dle sylabu předmětu pro daný semestr, pokud se s vyučujícími písemně nedomluví na začátku semestru jinak.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of the course students should be able to:
    - know the list of stretch and strengthen exercises for different muscles of the body
    - know the correct execution of these exercises
    - form and lead the warm up (without/with accompaniment of music), circuit training, final stretching
    - know the correct Czech terminology of physical exercises
    - able to identify individual counting times in musical accompaniment, recognize metric impulse or master beat
    - be able to choose adequate musical accompaniment for the presented movement exercises
    - be able to perform basic dance elements, steps, jumps, turns and use them for preparatory or other exercises
    - be able to create movement combinations to the given musical accompaniment
    - be able to perform basic and more advanced jumps over a rope by the music
    - be able to give feedback on the exercises performed – they recognize correct and incorrect execution, they can instruct in the sense of improving movement skills
    - to know other uses of musical accompaniment in movement activities (emotional and social development, use in experiential activities, development of cooperation)

NAME: Anatomy
TEACHERS: Gimunová, M. - Juříková, J.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Introduction to Anatomy - cell, tissue, terminology. Bones - structure types. Axial skeleton (skull, spine, pelvis), upper limb skeleton, skeleton legs. Connection of bones, joints - Components, types, movements, individual joints. Muscles - structure, component types. Muscles of the head, neck, back and abdomen (including motor function). The muscles of the upper extremity, lower extremity muscles (including motor function).
OBJECTIVES: The aim of this course is to obtain a comprehensive view on human body and morphological factors influencing its movement. For this, it is necessary to understand the basics of individual organs and organ systems structures, especially the anatomy of the skeletal system, joints and muscles.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Successfully completed oral exam.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Successful completion of the subject Anatomy will allow you to understand the basic structure and structure of the human body - the necessary attributes for perceiving the body as a whole.
    The acquired knowledge from the area of functional anatomy will then be applied in follow-up professional subjects.
    The FSpS graduate must have an anatomical idea of the human body in order to understand the possibilities of adaptation, training, exercise and regeneration of the organism in childhood, adulthood and old age.
    Completing the course Anatomy is a necessary prerequisite for the enrollment of courses followed in further study at the FSpS.
LITERATURE:
HANZLOVÁ, Jitka a Jan HEMZA. Základy anatomie soustavy trávicí, žláz s vnitřní sekrecí a soustavy močopohlavní. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2006, 77 s. ISBN 8021039620. info

NAME: Information Technology
TEACHERS: Sebera, M. - Zaoral, P. - Sebera, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Every week we will discusse and practice one of the following topics:
    Information System of Masaryk University
    Information Resources, publication and citation ethics
    Create and manage bibliographic citations
    Cloud solutions and Office 365
    Google and its services
    Internet and its services
    Email communication, mail settings, protocols, etiquette
    Security in IT
    How to make powerpoint presentation effectively
    Electronic study materials for students of FSpS
OBJECTIVES:
Understanding the Information System and Study and Examination Regulations
    Theoretical and practical acquaintance with the possibilities of using information sources, issues of publishing and citation ethics including the methodology of creating and managing bibliographic citations.
    Effective document creation in Office (Word-templates, publication standards-PDF)
    Creating high-quality presentations in common software (MS Powerpoint and others)
    Understanding the basic principles of the Internet and its services (information searching , principles and functioning of emails, social networks, online communication, sharing, clouds, electronic signature).
    Prevent security threats in the IT area
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Orientation in basic therms of hardware and software, user working with MS Office and logon to IS MU.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Written test.
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/informatika/
    http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/informatika/ http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/informatika-a-vedecke-databaze/

NAME: Physiology
TEACHERS: Bernaciková, M. - Vomela, J. - Grün, V. - Juříková, J. - Kapounková, K. - Mazúr, J.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Syllabus and Concept of Selective Lectures:
    1) Introduction to physiology:
    - basic cell functions
    - what is homeostasis
    2) + 3) Principles of neurohumoral control and regulation of functions of the human organism
    4) Fundamentals of metabolism and physiology of body fluids; Secretion
    5) Function of cardiovascular apparatus; Blood composition
    6) Breathing, gas transmission, acid-base balance
    7) Functions of the digestive system
    8) Functions of the locomotive apparatus
    9) Immune system
    10) Adaptation of the organism (stress, stress, illness, age and gender factors, external environment, etc.)
    11) Biorhythms
    12) + 13) Free additional topics

    Syllabus of exercises:
    1) Introduction to Exercise Physiology, assignment of semestral projects
    2) Body structure and composition (anthropological examination)
    3) Motion system I (muscle fiber diagnostics, genetic assumptions)
    4) Motion system II (types of muscle contraction, dynamometry)
    5) Metabolism (Measurement of Resting Metabolism, Indirect Energometry)
    6) Body fluids (LA, GLY measurements)
    7) Cardiovascular system (HR measurement, BP measurement, Q and Qs calculation)
    8) Cardiovascular system (ECG, HR variability)
    9) Respiratory system (BR, TV, VE - spirometry)
    10) Control system (nervous system, endocrine system)
    11) Excretory system (urine examination)
    12) Senses (visual examination, vestibular system)
    13) a) Protocols checking + presentation of semestral projects b) Credit test
OBJECTIVES:
Teaching physics is not an end in itself. The subject is thematically oriented so that the basic information about the function of the human body and its organs is presented to the students at the lectures (selected key themes), then discussed in Seminars and applied in Practice where the student will actively participate in the realization of concrete tasks , exercises and tests and program essays. Part of the Exercise will be the separate elaboration of worksheets.
    The course is designed so that the student can understand the basic functions of the human body as a whole, as well as the function of the organs, and understand the mutual interaction of the human organism and the external environment for the maintenance of homeostasis.
    Similarly, it will be mentioned how the function of the human organism (and the function of its individual organs) will affect the physical burden, illness, stress,
    Students are familiar with differences in the functions of the human body in childhood, adulthood and old age.
    Knowledge gained through the study of Physiology will allow students to understand the concepts and processes in the human organism that the student encounters in the next follow-up studies at FSpS. Understand the changes that occur in our organism in individual types of sport, it will know how to focus and individualize the training and regeneration load. The completion of the subject of Physiology is a necessary prerequisite for enrollment of subjects related to further study at FSpS.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS:
The basic prerequisite for the beginning of Physiology studies are:
    - Regular enrollment of the subject
    - student knowledge at the level of biology teaching at high school
    - knowledge gained through study in the subject ANATOMY (bp4008).
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Subject physiology is normally completed by credit and examination.
    The basic prerequisite for granting the credit is:
    a) fulfillment of the duties prescribed within the subject (successful completion of Exercises and Seminars, elaboration of worksheets and semestral project). Compliance with these obligations is necessary to complete the credit test.
    b) passing a credit test (50 questions - maximum possible number of points obtained = 50) at least 70%.
    Entry to the oral exam is conditional upon the award of the Credit.
    Participation in seminars and seminars is mandatory. A maximum of 2 absences are tolerated, topics missing and need to be explained.
TEACHING_METHODS:
A) Lectures of selected topics - as an introduction to study.
    B) Exercises and seminars include both theoretical and practical part of teaching. Prerequisite for participation in the Exercise is the knowledge of basic information about the particular lesson.
    C) Self-study of recommended literature
    Teaching methods: presentation, discussion, practical measurements, group projects, essay processing, brainstorming. Testing knowledge.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Successful completion of the subject of Physiology will make it possible to understand the basic principles of homeostasis (ability to stabilize the internal environment of the organism), which are a necessary condition for the function of the organism as a whole, as well as its individual organs.
    Understand what is happening in the human organism, due to the burden, age, illness, stress,
    The acquired knowledge will allow to understand the basic functions of the human body as a whole (system), and from the point of view of the function of the individual organs.
    Graduates of the FSpS have to know the possibilities of adapting, training, loading and regeneration of the organism in childhood, adulthood and old age.
    The knowledge gained in this subject will allow students to understand the concepts and processes in the human organism with which the FSpS student will meet in related subjects. Thanks to the knowledge of the body's function, it understands the changes that occur in our body in individual types of sports and will know how to focus and individualize the training and regeneration load.
    The completion of the subject of Physiology is a necessary prerequisite for enrollment of subjects related to further study at FSpS.
LITERATURE:
BERNACIKOVÁ,M, Kapounková K., Novotný J., Vomela J., Vomelová N. Fyziologie člověka pro studenty bakalářských oborů Tělesné výchovy. FSpS MU, 2014. ISBN: 978-80-210-7697-6

NAME: Basketball
TEACHERS: Vencúrik, T.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_hry )
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Blocks:
    1. ballhandling, dribbling, moving with and without the ball,
    2. shooting (lay-up, set shot),
    3. passing and catching the ball,
    4. rebounding, moving without the ball,
    5. guarding the player with/without the ball, individual defensive skills against two opponents,
    6. offensive transition (fast break 3 on 2, 2 on 1), "give and go".
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to create the right physical habits in the teaching of individual basketball skills and basic game combinations. Students will also be introduced to basic basketball rules.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
80% attendance
    Credit is based on two parts: practical test of individual basketball skills and basic game combinations and an e-learning test of basketball rules.
    Practical test:
    1. Moving with the ball (dribble technique, change of direction, change of speed), lay-up (right and left side),
    2. "give and go" situation, drive and finishing with shot,
    3. game situation 3-on-3, full court.

    E-test from basketball rules: 15 questions in a given time.

    The overall grade will be based on the score students gain from the test. Students must pass each part of the test to earn the credits. Failing one part of the test means failing the test as a whole.
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/basketbal-a/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
When successfully completing the course, the student will be able to:
    - control the ball,
    - use individual offensive skills,
    - use individual defensive skills,
    - use the basic "give and go" combination of play and understand the nature of fast break situation,
    - characterize basketball and master basketball rules.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Psychology
TEACHERS: Pačesová, P. - Sokol, A. - Možná, T. - Kubíčková, V.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Lectures: - The content of discipline psychology: definition, paradigma, network of basic and applied disciplines, biology and social determination of human psyche (psychology schools). - Executive functions: cognitive, dynamic, conative processes (according the age and environment, possible impairments). - Dynamic processes: attitudes, motivation, values(according the age and environment, possible impairments). - Personality: definition, determination, typology, ontogenese. Personality in the social environment. - Loading and psyche, spiritual hygiene, optimal life-style. - Basics of sport psychology. Anxiety, aggression, activation, performance motivation, self-confidence, group cohesion, leadership and coaching styles, burnout, doping, sports and health. Seminars: - Interactive lectures and discussion, seminar works, self-learning, students presentations.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to make familiar the students with the basic principles, topics and issues of psychology: personality, inner experience and behavior in the social context. To present this topics from the holistic and bio-dromal psychology paradigm.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Assessment in points - active participation in lectures (10%) Assessment in points - active participation in the seminars, filled tasks (10%) Written test - exam (80%)
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with online information, seminars, seminar works, self-learning, students presentations.
TEACHER_INFO: https://owncloud.is.muni.cz/index.php/s/TV6oBnvut4DFPRW
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After passing the course student will be able to:
    - orientate in basic terms and principles of psychology topics and possible application, - on the bases of principles to understand approaches to personality according age and social context, - obtain knowledge and skills basic for his/her background in the interactive professions, - obtain the experience for self-efficacy in social relations
LITERATURE:

NAME: Anthropomotricity and Biomechanics
TEACHERS: Kalichová, M. - Zvonař, M. - Kalichová, M. - Vespalec, T.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Definition of biomechanics, importace, history. Physical base of biomechanics: line coordinates, scalares, vectores, units. Kinematics: mass point, distance, velocity, acceleration, straight motion, accelerated motion, cirgular motion, motions in field of gravity of Earth, describing motion with graphs. Dynamics: force, Newton's Laws, effects of force, deformations, Hook's Law, momentum and its conservation, impulse, centripetal force, inertial force, D'Alambert's Principle. Mechanics of rigid body: moment of force, principle of moments, centre of gravity, equilibrium positions, statics, frictional force, air resistance force, inclined plane, lever systems. Mechanical energy, work, power, conservation of energy. Mechanics of liquid and gas: pressure, Pascal's law, Hydrostatic pressure, law of Archimedes, equation of kontinuity, Bernoulli's equation, liquid flow around an obstacle. Biological base of biomechanics: body segments, biomechanisme, weight and centre of gravity of segments, centre of gravity of humen body, angular momentum of segments, mechanics properties of skeletal system, mechanics of joint connections, mechanics of muscle, mechanics load and deformation of tissues. Measurement and experiment in biomechanics. Biomechanics applications. Description of abilities and skills. Diagnostic methods of skill levels - motor tests The motor learning process. Laterality Ontoogenesis of motorics
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the subject is to explain the mechanical structure and mechanical behavior of the movement apparatus of the human in motion, especially the sport, and in this approach the research methods, based on which the human body is analyzed. Further, the aim of the subject is to acquaint students with the basic prerequisites for physical activity (skills and abilities), with the diagnostic methods of these assumptions and with the main manifestations during ontogenesis.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: seminar work; presentation of biomechanical paper; written test; oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: theoretical presentations; applications on exercises; biomechanical expert studies presentation; application of motor tests
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/biomechanika
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course students will be able to: explain basic mechanical laws and principles; ontogenesis rules and the motor learning process and to synthesize this knowledge in the future with previously acquired knowledge of selected biological subsystems; to apply the basic knowledge of this synergetic scientific discipline to the human system of motion and sport movement; from a kinematic and dynamic perspective to analyze the nature of the selected sport movement; to propose appropriate biomechanical measurements to solve the problem, to diagnose the level of physical abilities
LITERATURE:
KALICHOVÁ, Miriam, Josef BALÁŽ, Petr BEDŘICH a Martin ZVONAŘ. Základy biomechaniky tělesných cvičení. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2011, 193 s. ISBN 978-80-210-5551-3. info

NAME: Track and Field 1
TEACHERS: Adamík, R. - Hlavoňová, Z.

FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
1. lesson - warm-up, cool down
    2. lesson - running drills
    3. lesson - starts, rhythmizing excersises
    4. lesson - technique of running
    5. lesson - hurdle drills, rhythmizing excersises
    6. lesson - training hurdle running (3-step,4-step and 5-step rhytm)
    7. lesson - practise relay exchange (up-sweep and down-sweep)
    8. lesson - practise relay 4x 60m, 4x 100m, 4x 400m
    9. lesson - practice of throwing of ball and javelin
    10. lesson - kids athletics - speed development, endurance and hurdle running
    11. lesson - preparation for fulfillment of the requirements
    12. lesson - rehearsal of track and field rules and technique of mentioned events
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of subject Track and Field I is to provide theoretical knowledge and training practical skills:
    the correct technique of drive and stride phase of running,
    starts,
    the correct elementary, running and hurdle drills,
    hurdle running (3-step, 4-step and 5-step rhythm),
    relay exchange (up-sweep and down-sweep),
    the correct technique of throwing with ball and javelin
    basic rules of Track and Field events and principles of safety in the lessons.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Credits are obtained after fulfillment of the requirements:
    active attendence in lessons (1 missed lesson is allowed),
    ability to perform 3 randomly selected running and hurdle drill excercise,
    . running over 6 hurdle (3-step,4-step and 5-step rhytm and school-boys height),
    performing proper technique of drive (30 m) and stride (100 m) running phase,
    the correct technique of throwing ball pass written final test
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical exercises at the athletic stadium. Self study e-learning form.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After successful completion of the subject Track and Field I student will be able to:
    apply the correct technique of drive and stride phase, starts,
    demonstrate the correct technique of elementary, running and hurdle drills,
    use the correct technique of hurdle running (3-step, 4-step and 5-step rhytm),
    practise relay exchange (up-sweep and down-sweep),
    use the correct technique of throwing ball
    analyze (and critically evaluate) the most frequently occurring errors in technique perform the above mentioned events,
    demonstrate knowledge of basic rules mentioned Track and Field events and safety on lessons.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Skating
TEACHERS: Nykodým, J. - Starec, P.

FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Basic skating training according to the methodical series: Teaching is primarily focused on mastering the technique: forward, stop, reverse, ride in turns, forward and reverse, forward and outward swings, turns, jumps and ice games.
    Part of the lesson is to master warm-up, relaxation and stretching exercises, and safety precautions in skating lessons. Taking advantage of the skating tire as a prevention of injuries (injuries).
    Extended didactic skating series - circles forward and inward,
OBJECTIVES: At the end of this course the student will be able to: Demonstrated skills bases skating
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation in lessons, skill tests.
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/zaklady-brusleni-ledniho-hokeje-a-krasobrusleni/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After solving the subject, the student will be able to: -option theoretically the basic methodical skating series; -poping an extended methodical skating series; Practically handle individual elements of skating basics; -analyze shortcomings in practical demonstrations and propose a solution; -Take principles of warm-up, relaxation and stretching as a prevention of injuries.

NAME: Culture of Speech and Academic Writing
TEACHERS: Hurych, E. - Palka, J. - Kubíčková, V.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Culture of performance – written, oral, presented. Verbal and nonverbal performance, body speech. Cultural versus non-cultural. The fields of human communication and the specificities. Communication competence, communication in stress situations, communication in groups. Scientific works, scientific methodology. Sources and the process of searching and selecting information. The formal structure of the scientific texts, their characteristics, how to write introduction. Kinds of scientific texts and the specific parts. How to work with information, plagiary, ethics of research. Citations, bibliography, supplements, citation norms. Presentation of the results. Creative writing, processes (brainstorming, mind maps etc.).
OBJECTIVES: The main aim of the course is to develop the students´abilities in the next main fields: Cultura of performance. Communication skills. Writing skills - scientific work, scientific methodology. Formal demands of the scientific text and abilitiy to work with sources. Presentation of the results in both the written and oral forms.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The minimal presence in practical lessons = 80%; 1 active presentation during the term; the autoevaluation essay based on the presentation; written test (min. 8 points from 15).
TEACHING_METHODS: Lectures, practical exercises (individual and group projects), discussion, independent work
TEACHER_INFO:
https://is.muni.cz/auth/el/fsps/podzim2024/bk4022/index.qwarp
    Výuka a veškeré požadavky na ukončení předmětu jsou vedeny v rámci interaktivní osnovy předmětu.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: The student will be able to define basic demands on culture of performance in th eoral and written form and he/she will be also able to identify basic principles of culture within a model form of the presented outputs. In written form he/seh can use all the knowledge in the topographic, grammar and stylistic demonstrations. He/she will prove ability to work with written sources - their selection, meaningful implementation and using citation norms.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Preparation for Practice
TEACHERS: Roček, M. - Čechová, O. - Kubíčková, V.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
1. Acquaintance with the subject and its organization system
    2. On the basis of the theoretical knowledge, the student carries out during the semester of hospitalization in selected leisure organizations.
    3. Analyze and diagnose motion units and individual activities of the trainer.
    4. Participates in the analysis of all the lessons with the training instructor.
    5. Prepares its own motion units.
    6. He gains experience in conducting various types of motion units.
OBJECTIVES: Practice is an important and inseparable part of the undergraduate training of future instructors, trainers and educators. The aim of this training is to gain a balanced knowledge of pedagogy, psychology, general didactics as well as practical training. It is therefore necessary during the course of study to give students the opportunity to acquaint themselves with the various work activities of physical education specialists and to enable the training of pedagogical activities in the main areas of their possible application. Students will deepen their knowledge in both the theoretical and practical problems of organizing movement leisure activities and will better evaluate the pedagogical educational activities.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation in teaching, elaboration of all assigned tasks and investigations, management of pedagogical documentation (assessments of trainer, training analysis).
TEACHING_METHODS: Theoretical and practical preparation in the form of lectures and seminars, tasks for separate work.
LITERATURE:
HÁJEK, Bedřich, Břetislav HOFBAUER a Jiřina PÁVKOVÁ. Pedagogické ovlivňování volného času : současné trendy. Vyd. 1. Praha: Portál, 2008, 239 s. ISBN 9788073674731. info

NAME: Management Fundamentals in Sport
TEACHERS: Racek, O. - Sedláček, T. - Kadlec, J. - Racek, O. - Vyroubal, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
1. Meaning of management and basic terms
    2. Personality of the manager of his role and role
    3. Basic managerial skills and their use in practice
    4. Basic economic concepts - supply, demand, market
    5. Measuring economic performance, inflation, unemployment
    6. Banking and money
    7. Basic concepts of marketing
    8. Organization of sport in the Czech Republic
    9. Basics of business in sport
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to acquaint students with basic concepts in the field of management, marketing, economics and their possible applications in practice. Orient in the world of finance, the possibilities of doing business in sport and in organizing sports in the Czech Republic.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
The course ends with a final test with a pass/fail result (the student must obtain a minimum of 60 points).
    The student will be admitted to the colloquium if he/she actively participates in the seminars, presents properly and submits the seminar work on time (i.e., obtains a minimum of 51 points in the seminars - all information on the seminar requirements is inserted in the course materials).
    If a student commits any disciplinary infraction, that action will be considered a failure to meet the requirements for completion of the course. The instructor will close the examination (credit) with a grade of "F" in the IS and the Dean will initiate disciplinary proceedings which may result in termination. Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
TEACHING_METHODS:
Teaching is conducted in the form of lectures and seminars.
    The content of the seminars will be the application of the acquired theoretical knowledge to the practical use (managerial skills), the other problems will be practiced by case studies, where the students are expected to discuss the given issue, based on the theoretical basis obtained at the lectures.
    The student will prepare and present a seminar paper.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
- Define and explain the basic concepts of management, marketing and economics
    - Apply managerial skills in specific situations
    - Understand the fundamentals of finance and apply this knowledge in various life situations
    - to know the organization of sport in the Czech Republic
    - gain basic knowledge in the field of business in sport
LITERATURE:
ZAMAZALOVÁ, Marcela. Marketing. Vyd. 2. Praha: C.H.Beck, 2010, xxiv, 499. ISBN 9788074001154. info
        SRPOVÁ, Jitka a Václav ŘEHOŘ. Základy podnikání : teoretické poznatky, příklady a zkušenosti českých podnikatelů. 1. vyd. Praha: Grada, 2010, 427 s. ISBN 9788024733395. URL info

        BĚLOHLÁVEK, František, Pavol KOŠŤAN a Oldřich ŠULEŘ. Management. 1. vyd. Olomouc: Rubico, 2001, 642 s. ISBN 8085839458. info

NAME: Movement and Health
TEACHERS: Vomela, J.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
1. Reciprocal positive and negative relations between health and exercise or sport activity
    2. Oxidative stress and rhabdomyolysis after endurance physical performance - causation, symptoms, consequences, prevention
    3. Helath problems of exercise and sport in extreme climatic conditions (hypohydratation, hyponatremia, hyperthermia, hypothermia, altitude illness, dive injuries and decompression illness)
    4. Sudden cardiac death during sport aktivity - - causation, prevention
    5. Preventive medical examens - purpose, content, conclusions
    6. Overuse injuries of locomotive apparatus - causation, prevention, rules of treatment
    7. Orthesis, classic taping and kinesiotaping - purposes, rules of application
    8. Management of exercise and sport training and competion with minimalization of health problems
    9. Health risks of doping in sport
    10. Specific prevention of health risk of women, children and seniors during exercise and sport activity.
    11. Prevention of health risks during endurance running, cycling, swimming.
    12. Helath injuries after aggressive behaviour in sport - footbal, ice hockey, box.
    13. Exercise and sport activities of cardiac patients and peoples with blood hypertension - positive effects, and prevention of problems.
    14. Exercise and sport of patients with asthma bronchiale.
    15. Exercise and sport of patients with diabetes mellitus.
    16. Exercise and sport of patients with migraine.
OBJECTIVES:
At the end of the course students should be able to
    - consider relationship between health and physical activity
    - pursue an effective prevention, to deal with health problems during exercises or sport training etc.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Knowledge of human anatomy and physiology is supposed.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Colloquium
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/sportovni-medicina/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of the course students should be able to:
    1. list and explain reciprocal relations between health and exercise or sport activity
    2. discuss to causation, prevention and consequences of injuries and failures of physiological organs and systems (locomotive, cardiovascular, respirátory, endocrine, metabolic, immune)
    3. analyze chosen exercise or sport aktivity (e.g. endurance and strength training, running, cycling and swimming, common ball games) and identify its health risks
    4. plan of exercise or sport activity with minimal health risks
LITERATURE:
Novotný J, Sebera M, Hrazdira L, Novotná M. Kapitoly sportovní medicíny, Paido/FSpS MU 2003, www.fsps.muni.cz/ucebniceNovotny
        Kučera M. a kol. Dítě, sport a zdraví. Galén, Praha 2011
        MÁČEK, Miloš a Jiří RADVANSKÝ. Fyziologie a klinické aspekty pohybové aktivity. První vydání. Praha: Galén, 2011, xvi, 245. ISBN 9788072626953. info
        O´Connor et al. ACSM´S Sports Medicine. A Comprehensive Review. Wolters Cluwer, Philadelphia, Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2013, 857 pp.

NAME: Preparatory Combatives
TEACHERS: Bugala, M. - Reguli Čihounková, J. - Vít, M.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_upoly )
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Introduction to preparatory combatives - characteristic of combatives - taxonomy of combatives - function of combatives in school physical education Basic combative techniques 1. contact establishment 2. postures, transitions between postures 3. transfers 4. arm movements 5. leg movements 6. lifting, carrying and dropping of a live load (partner) turning the body, changing position 7. falling techniques (principles, psychology, tactics and bimechanics) Basic combatives 1. centrifugal (pulls) 2. centripetal (pushes) 3. opposition (resistance Combative games
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to acquire the knowledge about taxonomy of combatives, structure and use of preparatory combatives as a mean of motor abilities development in physical education and sports.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Student - knows taxonomy of preparatory combatives and characterize each group of exercises - is well informed about history of combat sports
ASSESMENT_METHODS: 1. Theoretical test - will verify knowledge of taxonomy and biomechanics of combatives 2. Practical test a) 8 exercises of preparatory combatives for developing of different motor ability b) 6 basic falling techniques to all directions
TEACHING_METHODS: Explication, exercises, individual physical preparation, drills, individual tasks: literature and e-learning study. Task control: questions and tasks in the class, submission of videos, mutual evaluation, final examination (theoretical test, practical test, seminar work).
TEACHER_INFO:

NAME: Football
TEACHERS: Bokůvka, D. - Lipčák, A. - Lipková, L.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_fotbal )
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Movement on the pitch Passing and receiving the ball Dribbling and one-on-one situations Goalkeeping Shooting Heading Attacking combinations Defensive combinations Gameplay Technical skills' test
OBJECTIVES: Students will be familiarized with the game's basic rules, terminology, and theoretical knowledge about the game and its contents. The practical part of the subject focuses on the practice of attacking and defensive football skills and the practical interpretation of theoretical knowledge. This knowledge and skills will be used in students' further study and practice. Basic structure, content and principles of distinctive parts of the teaching unit will be presented in this subject. Students will practice delivering the preparatory part of the unit, discussing both methodological and didactic procedures.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The student is healthy and can perform physical activity to the full extent.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Football knowledge and skill tests, active participation in exercises. Gaming skills will be tested during an exercise where the student receives the ball, dribbles and then shoots the ball on the goal within a given time limit. The final written test consists of 20 questions. If a student makes more than four mistakes, he or she must sit a re-test. The final evaluation consists of partial assessments of the practical skill test and a written test on football rules and theory. This subject assumes individual study of the rules, as well as individual skills training.
TEACHING_METHODS: practical exercises Self-study tasks: the study of football theory, Improving football skills Task control: technical skills test
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/zaklady-fotbalu/
    Výuka tohoto předmětu probíhá na hřišti s umělým povrchem TJ Tatran Bohunice po dobu 6 týdnů . Nejvhodnější obuví do této výuky jsou turfy (kopačky s gumovými kolíčky), kopačky nebo tenisky s hrubou podrážkou. Jako podpůrný informační a organizační materiál slouží interaktivní osnova předmětu.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of this seminar, students will be able to explain the basic terminology and basic rules of the game and will be able to prepare and design the teaching unit. Students will be able to describe and explain the basic systematics of game performance in football, understand the rules of football, and be able to demonstrate selected individual gameplay activities and a sequence of individual gameplay activities in practice.

NAME: Didactic
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Jůva, V. - Sliacky, J. - Kubíčková, V.

SYLLABUS:
General didactic as a basis for teaching. Aims and issues of general didactic.
    Components of the educational process (aims, actors, conditions, methods).
    Teaching methods (with respect to age-related differences).
    Alternative and innovative methods.
    Teaching methods regarding special educational needs.
    Modes of classroom organization and lesson phases.
    Teaching and learning strategies.
    Curriculum. Content transformation.
    Classroom management (with respect to age-related differences: pre-primary, primary, secondary, adult education).
    Pedagogical diagnostic.
    Pedagogical communication.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is introduce relevant didactic categories and theoretical knowledge with respect to age-related differences of pupils and domains, in which will students work. Another aim is to enhance pedagogical thinking a pedagogical competencies.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation, submitting a written lesson preparation, realisation and presentation of the individual homework, written test, oral exam.
TEACHER_INFO:
https://is.muni.cz/auth/el/fsps/podzim2024/bk4029/index.qwarp
    Cíle a obsah výuky a veškeré požadavky na ukončení předmětu jsou uvedeny v rámci interaktivní osnovy.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After finishing the course, the student is able to explain key concepts of didactic, to analyze lesson with respect to educational needs of pupils, to choose appropriate teaching methods, to use diagnostic methods with respect to needs of students or groups, to apply principles of pedagogical communication in instruction.

NAME: Physical Activity for People with Diseases and Disabilities
TEACHERS: Grmela, R. - Kapounková, K. - Struhár, I. - Grmela, R. - Šimonová, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Physical education for deseas and disorders, aim, means, compensatory procedure • Functional desorders of locomotor apparatus (diagnostics and corrective procedure) • Several kind of desorders of locomotor apparatus and corrective procedure • Kinesiological analyse of motion and suitable compensatory exercises • Diseases of pulmonary apparatus and compensatory exercises • Obesity nad compensatory exercises • Diabetes mellitus type I, II and compensatory exercises • Diseases of Cardiovascular apparatus and compensatory exercises • Gynecological diseses nad compensatory exercises • Neuropsychological diseases and compensatory exercises • Diseases of sense and compensatory exercises • Ontology, specialities and pathogeny • Elderly available physical activities
OBJECTIVES: The subject deal with prescription of physic activity in disabled people. During study of this subject student will be informed about possibilities of diagnostics of locomotive apparatus, compensatory means, structure and content of exercise unite. Student will also develop procedures in choosing of proper physic activity in disorder of locomotive apparatus, respiratory system, cardiovascular system, obesity, diabetes mellitus, gynecologic disorder, neuropsychic disorder, disorder of sense, elderly and so on.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Admission requirements for the exam:
    - participation in seminars (90% attendance)
    - completed practical methodical output
    - submitted investigation protocol marked by the teacher as fulfilled
    - credit test - success rate 70%, test content: theoretical and practical knowledge from lectures, seminars and study materials
    Final oral exam:
    - discussion of the investigation protocol
    - verification of knowledge from lectures and seminars
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon completion of this course the student will be able to: Carry out the orientative testing of the movement system for   weakened individuals. Propose an adequate balancing process for individual health impairments. Build an exercise unit for individual weaknesses in terms of developing the necessary indicators. Practically implement an exercise unit for individual weaknesses.

NAME: Theory of Sports Training
TEACHERS: Hrubý, M. - Langer, F. - Nykodým, J. - Hrubý, M. - Langer, F. - Nykodým, J.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Theory of Sport Training – basic principles Definition of sport Goals, tasks and outcomes of sport training Classification of sport performance Factorial structure of performance in sport Sports training tasks (strength&conditioning, technical, tactical and psychological preparation) Strength&Conditioning – definition, structure and methodology Technical preparation – motor learning and skill development Tactical preparation Psychological preparation Teaching methods Types of training units Short-term planning and programming
OBJECTIVES: During this subject students will synthesize theoretical knowledge of human anatomy, physiology, anthropomotorics, biomechanics and social studies. Students will apply these knowledge in the issue of adaptation of human organism to different types of sport training. Main objective is to help student understand basic principles and approaches of skill development of which lead to improvement of sport form and performance. Some special chapters will be also discused, for example diagnostics in sport, programming and planning of training process, classification of skills and many others. Students are in small groups, where they discuss and present their own work on related topics.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Written test using PC (close answers), condition to successfully pass the exam is 80% of the total score result for a particular test, active participation at the seminars,elaboration of a seminar paper on selected topic, and its PowerPoint presentation
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/teorie-sportovniho-treninku-1/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: By the end of the subject students will be able to define, explain and correctly use basic terms such as sports training, performance, shape, form and to classify sports performance. They will be also able to define objectives, tasks and outcomes of sport training, explain process of adaptation and create training plan using appropriate stimulus (specific, nonspecific). Students will be taught to apply these knowledge in different sport disciplines.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Sociology
TEACHERS: Svoboda, A. - Svoboda, A. - Svobodová, Z. - Kubíčková, V. - Sebera, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS: Origin and development of sociology Society Social groups Social mobility Socialization Sociál structure Social position and social role Culture Mass culture Media and society Sport and society Organization, institution, bureaucracy Social unevenness Socio pathological problems Organized crime, corruption Roman in the Czech context Religion Family Globalization
OBJECTIVES: Main objective and content of this lesson is to present a describe principal problems of contemporary society and discuss it in English. In such tas main sociologicl concepts and problems of siciety are discussed - society, socialization, social groups, globalization, mass media, family, social pathology, corruption,religion etc. Accent is focused on mutual relations of global dominant cultural backgrounds including phenomenon of sport as the growing agent os mass culture in sedentary postmodern society.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Main objective of this lesson is to understand principal problems of contemporary society.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: regular term of the final exam - written test - will be held in written form in a classroom with a PC at the faculty - remedial term - oral exam - participation in seminars, student seminar presentations
TEACHING_METHODS: Lessons on sociology, study of relevant literature Seminary: Topical problems of contemporary society
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Main and fundamental objective of this subject is deeper understanding of operation and tendencies of contemporary postmodern, sedentary consumerist society. Students are supported to understand existing forms of socialization, mutual relations of different global levels of culture, function of mass media, mutual relations of social and cultural majority and minorities, functioning sport phenomenon as growing agent of mass culture.

NAME: Floorball and Softball
TEACHERS: Ovesný, T. - Šiška, S. - Vencúrik, T.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_florsoft )
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
Floorball course blocks:
    1. Basic Game Skills:
    - posture and holding a stick,
    - spacing.
    2. Individual game activities:
    - dribble,
    - keeping the ball,
    - catching and passing,
    - moving without ball,
    - moving with a ball,
    - shooting,
    - steal the ball,
    - goalkeeper skills.
    3. Game combinations:
    - give and go,
    - back passes,
    - small-sided floorball.

    Softball course blocks:
    1. throwing and catching the ball,
    2. pitch and strike,
    3. base run and basic tactics of the game.
OBJECTIVES: Students will be acquainted with the basic rules of floorball and softball. Students will be practically familiarized with game skills and combinations in floorball and softball.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. 80% attendance,
    2. floorball and softball rules – e-learning test,
    3. practical demonstration of chosen individual skills from floorball and softball.
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/florbal-softbal/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the floorball part of the course, the student will understand the basic rules of floorball and master the individual floorball skills and game combinations.
    After completing the softball part of the course the student will understand the basic rules of the softball, master the individual softball skills and the basic tactical principles of the game.

NAME: Gymnastic Preparation
TEACHERS: Hedbávný, P. - Skotáková, A. - Vaculíková, P.

strengthening preparation

    landing preparation

    Development of joint mobility
    Development of reactivity
    Using of equipment and aparatus (ropes, overballs, fitballs, Swedish box, bench,...)
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of the course is:

    - Mastery of gymnastic skills on equipment and secondary tools
    - Getting acquainted with the assistance of exercises on individual aparatus
    - Introduction to methodological and didactic procedures in training individual exercises
    - Extension of the knowledge of basic gymnastic terminology by the nomenclature of exercises on aparatus

    1 absence possible Vault: Crouch
    Circles in the hump: swinging with turns, pull-up
    Rope climbing: with thrust, without thrust
    Trapeze: Swing
    Flexibility: wide legged seat, arms up

The student will be able to:
    - apply partial motor-functional preparations to the physical education process
    - demonstrate gymnastic skills on individual apparatus (vault, floor, climb, horizontal bar, rings, hoops in the hump)
    - provide assistance in exercising on individual equipment
    - apply the methodological series when teaching individual exercises

NAME: First Aid
TEACHERS: Mojžíš, M. - Zvonař, M.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: MS, OKT, SEBS, RKH, T, RVS
SYLLABUS:
1. Assessing the Situation
    2. Risks linked with giving of first aid
    3. External and Internal bleeding
    4. Uncosciousness. CPR Guidelines GL2021
    5. Recovery position
    6. Aspiration of Foreign Object
    7. Cold related emergencies
    8. Heat related emergencies
    9. Intoxication and chemical burns
    10. Musculoskeletal Injuries. Spinal injuries
    11. Shock developement
    12. Non-Accidental Cases
    13. First Aid differences at water environment
OBJECTIVES: The subject acquaints students with the prevention of accidental and non-traumatic emergencies, basic theories and practice of first aid, including resuscitation (basic life support). The subject respects the principles and procedures of first aid in accordance with the modern development of the field.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Attandance
    Practical exam - CPR, bleeding and positioning
    Theoretical oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Theoretical and practical lectures of First Aid and CPR
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/elportal/?id=1359748
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Student will be able to:
    -name risks linked with giving of first aid including water environment
    – name life-saving acts
    -distinguish unconsciousness with kept vital signs from necessity of starting of CPR
    - practice CPR of adult, child, infant and by state of near-drowning
    - change procedure of CPR, if there is possibility to use AED
    - stop life-threatening bleeding
    – find out from mechanism of accident severity of possible damage of organism and react adequately
    - treat typical musculoskeletal injuries – deduce probable type of non-accidental case from symptoms and react to the situation adequately
    -treat thermal injuries and cold exposures
    - remove aspirated foreign object with proper technique depending on age of casualty
    -discuss about possibilities of prevention due to rise of accidental or non-accidental case at school, swimming pools or in common life

NAME: Exercise Physiology
TEACHERS: Bernaciková, M. - Kapounková, K. - Pospíšil, Z. - Vomela, J. - Bernaciková, M. - Řehoř, A.
SYLLABUS:
Syllabus of lectures:
    - Characteristics of sport disciplines (type of load, duration of performance, load intensity). Sports Performance Factors.
    - Physiological principles of training.
    - Effect of genetics on performance. determinants of sport performance.
    - Stress response (control systems). Disturbance of homeostasis. Acidobasic equilibrium - stress acidosis. Response of the organism to different types of body load.
    - Metabolic performance characteristics (metabolic cover, energy sources, energy supply).
    - Functional Performance Characteristics (HR, VO2, LA, ..).
    - Characteristics of the athlete (load test to maximum: HR max, VO2 max, Wingate test: P max, AC, fatigue index, somatic characteristics).
    - Adaptation process. Regulation of adaptation processes. Adaptation mechanisms.
    - Specific adaptations of the organism to the burden (speed, force, endurance, force endurance, speed-force, coordinating aesthetic, combat, sports games).
    - Physiological differences during stress response and adaptation in relation to ontogenesis.
    - Influence of the environment on performance (cold, heat, pressure). Acclimatization.
    - Desecration process. Detrain.
    - Specifics of female response (menstrual cycle, pregnancy, childbirth, puerperium).

    Syllabus of exercises:
    - Introduction to exercise Physiology of the load, characteristics of sport
    - Sports performance factors
    - Metabolic performance characteristics
    - Performance characteristics during exercise
    - Specific adaptations of the organism to the load
    - Stress tests - introduction, performance characteristics of the athlete
    - Determination of thresholds (ventilation, lactate, circulating), Conconi test
    - Spiroergometry
    - PWC170
    - Selected tests of anaerobic assumptions (Jump ergometry, Wingate test)
    - Somatic characteristics of an athlete
    - Somatotype detection
    - Physiological essence of training, Health risks
    - Delivery of logs and worksheets
OBJECTIVES: The student will be able to understand the physiological processes in the organism during the sporting load and then after the physical activity. The graduate is able to explain logically and materially the structural and functional changes that occur in the organism due to adaptive mechanisms in response to a specific type of regular exercise load.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Regular enrollment of the subject and successful completion of so-called prerequisites in previous studies at FSpS (Anatomy and Physiology).
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Developed worksheets and exercise logs. The course will end with an oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture and practice. Exercises are both theoretical and practical, including laboratory testing. Teaching methods: presentation, discussion, demonstration of tests, practical measurements, homework (replenishment of worksheets).
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Graduates of the course will be able to:
    1.Pacify the body's response to the load for specific groups of sports disciplines
    2. Identify the mechanisms of adaptation processes
    3. Analyze workload and load stress tests to determine the degree of stress and thus prevent the development of pathological fatigue.
LITERATURE:
BERNACIKOVÁ, Martina, Kateřina KAPOUNKOVÁ, Jan NOVOTNÝ, Eva SÝKOROVÁ, Jan NOVOTNÝ, Stanislav BERNACIK, Sylva HŘEBÍČKOVÁ, Eduard HRAZDÍRA, Pavel MUDRA, Jan ONDRÁČEK, Zora SVOBODOVÁ, Jaroslav ŠAMŠULA, Pavel VACENOVSKÝ a Jaroslava CHOVANCOVÁ. NAME: Introduction to Strength Training and Conditioning

SYLLABUS:

    Speed perfomance determinants,
    The methods of development speed skills,
    The specifics of speed training,
    Strength perfomance determinants,
    The methods of strength development,
    The specifics of strength training,

    The specifics of endurance training,
    The methods of endurance development,
    Coordination perfomance determinants,

    Application of methods of developing endurance skills

    Application of methods of developing of flexibility
OBJECTIVES: The aim of subject "Introduction to Condition Training" is to educate the students to interpret the basic of condition training, to define determinants of development of physical abilities, to define concepts of condition training,forms and methods using in codition training. The another goal is to apprize with methods of development of physical abilities in practice and with description and application of excersises on the basic of specific to selected sport discipline.

NAME: Classical Massage
TEACHERS: Kapounková, K. - Struhár, I. - Müllerová, M. - Kopečková, B.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    1. Theoretical basics of massage
    2. Diseases of the subcutaneous tissue, musculoskeletal disorders and vertebral musculoskeletal disorders
    3. Indications and contraindications of massage
    4. General myology. Muscle system (back muscles, chest muscles, abdominal muscles, lower limb muscles)
    5. Types of massage, massage media
    6. Effects of massage - Effect on the skin, Effect on skeletal muscles, Effect on tendons, Effect on blood circulation, Effect on the lymphatic system
    7. Position of a person during massage, Pain and massage
    8. Classic Massage Technique: a) Effleurage b) Petrissage c) Friction d) Tapotement e) Vibration f) joint movements g) Various other forms
    9. Technical errors of massage therapist
    Seminars:
    1. Fundamentals of ergonomics of work
    2. Basic massage strokes - a) Effleurage b) Petrissage c) Friction d) Tapotement e) Vibration f) joint movements g) Various other forms
    3. Back massage including the shoulder blade (positioning, massage strokes, passive stretching)
    4. Neck massage including the shoulder blade (positioning, massage strokes, passive stretching)
    5. Lower limb massage (positioning, massage strokes, passive stretching)
OBJECTIVES: The main aim of the course is to administrate the massage of selected parts based on theoretical knowledge and practical skills. Another aim is to teach the student to choose the correct massage strokes with respect to the actual state of the person. Based on acquired knowledge, the student will analyze muscle groups, design and apply a combination of massage strokes based on their effectiveness. In conclusion, the student must justify used massage techniques.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. attendance (one absence is permitted)
    2. 2 tests during semester, min.65 %. Tests consist of 20 randomly selected questions.
    3. Practical exam
TEACHING_METHODS:
- lectures
    - practical seminars
    Practical seminars are focused on the correct technique of individual massage strokes, which students practice in pairs under the supervision.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the course the student is able to:
    1. Define general principles and benefits of massage
    2. List the indications and contraindications of the massage
    3. Define the topographic areas of the trunk and the lower limbs
    4. Choose the right massage strokes in relation to the aim of the massage
    5. Discuss about the selection of selected massage strokes
    6. Demonstrate individual massage strokes
    7. Practice selected massage - back, neck, lower limbs
    8. Assess the condition of the organism before and after massage
LITERATURE:
STORCK, Ulrich. Technika masáže v rehabilitaci. Edited by Heinz-Otto Junker - Walter Rostalski. 1. české vyd. Praha: Grada, 2010, 191 s. ISBN 9788024726632. URL info

NAME: Sports Nutrition and Regeneration
TEACHERS: Hlinský, T. - Bulínová, V. - Kumstát, M. - Puda, D.
SYLLABUS:
1. Regeneration, regeneration, regeneration.
    2. Fatigue.
    3. Psychological means, pedagogical means of regeneration.
    4. Nutrition, basic concepts in nutrition, energy balance.
    5. Water, water balance, drinking regime.
    6. Vitamins and minerals.
    7. Nutrition in endurance sports.
    8. Nutrition in power sports.
    9. Food supplements - legislation, division.
    10. Food supplements - proteins, energy preparations, drinking regime, ergogenic substances.
OBJECTIVES: Get acquainted with basic regeneration methods. Within the framework of regeneration, focus more closely on nutrition. Successful graduates will be able to orientate themselves in possible regeneration methods and resources and basic principles of the nutrition plan for selected types of exercise and sports.

- attendance at seminars (1 non-attendance is allowed)
    - 2 subtests containing 5 questions with a total score of 10 points (7 points are required to meet the seminar requirements ... 70%)
    - 3 interim ROPOT in the form of open-book tests
    - the exam is written on a PC with a total of 30 points (at least 16 points are required for successful completion)
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: - Understand the concept of regeneration and the importance of nutrition for sportsmen, the concept of fatigue and adaptation. - Explain the basic concepts of nutrition, basic principles of regeneration. - Identify the need to establish a regeneration plan and a diet plan. Food supplements and doping. - Know different forms of regeneration, regeneration and nutrition supplements. - Identify appropriate and inappropriate means of regeneration and nutrition supplements.

NAME: Law in Sport
TEACHERS: Novák, J. - Novák, J. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: 1 Application of basic legal standards in practice. 2 Understand the structure of internal standards within individual sports 3 Knowledge and application of basic contractual relationships in the sporting environment 4 Knowing the basics of budgeting of sports clubs and associations 5 Tax Issues in Associations and Business Companies 6 Knowledge and orientation on state administration portals 7 Management of general meetings of clubs and sports associations, activities of executive committees and committees 8 Pitfalls in the legal protection of physical and legal persons in sport 9 Basic understanding of the breadth and impact of self-responsibility in sporting activities 10 Knowledge of practices against the negative phenomena in sport - doping, corruption, betting, etc. 11 Basic differences in sports at schools, clubs and professional sports
OBJECTIVES: Learning outcomes of the course unit The aim of the course is to create a complex legal awareness of students about the Czech legal order, including the most important norms of European law, and to build legal awareness of students about the status of sport and its autonomous nature in the Czech and EU law. Furthermore, gaining a basic orientation in the creation and application of general and sporting standards in sports at the federal and commercial level and understanding the position of natural and legal persons in the governing structures of associations, both national and transnational, including acquisition of awareness of legal protection of sports subjects and responsibility in sport.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Experience in the creation , application and use of sports law.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: oral exam After passing lectures (to the extent necessary) and compulsory seminars, the student will receive a credit from the subject. The course is finished in written form. oral exam. In case the subject is not finished by the exam, the credit can not be awarded until the written test is completed. The rating scale for passing a test mark is A - F.
TEACHING_METHODS: lectures, seminar The subject is taught in the form of lectures and follow-up seminars. The lectures explain the basic topics of the given topic. The seminars discuss specific examples of current dispute and law practice. Due to the little-published comprehensive information about this issue, participation in lectures is a prerequisite for the completion of the course.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon completion of the course the students will be able to orientate in the Czech legal order in relation to sports subjects and the position of physical and legal persons in an autonomous sports environment. They will understand the notion of "state separation from sport" and the application of internal legal norms. For the future position of coaches, respectively. managers acquire knowledge of the responsibility in sport resulting from their activities in clubs and associations and all possibilities of legal protection within sports autonomy, including international institutions (CAS) and general courts, respectively. arbitration bodies.
LITERATURE:
PICHRT, J. (ed.) Sport a (nejen) pracovní právo. Praha: Wolters Kluwer, 2014, 288 s. ISBN 978-80-7478-655-6

NAME: Theory of Sports Training 2
TEACHERS: Langer, F. - Hrubý, M. - Hrubý, M. - Langer, F.
SYLLABUS: 1)TALENT – evaluation and forming talent, exogenous or endogenous factor, selection of talent. (example real selection) 2)METHODS OF MANIPULATING WITH LOADS – (construct by sort of sport) 3)MOTIVATION – primary, secondary, outer – inner, motive, needs (Maslow´s hierarchy of needs) SPORT MOTIVATION phase: generalization, differentiation, stabilization, diminution. 4)DIDACTIC METHODS orders, practical, reciprocal, self-evaluation, with offer, controlled discovering. 5)TYPOLOGY OF TRAINERS specialist, organiser, controller, motivator, educator-tutor. METHODS autocratic, democratic (participation), liberal, situational. 6)PRINCIPLES OF LEADING A TEAM, DIDACTIC PRINCIPLES – principles of a sport training 7)BIOLOGICAL QUANTITY FOR LEADING A SPORT TRAINING (heart rate, lactate, VO2 MAX) 8)TRAINING AT HIGH ALTITUDES – acclimatization 9)FITNESS, TECHNICAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL PREPARATION – definition, aims, tasks, programs, methods and procedure. 10)MOVEMENT ACTIVITY AND TRAINING IN HIGHER AGE standards and recommendation for maintenance of condition, basics of workout (men, women. SPORT PREPARATION OF WOMEN, CHILDREN AND YOUTH) (principles, specifics from aspect of anatomy, physiology, psychology) 11)MOTORIC TESTS and their use, diagnostic, control, planning, prognostication, application methods of mathematics statistics. DIAGNOSTICS OF PHYSICAL FITNESS form of diagnostics, diagnostics methods a procedure, results of diagnostics from aspect of time. 12)ANALYSIS OF SPORT – GAME PERFORMANCE factors – determinants, movement activity and physiological characteristic, actual occurrence and trends of chosen discipline, sport (athletics, sport game, gymnastics, modern gymnastics, swimming), stimulation and development of dominant movement abilities. 13)PLANNING AND MODELING OF TRAINING LOAD stimulation and development of movement abilities: condition, coordination, hybrid, analyse of sport – game performance, individual and collective game performance, condition training, technical-tactical, regeneration, psychological preparation, kinetic tests, tests of sport skills.
OBJECTIVES: The main aim of TST is to, after successfully finishing this subject, clarify sport training (furthermore: pedagogical process with its specific didactics within sports like requirements in development of movement abilities in sport skills). Ability to use trainings methods, forms, preparation etc. with consideration the age, individualism to differences between gender, performance level in variable environment is prerequisite to required effectivity in training process or rather to reach maximal performance in some specific sport or discipline.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Written test using PC (close answers), condition to successfully pass the exam is 80% of the total score result for a particular test, active participation at the seminars,elaboration of a seminar paper on selected topic, and its PowerPoint presentation.
TEACHING_METHODS: Seminar teaching mixed, form outputs seminar for students on issues and practical activities for the development and performance of training
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/teorie-sportovniho-treninku-2/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After finishing this subject every student should be able to: a)make a training plan for a specific load in some particular sport. b)create a movement activity plan in terms of health. c)explain and use basic principles of training in hypoxic environment. d)take into consideration differentness connected with growing up of children and youth people in training process. e)explain differences between sport training of a man and a woman and be able to use this knowledge in making training plans. f)Identify a sport talent g)Lead a training process in short-term, medium-term and long-term period. h) explain and use different kind of training for seniors and physical disabled people in practise use.
LITERATURE:
