NAME: Law and Sports
TEACHERS: Skryja, P. - Bučková, L.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: TRBU, TRAD, TRBA, INSE, TRFB, TRAT, TRBL, TRVO, TRKR, TRBO, TRCY, TRPL, TRZA, VZST, TRMG, TRBI, TRSG, TRLH
SYLLABUS: 1.The basic rules of private law and public law, commercial register, insolvency register, trade register, VAT register 2.The relationship of the state and sport, the autonomy of sport - and government funding for sport in the Czech Republic at the republic, provincial and municipal 3.Legal relations sporting entities (legal order of the Czech Republic, tax obligation sports bodies, internal rules of sport and the rules of the sport) 4.Entities in sports, legal entities and natural persons 5.Contractual relationships sporting bodies, patterns, form and kontent 6.Liability in sports development and current concepts 7.Decision disputes in sport (judicial and extra-judicial protection of sporting entities, including CAS)
OBJECTIVES: Given that the subject is taught while studying coaching licenses in the maximum range 2-6 hours is the goal of the course providing a comprehensive legal awareness trainers on the legal order of the Czech Republic, including the related most important standards of European law and the establishment of legal awareness of the coaches on the status of sport and its autonomous nature of environment Czech law and EU. Furthermore, the acquisition of basic knowledge in the field of sport and business at the federal level and understand the position of natural and legal persons in the management structures of associations and national and international note, including the adoption of legal protection of sports bodies and accountability in sports.
TEACHING_METHODS: The course is taught through lectures and seminars. The lectures are explained the basic themes of the issue. At the seminars are discussed concrete examples of current practices affecting the rights and dispute.
LITERATURE:
KRÁLÍK, Michal. Civilní odpovědnost sportovců za sportovní úrazy. Vydání první. Praha: Leges, 2016, xxix, 475. ISBN 9788075020994. info

NAME: Football coach UEFA A 1

Introduction to coaching: The roles and responsibilities of a coach.
    Basic principles of coaching: Physical, technical, tactical and psychological preparation.
    Football playing principles and basic tactics.
    Communication and player motivation.
    Ethics and fair play in football.
OBJECTIVES: To introduce students to the key principles and concepts of coaching. Provide the foundations of theoretical knowledge needed to work as a coach.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Students must have a valid UEFA B licence and a minimum of 2 years' experience in a coaching role in football.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Sub-requirements for the semester established prior to the start of the course.
TEACHING_METHODS: Individual preparation, self-study, theoretical preparation, practical training units, internship.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon completion of the course, the student will be able to: - define the key concepts and principles of coaching; - explain the basic methodologies of training; - analyze basic tactics and game principles.

NAME: Social-scientific basis
TEACHERS: Hurych, E. - Bučková, L. - Králová, T. - Rus, V.
SYLLABUS:
Fair play and respect for the rules
    Olympism - key principles and their legacy
    Doping and athletes' health
    Equality and inclusion
    Coach's responsibility to nurture and role models
    Match fixing and corruption
    Protecting young athletes
    Ethics of competition and rivalry
    Ethical decision making
    Some current issues in contemporary sport (gender and transgender, disadvantage, the intersection of politics into sport)
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to provide students with a basic overview of the key attributes of social science, to develop their understanding of the social, psychological and ethical aspects of sport and coaching and to provide tools for working effectively with individuals and teams Further, the goal is to prepare students to be leaders as coaches who also understand the human and social aspects of their profession.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: written test, 15 questions, minimal rate 8 points.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
The student understands the principles of sports ethics and fair play and is able to apply them in the daily training and competition environment. The student is able to convey the values of fair play to athletes and promote ethical behaviour.
    The student understands cultural, gender and social differences and is able to approach them with respect. Can create an inclusive training environment where all athletes feel supported regardless of their background.
    The student is able to critically evaluate their own coaching methods and approach, including their impact on individual athletes and the team. He/she actively seeks feedback and is willing to continually improve not only in technical, but also in social and psychological areas.

NAME: Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Roček, M. - Bučková, L. - Králová, T. - Rus, V.
SYLLABUS: 1. Pedagogy of sport as a discipline (aim, means, philosophy, history, research in pedagogy) 2. Sport (characteristics, types and approach) 3. Coach (profession, role and personality of the coach, coach-athlete communication, principles of tactful behaviour, diagnostic activity of the coach) 4. The athlete (career of the athlete, ending a sporting career, education of the athlete) 5. Training of children (age regularities, individual peculiarities) 6. Theory of motor learning 7. Didactic principles (forms of learning, feedback, self-reflection) 8. Philosophy of the coaching profession (Positive Coaching Alliance, Fair Play Coaching as a helping profession)
OBJECTIVES: Acquisition of professional terminology of pedagogy and sport pedagogy; understanding of the humanistic concept of contemporary sport pedagogy; analysis of sport education. Development of basic pedagogical categories, concepts and theories with emphasis on the formation of the foundations of pedagogical competences.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation and successful completion of the colloquium is required for successful completion
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon completion of the course, the student will be able to: - identify basic pedagogical categories and concepts - orient themselves in the basic forms of pedagogical research - describe the basic elements of the educational process - orient themselves in the field of motor learning - analyse a selected area of education - explain the functions of education in the field of sport and physical activity - actively use pedagogical communication and feedback
LITERATURE:

NAME: FIRST AID KIT
TEACHERS: Bartošek, D. - Mojžíš, M. - Bučková, L. - Králová, T. - Rus, V.
SYLLABUS:
1. Assessing the Situation
    2. Risks linked with giving of first aid
    3. External and Internal bleeding
    4. Uncosciousness. CPR Guidelines GL2021
    5. Recovery position
    6. Aspiration of Foreign Object
    7. Cold related emergencies
    8. Heat related emergencies
    9. Intoxication and chemical burns
    10. Musculoskeletal Injuries. Spinal injuries
    11. Shock developement
    12. Non-Accidental Cases
    13. First Aid differences at water environment
OBJECTIVES: The subject acquaints students with the prevention of accidental and non-traumatic emergencies, basic theories and practice of first aid, including resuscitation (basic life support). The subject respects the principles and procedures of first aid in accordance with the modern development of the field.
TEACHING_METHODS: Theoretical and practical lectures of First Aid and CPR
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Student will be able to:
    -name risks linked with giving of first aid including water environment
    – name life-saving acts
    -distinguish unconsciousness with kept vital signs from necessity of starting of CPR
    - practice CPR of adult, child, infant and by state of near-drowning
    - change procedure of CPR, if there is possibility to use AED
    - stop life-threatening bleeding
    – find out from mechanism of accident severity of possible damage of organism and react adequately
    - treat typical musculoskeletal injuries – deduce probable type of non-accidental case from symptoms and react to the situation adequately
    -treat thermal injuries and cold exposures
    - remove aspirated foreign object with proper technique depending on age of casualty
    -discuss about possibilities of prevention due to rise of accidental or non-accidental case in sport or common life
LITERATURE:
KUBÍKOVÁ, Zdeňka, Barbora ZUCHOVÁ, Milan MOJŽÍŠ, Martina BERNACIKOVÁ, Barbora CVEJNOVÁ, Radek TURIN, Petr ZAORAL a Petra SEBEROVÁ. Metodický materiál k výuce první pomoci. 3., aktual. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014. Elportál. ISBN 978-80-210-7674-7. URL info
        FLEGEL, Melinda J. Sport first aid. 4th ed. Champaign, Ill.: Human Kinetics, 2014, vii, 315. ISBN 9781450468909. info

NAME: Nutrition
TEACHERS: Hlinský, T. - Kumstát, M. - Bučková, L. - Králová, T. - Rus, V.
SYLLABUS:
1. The importance of nutrition for the human body
    2. The role of nutrition and lifestyle in human health
    3. Health aspects of sports nutrition
    4. History and assessment of nutritional status
    5. Nutritional recommendations
    6. Energy balance
    7. Carbohydrates, proteins, fats
    8. Micronutrients
    9. Drinking and the importance of fluids
    10. Dietary supplements
OBJECTIVES: The objective of the course is to provide students with comprehensive knowledge of nutrition and its impact on human health. Students will become familiar with current nutritional recommendations for the general healthy population as well as for individuals with increased physical activity. The course will focus on the fundamental components of nutrition, their significance, sources, dosage, and physiological effects on the body. Emphasis will be placed on understanding the role of nutrition and a healthy lifestyle in health promotion and disease prevention. The course will also address the health aspects of sports nutrition and the importance of proper hydration.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Active participation.
    Completion of the online test (20 questions, 20 minutes, only one correct answer each time, no points deducted for wrong answers, minimum score is 15 including, learners have 5 attempts to complete the test).
LITERATURE:
KUMSTÁT, Michal a Tomáš HLINSKÝ. Sportovní výživa v tréninkové a závodní praxi. 2., upravené vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2022, 115 s. ISBN 978-80-280-0173-5. info

NAME: Body and Mind Under the Castle
TEACHERS: Koblížková, A. - Bučková, L.
OBJECTIVES: This is a compensatory lesson characterized by a faster pace. The lesson smoothly connects balance exercises with elements of the Pilates method and yoga asanas. It uses not only exercises with your own body weight, but also various aids such as overball, bosu, flexband and fitball. During the exercise, emphasis is placed on working with the breath and its awareness. Exercise builds a strong core. Its goal is, among other things, training in proper posture, changing bad movement stereotypes, removing muscle imbalances and overall strengthening and at the same time stretching the muscles. At the end of the lesson, relaxation is included using the effect of aromatherapy, or work with the fascial system. They practice in comfortable clothes, barefoot. Drinks, a towel and your own mat are also suitable

NAME: Fitness dance plus
TEACHERS: Šilerová, L. - Bučková, L. - Sojka, M.
SYLLABUS: - introduction of the basic principles of exercise - the bases of the system - training and mastering the basic configuration - practising the advanced methods
OBJECTIVES: Do you like Zumba? You'll love the this! It is a fun and simple, uses various kinds of dances from Latin American dances to pop hits and hits of the sixties. Unlike Zumba emphasis on symmetry assembly - burdened both sides of the body equally, more engaging work arm and puts greater emphasis on proper implementation of Fitness dance plus combines the rhythms of salsa, bachata, merengue, reggaeton, hip hop, pop, Latin, rock, mambo, cumbia and many others - uses the rhythms of both Latin American and European. Certainly is not anything complicated, dance and exercise can really each of you. The moves are easy to follow and rhythms are repeated emphasis is on even loading all parts of the body with emphasis on symmetrical replenishment exercises. Fitness dance plus benefits are similar to other cardiovascular activities: improve cardiovascular and cardiorespiratory system improving fitness muscle system, especially pelvic muscles improve overall physical coordination program ideal for weight loss toning the muscles of the lower limbs in particular improving physical and mental activity

NAME: BODYSTYLING
TEACHERS: Pavlíčková, Ž. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: - introduction of the basic principles of exercise - the bases of the system - training and mastering the basic configuration - practising the advanced methods
OBJECTIVES: Bodystyling is focused on strengthening and shaping the figure and also helps improve physical condition. The training focuses on shaping the muscles of the whole body, especially focusing on strengthening the problematic areas - thighs, buttocks and abdominal muscles. The lesson consists of four parts. The first part of the lesson is of a combustion character with strengthening the lower half of the body. There is also an increase in heart rate, which accelerates basal metabolism and the body begins to use fats as a source of energy. Another part of the lesson is focused on strengthening the muscles of the upper body. The third part is devoted to abdominal muscles, pelvic floor muscles and muscles around the spine, which are very important for proper posture. At the end of the hour, the body calms down and the muscles are stretched.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is geared for the long-term education only.
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/zamestnanci/

NAME: Poweryoga
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: - introduction of the basic principles of exercise - the bases of the system - training and mastering the basic configuration - practising the advanced methods
OBJECTIVES: Poweryoga is a style of exercise that focuses on the harmony of body and mind. This is a comprehensive approach with an emphasis on the dynamic execution of individual yoga asanas in short formations, based on proper posture, pelvic floor control and work, and a deep spine stabilization system. Compared to classical yoga, this style is more dynamic (you will even sweat). However, the emphasis is still on fluidity, concentration and transition between positions so that they are not performed with haste and stress, but with calm mind and flowing breath. Poweryoga is suitable for the prevention of back pain, which is often caused by civilization influences: poor posture, poor movement habits, unilateral load, etc.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is geared for the long-term education only.
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/zamestnanci/

OBJECTIVES: The exercise is based on the repetition of basic yoga positions (asanas), which strengthen, strengthen and stretch the muscles of the whole body and relax the mind. We will include Pilates elements to strengthen the deep stabilization system. In the lessons, we will also use various balance aids (overballs, fitballs, balance segments - boss). What to take with you to exercise? Comfortable clothing that does not restrict your movement, a towel, a bottle of water, and exercising without shoes are suitable. If you own a mat or exercise mat, please bring it with you (from a hygienic point of view).

NAME: Pilates as compensation for sedentary work
TEACHERS: Kostelníková, A. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: - introduction of the basic principles of exercise - the bases of the system - training and mastering the basic configuration - practising the advanced methods
OBJECTIVES: This is a "softer" Pilates lesson that is also suitable for beginners (it is not as "powerful" as a classic Pilates lesson). During the exercises, the emphasis is on proper breathing and exercises are done at a slow pace, the technique of the exercises performed is important. The exercise is aimed as a compensation for sedentary work (especially when working at a computer), during which there is an excessive load on the spine due to long-term sitting with a round back, which leads to increased pressure on the intervertebral discs. During this lesson we will focus mainly on relaxing the spine and stretching the muscles along the spine, we will further stretch and slightly strengthen the muscles of the whole body and also the deep muscles. During this lesson, for example, overballs or cylinders are used as exercise aids (if we will practice in person, of course).
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is geared for the long-term education only.
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/zamestnanci/

During exercise, we will use the weights of our own body and exercise aids, both classic and latest trends in fitness training. Each lesson will end with a thorough stretch. Conditional exercise is suitable for anyone who wants to strengthen their body and improve their physical condition.

NAME: Wellness Fit Programme for MU students
TEACHERS: Koblížková, A. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: Timetable 24h (i.e. 25x45min.): Total number of 16 hours sport. Activity + debate Ma active and healthy lifestyle +1, 5h relaxation Program – Jacuzzi and sauna: Friday (7h): Pilates, Yoga therapy, fascial yoga, 3 fitness walking or run @ Go around dam + fitness exercise (outdoor gym), 30 min. + 30 min. Aqua Aerobics and fitness swimming, table tennis Saturday (6h): bodybalance, walk + kpč Luhačovice, aqua aerobics, fitness yoga, relaxation and body massage, cardio prolongation and whichare and metabolic training. Sunday (3h): Pilates, BodyForm + functional training, fitness swimming + 1, 5h relaxation Program – Jacuzzi and sauna -Change of program according to possibilities defined
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the Welness Fit Programme is to support a healthy lifestyle with the help of active sports programme and to strenghten a preventive and educational significance of physical activities and to support cultural and instructional activities due to a tour around the spa town of Luhačovice situated in a beautiful countryside in the Bílé Karpaty and to taste the curative spa springs Vincentka, Amandka, Ottovka, dr.Šťastný.Students will get a great emocional experience of an active move thanks to the programme.
TEACHER_INFO:
https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/zamestnanci/
    https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/zamestnanci/ HOTEL Adamantíno *** LUHAČOVICE - POZLOVICE Nachází se u Luhačovického jezera Termín:6.-8.12. 2024/2noci Cena: 3.890,-Kč a zahrnuje: Ubytování na 2 noci ve dvoulůžkových nebo třílůžkových pokojích s polopenzí (snídaně formou bufetu) Vstup do bazénu je po celou dobu pobytu zdarma Cvičení Wellness Fit program. Přihlášení a platba do 30.10.2024 v Obchodním centru MU, http://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/ . Kapacita seminární skupiny je omezena, v případě většího počtu zájemců rozhoduje pořadí zápisu v OC MU. Závaznou přihlášku je třeba zaslat po zaplacení v OC na pokorna@fsps.muni.cz. Cvičení zahrnuje Wellness Fit program 12 lekcí x 90 min. 30 minut vířivky a 1x sauny Kulečník a stolní tenis je zdarma po celou dobu pobytu Co se děje: Katedra Univerzitní sportovní centrum nabízí pro studenty MU třídenní aktivní kurz Wellness Fit program. Cílem je seznámit studenty se základními principy zdravého životního stylu a podpořit jejich aktivní implementaci do každodenního života, dále umožnit studentům aktivně se zapojit do různých druhů cvičení, které jim pomohou harmonizovat fyzické i psychické schopnosti. Kurz zahrnuje lekce jogging, Total body work, Pilates, Body Balance, Fitness jógy, Relaxačního cvičení, Aqua aerobiku, Keep-fit, plavání, stolní tenis a základy tanečních aerobních aktivit. V případě pěkného počasí se zapojí inline bruslení (je třeba mít vlastní inline brusle). Dalším cílem je představit a ukázat tuto krásnou oblast formou komentované prohlídky lázeňského města Luhačovice ležícího v Bílých Karpatech a ochutnat místní léčivé prameny Vincentka, Amandka, Ottovka, dr.Šťastný. Cena NEZAHRNUJE: dopravu (způsob dopravy bude individuálně popsán a zaslán přihlášeným studentům společným e-mailem před zahájením kurzu), lázeňský poplatek 30,-Kč/1 dospělá osoba/1 noc (lázeňský poplatek se hradí na recepci hotelu). Přihláška a platba: formulář vyplňte, naskenujte a zašlete na adresu: pokorna@fsps.muni.cz. Pokud chcete vědět více, ptejte se lektorů: Mgr. Alena Koblížková, Ph.D. - koblizkova@fsps.muni.cz
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After finishing the course, the student will be able to: -Know-how with the new trends in exercise programs. -Perform self-complicated exercises based on functional chains, using proper posture and breathing -Have new experience of   locomotor Activities-Pilates, yoga, watercolor aerobics, core training, Nordic walking, metabolic and interval training, fit aerobic dance etc.

NAME: Cardio Dance
TEACHERS: Nováčková, D. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: - introduction of basic principles - mat exercise without sports equipment - exercise using special sports equipment - combination of various sports equipment
OBJECTIVES: Cardio Dance is a fitness workout to music that combines various aerobic and dance elements into a final choreography. The result of each class will be a new unique choreography to the rhythm of various songs. We will always start with a warm-up, learn basic steps and then move on to more complex variations, the more difficult steps will be adapted to the individual's ability. Finally, there will be a short strengthening of mainly the abdominal muscles and lower body and, last but not least, a thorough stretching of the whole body. The lesson is suitable for both beginners and advanced students, and for all age categories. It is focused on improving physical fitness, shaping the figure, but above all on the joy of movement. What to bring with you? Exercise clothes in which I feel comfortable, sports shoes, a towel, a drink, energy and a smile - with which you will mainly leave.

NAME: Self-defense course for women using pepper spray
TEACHERS: Reguli Čihounková, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: The self-defense course for women focuses on the practical use of pepper spray as a very commonly owned self-defense tool. The main goal of the course is to teach participants how to properly handle pepper spray and how to use it safely and effectively in case of danger. The course includes a theoretical part, which explains the principles of non-verbal and verbal self-defense, legal aspects of the application of necessary defense and possible scenarios of crisis situations. In the practical part, participants will then try out the principles of verbal and non-verbal self-defense, further master the basics of physical self-defense using pepper spray, and above all, try out model situations, where they will learn reactions to attacks and optimal techniques for quickly, effectively and assertively resolving situations that they will find themselves in within the model situations.
OBJECTIVES: The main goal of the course is to teach women how to use pepper spray. Sub-goals are to teach participants the basics of non-verbal, verbal and physical self-defense (simple strikes using pepper spray).
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is intended for women aged 18-55, without health restrictions.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation during the course.
TEACHER_INFO:
https://www.fsps.muni.cz/czv/nabidka/aktualne-nabizime

NAME: Basic personal self-defense course
TEACHERS: Reguli Čihounková, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: This is a course on the basics of personal self-defense, which will include an introduction to the basic principles and techniques of self-defense, including prevention, verbal de-escalation of conflict, effective stance techniques, and basic ground fighting techniques.
OBJECTIVES: The Basics of Personal Self-Defense course is designed for anyone who wants to improve their personal safety and self-confidence in potentially dangerous situations. Participants will learn the basic principles and techniques of self-defense, including verbal de-escalation of conflict, effective stance techniques, or basic ground fighting techniques. The emphasis will be on prevention, recognizing dangerous situations, and psychological aspects of self-defense, such as managing fear and stress. The course combines theoretical knowledge with practical exercises that allow participants to apply the learned skills in a safe environment.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Adults.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation in the course.
TEACHER_INFO:

LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course, participants will be equipped with the knowledge and skills needed to effectively respond to both potential and real threats and increase their level of personal security.

NAME: Self-defense for women with a focus on sexual harassment
TEACHERS: Reguli Čihounková, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: Women's self-defense forms a separate chapter of self-defense, especially because women are much more often exposed to the risk of sexual or domestic violence. Given the physiological and psychological differences between women and men, it is important to emphasize prevention, strengthening self-confidence and effective verbal communication, in which women excel. These skills help reduce the risk of physical conflict, but do not completely eliminate it. In cases of conflict escalation, it is necessary to recognize warning signs and respond to them quickly and effectively. The program focuses on women's self-defense with an emphasis on the issue of sexual harassment, which will be introduced to participants in a ten-hour course. It combines theoretical knowledge and practical skills. The first part of the program will emphasize prevention, strengthening self-confidence, effective verbal communication and expanding knowledge about the issue of sexual harassment. The second part of the program will begin with an explanation of the legal concept and necessary defense, which will provide participants with an overview of the legal aspects of acting in crisis situations. This theoretical part will be followed by practical training in physical self-defense and defensive techniques, for example using improvised weapons, where participants will learn effective ways to confront an attacker, even with the help of commonly available objects. In the final phase, the course will deal with the post-conflict phase, ensuring safety and seeking help. Finally, participants will try applying the acquired knowledge and skills in solving model situations.
OBJECTIVES: They will expand their knowledge in the field of prevention, strategies and tactics of self-defense. They will expand their knowledge in the field of sexual harassment and its solution. They will acquire skills in basic technical means of self-defense They will become familiar with the possibilities of using common objects as defense tools They will understand the legal conditions of self-defense
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Women, age 18-60 years
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Solving the model situation

NAME: SELF-DEFENSE FOR ADULTS WITHOUT THE USE OF DEFENSE EQUIPMENT
TEACHERS: Reguli Čihounková, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: At the beginning of the course, we will deal with the theoretical part of the issue of self-defense, specifically the theory of self-defense and its legislation will be explained. The practical part of the course will begin with training in basic techniques, such as developing a basic self-defense stance and confident walking. The practical part will also include an analysis of correct communication in a conflict situation and the distance between the defender and the attacker during a potential conflict situation. We will also focus on specific self-defense techniques without the use of defensive aids, such as defensive techniques against grabs and holds. During the exercise, we will also focus on basic punching and kicking techniques. At the end of the course, the instructors will test the participants. Model situations will take place with a predetermined scenario and role distribution, thanks to which the instructors will evaluate how well the participants have mastered the techniques and methods that were shown to them during the course. Then, in the last phase of the self-defense course, a short discussion will take place and the instructors will have the opportunity to answer the participants' questions.
OBJECTIVES: Self-defense for adults without the use of defensive equipment, with the acquisition of basic technical means of self-defense and familiarization with its legal aspects. Getting to know the basic theory of self-defense and its legislation. Learning how to manage conflict situations and apply verbal and non-verbal communication during conflicts. Acquiring basic skills, mastering and practicing basic techniques of self-defense means.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: This course is open to people over 18 years of age without serious physical limitations.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Participation
TEACHER_INFO:
https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/aktual_CZV/

NAME: Basic self-defense course for everyone
TEACHERS: Reguli Čihounková, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: The self-defense course for adults focuses on acquiring the basic skills needed to protect one's own safety. Participants will first learn the theoretical foundations of self-defense, including legal aspects, and learn how to prevent risky situations through effective anticipation and preventive measures. The program also includes work with posture and correct posture, training in effective communication (verbal and non-verbal) and reactions to conflict situations. We will also focus on working with space, i.e. maintaining a safe distance between the defender and a potential attacker. In the practical part, participants will master basic techniques such as punches, kicks, grabs and holds, and practice defending against various attacks, including strangulation, grips or hugs. The course will conclude with model situations in which participants will try out the application of acquired skills in simulated conflict scenarios. The course concludes with an evaluation of the participants' performance and individual feedback, which will contribute to the further development of their self-defense skills.
OBJECTIVES: Understanding the theoretical foundations: To familiarize participants with the basic theory of self-defense and its legal aspects, including the possibilities and limits of defensive reactions according to applicable legislation. Conflict prevention: To learn to recognize risky situations, anticipate possible conflicts and adopt preventive measures to minimize them. Communication skills: To master verbal and non-verbal communication techniques to de-escalate conflicts and increase one's own safety. Practical self-defense skills: To master basic self-defense techniques, including stances, punches, kicks and reactions to the most common types of attacks, such as grabs, strangulation or hugging. Application of skills in practice: To try out model situations that simulate real conflict scenarios and learn to effectively apply the learned techniques in practice. Improving personal confidence and safety: To strengthen participants' self-confidence and their ability to adequately respond to potential threats in everyday life. Reflection and Feedback: Provide participants with individual feedback and evaluation of their performance so they can further develop their self-defense skills.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course can be attended by people over 18 years of age who do not have serious physical or mental limitations.
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/aktual_CZV/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Knowledge of self-defense theory and legal aspects: Understanding the basic principles of self-defense, including legal limits and obligations when defending in crisis situations. Correct communication and response in a conflict situation: The ability to choose effective verbal and non-verbal communication strategies to de-escalate the conflict and adequately respond during its course. Application of adequate procedures in self-defense situations: Correct use of learned techniques and procedures in simulated model situations, taking into account the nature of the conflict, the environment and the safety of all participants. Practical mastery of basic self-defense techniques: Successful mastery and use of basic defense skills, such as grips, punches, kicks and reactions to specific attacks. Active participation in the practical part of the course: Participation in exercises and model situations that test the ability to handle conflict scenarios in practice. Feedback and Self-Reflection: The ability to evaluate one's own progress, receive feedback from tutors, and actively work to improve one's skills.

NAME: CORE TRAINING using balance equipment Bossa and Bosu®
TEACHERS: Koblížková, A. - Kostelníková, A. - Svobodová, Z. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: Syllabus: Posture and its importance for healthy movement Deep stabilization system and core Balance aids Exercise programs using the core Methodology and principles of proper exercise using balance sections Exercise repository
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the educational event is to use Bossa and Bosu® balance stretches in the training process within the framework of conditioning and compensatory training with a focus on the specific requirements of individual sports. CORE training, within the educational process of TV and sports training, develops movement abilities and skills based on the perception of one's own body. It emphasizes conscious control of one's own movement and maintaining correct technique, breathing, including correct body position. At the same time, it also shows the possibilities of using balance aids in the training process, especially in fitness training with a focus on the specific requirements of individual sports.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The subject is intended for pedagogical workers - direct pedagogical activity is carried out by: teacher, pedagogue in a facility for further education of pedagogical workers, tutor, special educator, psychologist, leisure educator, assistant educator, trainer, leading pedagogical worker. Completed secondary education.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: credit
TEACHER_INFO: https://is.muni.cz/obchod/fakulta/fsps/aktual_CZV/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Using the CORE exercise program to achieve improved balance between the muscular systems of the postural and phasic chains, improve movement stereotypes, conditioning and coordination skills, and eliminate the risk of injury. Basic terminology of physical exercises, basic anatomy and physiology of physical exercises. Concentration, control, breathing, flow, precision, core. -Theoretical basis - healthy movement and correct posture, position of individual segments of the musculoskeletal system, explanation of the terms deep stabilization system (HSS) and core (center of the body). Introduction to balance aids Bossa and Bosu®, health aspects of exercise and core activation in kinetic chains, specifics of exercise programs using balance aids in core training, basics of first aid. -Practical basis - methodological and didactic principles of exercise programs using core and balance sections (slow forms of the so-called Body and Mind - new forms of relaxation and release, static and dynamic balance exercises). Use of core in the training process of various sports and fitness (cardiovascular aerobic training, strength training, strengthening of stabilizing muscles, flexibility training). Possibilities of fitness training, especially for the development of fitness and coordination skills in the preparatory training period, e.g. for volleyball, basketball, hockey, football and other sports).

NAME: Promotion of Social and Emotional Skills Through Outdoor Activities

Support the Implementation of OAE in the School Curriculum Provide practical guidance on integrating outdoor activities into teaching. Introduce the Model Curriculum Template for OAE and its potential adaptations based on the specific needs of schools and teachers. Develop Teachers' Skills in Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) through Outdoor Education Help teachers understand how outdoor activities promote self-regulation, collaboration, and students' emotional intelligence. Demonstrate how SEL can be used to support inclusive education and prevent mental health issues. Empower Teachers to Apply OAE Methodology in Practice Provide access to Open Educational Resources (OER) developed within the project. Enable the exchange of experiences and collaboration among teachers through workshops, seminars, and community platforms. Disseminate Research Findings and Policies on OAE and SEL Present research study outcomes and their practical implications for education. Discuss possibilities for teacher certification in OAE within the European context. Support Teachers’ Lifelong Learning in Innovative Teaching Methods Help teachers develop pedagogical competencies focused on innovative teaching methods. Promote a multidisciplinary approach to physical education and personal development. Connect Key Educational Stakeholders for the Broader Implementation of OAE Engage not only teachers but also educational institutions, policymakers, and experts in physical education.

NAME: Specialization Coaching 2 - Track and Field
TEACHERS: Cacek, J. - Hlavoňová, Z. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS:
Gist:
    1. Introduction to the subject Specialization Track and Field II.
    2. The structure of sports perfomance of triple jump.
    3. Methods of training of triple jump
    4. The structure of sports perfomance of pole vault
    5. Methods of training of pole vault
    6. The structure of sports perfomance of shot put and hammer throw
    7. Methods of training of shot put and hammer throw
    8. The structure of sports perfomance of javelin
    9. Methods of training of javelin
    10. The structure of sports perfomance of discus throw
    11. Methods of training of discus throw
    12. Training of youth.
    13. Searching literature, the strukture of seminar work
    14. Written exam.
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of subject Track and Field II is to provide theoretical knowledge about the structure of sports perfomance, technique and methodological procedures and training practical skills:
    horizontal, vertical jumps and throwing events. (pole vault, triple jump, javelin, shot put, discus throw, hammer throw).
    The another aim is provide theoretical knowledge about specifics of children and youth training.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exam is awarded based on student successfully passing the final written test and the active participate in lessons. (90%). Test is consists from 20 questions. (a, b, c), Evaluation: 20-19p.-A, 18p. - B, 17p. -C, 16p. - D, 15p. -E. Studnets will prepare seminar work to analyze determine factor of the structure of sports perfomance concrete events. (30 min.)
TEACHING_METHODS: Teaching will take the form of lectures in the classroom and practical exercises at the athletic stadium and the gym.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After successful completion of the subject Track and Field Specilization II student will be able to:
    define and describe the structure of sports perfomance of vertical, horizontal jumps and throwing events,
    manage the correct technique of jumping and throwing events,
    analyze the most occuring mistakes in technique of mentioned events,
    to lead the training of children, youth and adults.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Coaching Specialization 1 - Rhythmic Gymnastics
TEACHERS: Kapounková, K. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS:
Characteristics of modern gymnastics
    History of Rhythmic Gymnastics in the Czech Republic and the World
    Organization and system of Rhythmic gymnastics - the hierarchy of organs and commissions of the RG in the Czech Republic
    Sports training in Rhythmic gymnastics (diagnostics of motion systems)
    Theory and didactics of acrobatics
    Theory and Didactics of Classical Dance (terminology)
    Musical Motion Education (music function in   MG)
    Nomenclature of Rhythmic gymnastics (exercise without tools and tools)
    Development of physical abilities in modern gymnastics (strength, speed, endurance)
OBJECTIVES: Graduates will acquire knowledge of the history and development of rhythmic gymnastics, will be oriented in the basic terminology of exercise without tools, tools and classical dance. Graduates of the subject will be oriented in the program and system of competitions of the Czech Republic.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Visiting classes is compulsory. In the framework of the seminar the student graduates: - practical methodical output focused on classical ballet techniqueSeminar work -training plan - a written test. The written test will consist of   30 questions rated 30 points. To achieve successful mastery, you need to achieve at least 23 points.

Graduates will be able to:
    1, classify the competitor, according to the achieved sport performance and age in the relevant competition category
    2, to name out the basic positions and movements of both idleness and exercise with individual tools
    3, methodically lead a basic ballet training unit and a training unit focused on the development of physical abilities
    4, choose the right musical accompaniment, taking into account the specifics of the individual instruments, but also the temperament of the gymnast

NAME: Coaching Specialization 1 - Ice Hockey
TEACHERS: Konečný, J. - Nykodým, J. - Bučková, L.
SYLLABUS: Organization, rules: basic rules, competitive order, terminology, organization of competitions, coach qualification, technical equipment, ice hockey systematic – basic organization – ice skating, game skills of an individual – attacking and defensive
OBJECTIVES: To acquire basics of ice hockey To get used to t ice hockey systematic – ice skating techniques, game skills of an individual – defensive and attacking.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: A student should be interested in ice hockey and should have his own practical experience as a player.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Credit – written test and practical performance on the ice rink Exercise. Requirements for credit: 100% active attendance. Passing written test on theory and didactics of ice hockey and its rules. Realization of methodological output on given theme in a pupils’ category. Writing and submitting a seminar work on given topic.
TEACHER_INFO: https://www.fsps.muni.cz/czv/nabidka/nabidka-pro-studenty-mu
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: A student will be able to: - set basic rules and competitive order; propose suitable equipment for young players; to describe and utilize in the practical part – ice hockey systematic/ice skating techniques, game skills of an individual player – defence and attack – it concerns basic organization, management and explanation of game which consists of both individual and team actions and is subjected to the coach instructions. - ice skating – basic motor skill Forward movement, stopping forward movement, arc movement, forward cross-over, backward movement, stopping backward movement, backward cross-over, turns, starts, dexterity skating, techniques, power skating... HČJ – individual skill connected with a particular game task... HČJ – attacking: freeing the player with the puck, passing and work with the pass, freeing the player without the puck, shooting, deception and faking HČJ defensive: Occupy the player with the puck, occupy the player without the puck, defence of the area, puck poking, striking the bottom part of the stick, clear the puck, stick press Other activities Throw in A. techniques, systematic -/ shot forward, forhend, beckend, backward - forhend, beckend B. Tactics

NAME: Coaching Practice 1
TEACHERS: Bokůvka, D. - Kapounková, K. - Bučková, L.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: TRF, TRBL, IBU, TRA, TRP, TRZ, TRBD, TRBU, TRAD, TRBA, TRCY, TRSG, TRFB, TRAT, TMG, TRK, TRLH, TRVO, TRKR, TRBO, TRPL, TRZA, TRB, TRV, TRAL, TRMG, TRBI
SYLLABUS: Based on their specialization and with the agreement of the head of the specialization, the students are assigned to sport clubs in which they observe training and exercise sessions. The students‘ practice consists of 26 lessons, i.e. 13 ninety-minute training units. As a part of their practice students will learn how to use electronic training diaries and how to record and evaluate the content of training sessions and cycles in the diaries. All depending on their corresponding specialization.
OBJECTIVES: • The students will learn the basic administration and functioning of the sport facilities; they will get acquainted with organizational and methodical duties with regard to the hierarchy within the organization. • The students will learn practical coaching, exercise, and didactic skills under the guidance of experienced coaches and trainers (appointed and confirmed by the guarantor of the specialization) • The students will observe training sessions and exercise lessons. • The students will work with selected training diaries and they will learn how to use them.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Complete the course coaching specialization II
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The students will submit a record of their attendance of the training sessions (13 pieces, each 90 min).
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/tmp1/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: The studens will be able to: • prepare and run training sessions and exercise sessions following their consultation with coaches and trainers • run training sessions and exercise sessions under the guidance of assigned trainers • analyze training units and exercise sessions • work with selected electronic training diaries
LITERATURE:

NAME: Coaching Practice 2
TEACHERS: Bokůvka, D. - Kapounková, K. - Bučková, L.
FIELDS_OF_STUDY: TRF, TRBL, IBU, TRA, TRP, TRZ, TRBD, TRBU, TRAD, TRBA, TRCY, TRSG, TRFB, TRAT, TMG, TRK, TRLH, TRVO, TRKR, TRBO, TRPL, TRZA, TRB, TRV, TRAL, TRMG, TRBI
SYLLABUS: Based on their specialization, the students are assigned to sport clubs in which they run training and exercise sessions under the guidance of coaches and trainers. The students’ practice consists of 26 lessons per semester, each lesson per 45 min, which corresponds to thirteen 90 minute units. The students prepare a training plan of their whole practice and they record in detail the process of all training sessions. In order to complete their task successfully they make use of the knowledge they gained in the course Practice in Coaching Metodology I in which they learnt how to use the electronic Training Diaries. By means of self-study, the students learn the basic function of the software program Dartfish. A handbook, including the user’s guide video is available on-line (e-learning based). The students will then complete their tasks with the use of their own recordings or the recordings from the video database containing match or competition shots or partial shots of individual sports. The students will be given access to the software program Dartfish. They will further learn the functions of Garmin sport testers and Polar system and how to use them to plan training process. Students will be able to borrow sport testers. Study materials will be e-learning based. A seminar session will be conducted to acquaint the students with the Polar system use.
OBJECTIVES: • The students will improve and extend their practical coaching, exercise, and didactic skills under the guidance of experienced coaches and trainers (appointed and confirmed by the guarantor of the specialization) • The students will enhance their practical knowledge gained in the the course Practice in Coaching Methodology I • They will prepare and run training sessions following their consultation with coaches and trainers. • They will analyze training units and exercise sessions. • They will be acquainted with the Dartfish system. • They will learn how to use Garmin sport testers • They will learn about the functions of Polar team system II in the seminar sessions.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Complete the course coaching methodical practice I
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The students will submit a record of their attendance of the training sessions (13 pieces, each 90 min). The students will sumbit the analysis of selected activities in the Dartfish system. The students will submit the analysis of selected training session with the use of Garmin sport tester. The students will participate in the seminar session devoted to the use of Polar Team II system.
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/tmp2/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: The students will be able to: • prepare and run training sessions and exercise sessions following their consultation with coaches and trainers • run training sessions and exercise sessions under the guidance of assigned trainers • analyze training units and exercise sessions • work with the Dartfish system • work with Garmin sport testers • use Polar team II system
LITERATURE:

NAME: Physical education - Floorball on electric wheelchairs
TEACHERS: Zvonek, A.
SYLLABUS: Warm-up, individual practice of game techniques and skills, game tactics and controlled play.
OBJECTIVES: Electric wheelchair floorball is a relatively young sport discipline that allows players with more severe disabilities to participate in the highest possible degree of safety. It is one of the few action sports activities for this group of people. The sporting activity is more oriented towards technique and teamwork than physical performance, but the social impact of this collective sport is not negligible.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is included in the compulsory part of the physical education curriculum. It is required to have an electric wheelchair.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Seminar, credit - credit is awarded to students for attendance: the maximum allowed absence is 25% of the volume of teaching hours, substitution of additional absences is possible in the examination period.
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical exercises (practicing movement on the court, ball management, match play), basic theoretical training (rules and tactics of the game) including the use of match records at national and international level.
TEACHER_INFO:
https://www.teiresias.muni.cz/vzdelavani-sport-a-volny-cas/sportovni-aktivity/alternativni-kurzy-telesne-vychovy/
    Informace k výuce TV najdete na www.fsps.muni.cz - celouniverzitní TV. Výuku předmětu p906 zajišťuje Středisko pro pomoc studentům se specifickými nároky ve spolupráci s Rolling lions Brno z.s. (https://rolling-lions-brno---tym-powerchair-hockey.webnode.cz) Nutný je vlastní elektrický vozík.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon completion of the course, the student will be able to: master the basic skills of electric wheelchair floorball (such as smooth driving of the electric wheelchair and basic movement on the court, ball management), have an understanding of the tactics of the game and team cooperation, know the terminology and rules of the game.

NAME: Physical activity - Showdown for students with visual impairment
TEACHERS: David, P.
SYLLABUS: Theoretical training: - acquaintance with the history of the sport, - acquaintance with player categories, and national and international contests, - safety rules of the sports activity. Practical training: - acquaintance with sporting equipment and its use (protector pads, blindfolds, paddles and rattling balls, - warm-up exercise, - limbering-up exercise, - basic playing skills (holding the paddle, orientation and movement in the playing field - in front of the goal area, basic batting hits, control - stopping the ball, serve practice), - playing skills development (attack techniques practice, defense practice), - cooperation of players in doubles, - matches - singles and doubles.
OBJECTIVES: The main objective of the course: - the improvement of the locomotive abilities and fitness; - the support of students' healthy lifestyle, - acquaintance with the environment, sporting equipment, and theoretical basics of the sports discipline (rules, commands, categories, contests), - safety rules of the game, practical sporting skills and their development.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course belongs to the part of the PE subject which needs to be paid for.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exercise, credit - the credit is given to students for the attendance. 3 classes can be misses and there is no need of any apology. The substitution of more absences is not allowed.

NAME: Swimming for Disabled Students
TEACHERS: Sommer, J.
SYLLABUS: 1. Practice of basic swimming skills - the postion on the back / on the stomach, floating, breathing into the water with one's mouth and face under the surface. 2. Practice of swimming styles (dolphin, backstroke, breaststroke and frint crawl) with the help of technical practice. 3. Practice of secondary swiming skills - starts, flip turns, continuous swimming and speed swimming
OBJECTIVES: Swimming is an apt form of rehabilitation for persons with limited motoric abilities. Swimming as a possible way of motoric learning and of keeping fit. Swimming in a group as an opportunity to meet, make social contacts and communicate. Swimming without any equipment as a unique freedom of independent movement.

ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exercise, credit - the credit is given to students for the attendance. 3 classes can be misses and there is no need of any apology. The substitution of more absences is not allowed.

NAME: Futsal for Blind Students
TEACHERS: Carcouët, J. - Banovský, O. - Bukovský, T. - Duda, M. - Moravec, A. - Vaďura, V. - Hladíková, J.
SYLLABUS:
After first introduction to the game and its rules the students adapt to the place where the sessions are held, they get to know the disposition of a building and a gym hall in it. Then they should practise following skills important especially for the blind sportsmen:
    1. spatial orientation,
    2. training of different kinds of movement and running,
    3. using of voice navigation to minimize collisions between two blind persons and to gain an idea about space and disposition of the play ground,
    4. different controlling a ball - passing it, dribbling it, shooting,
    5. discussion about tactics and its training,
    6. team cooperation.
OBJECTIVES: The main goals of the educational process include: - the improvement of the locomotive abilities and fitness - the impact on the positive approach towards sports activities considered as the protection against conflicts, civilization diseases and stress - the support of students healthy lifestyle Futsal for the blind is one of the paralympic sports and has the rules given by the International Blind Sports Federation (IBSA). In the introductory session the students get to know these rules as far as an explanation of all the necessary information about safety in training sessions and the game itself. Then they, as the blind sportsmen, should learn and practise the most important skills which are different from those ones for the sighted players: as spatial orientation, communication with their colleagues and navigators, controlling a ball etc. In the end of a period they should be prepared for starting with the game itself.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course is geared for paid PE only.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exercise, credit - the credit is given to students for the attendance. 3 classes can be misses and there is no need of any apology. The substitution of more absences is not allowed.
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.teiresias.muni.cz/cz/vzdelavani-sport-a-volny-cas/sportovni-aktivity/alternativni-kurzy-telesne-vychovy
    Informace k výuce TV najdete na www.fsps.muni.cz - celouniverzitní TV. Výuku předmětu p931 zajišťuje Středisko pro pomoc studentům se specifickými nároky (Středisko Teiresiás). Webové stránky futsalu pro nevidomé: http://www.avoymubrno.cz. V měsících září, říjen, duben, květen probíhá výuka na venkovním hřišti.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course, the students will: understand and acquire the basic game skills individual players need to have be able to work in a team to perform well in team sports become familiar with the rules of the game

NAME: Dancing for Visually Impaired Students
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Carcouët, J.
SYLLABUS: The course contains the rhythmic practice,the isolation of the movement of particular body parts and their harmonization, posture training, dancing technique practice: walk, run, jumps, turns. Further it deals with improvisation techniques, floowork, creativity, and training of short dancing combinations formed with acquired techniques.
OBJECTIVES: The main goals of the educational process involve: - the improvement of the locomotive abilities and fitness - the impact on the positive approach towards sports activities considered as the protection against conflicts, civilization diseases and stress - the support of students healthy lifestyle The course introduces dancing techniques: country,folk, jazz, rock-n-roll, steppe, M.Graham and J.Limon techniques, choreography and improvisation. The course will be complemented by elements of practice of correct posture, removal and prevention of muscle imbalance, strengthening and stretching.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The course belongs to the part of the PE subject which needs to be paid fo.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exercise, credit - the credit is given to students for the attendance + studetns present a short dancing combination. 3 classes can be misses and there is no need of any apology. The substitution of more absences is not allowed.
TEACHING_METHODS: Physical motoric activity. Tasks for self-study: study of recommended literature Monitors tasks: week in the credit

NAME: Kinanthropology
TEACHERS: Reguli, Z.
SYLLABUS: 1. Scientific terminology (science, hypothesis, theory, methods, paradigm, ...) 2. Evolution of science (ancient science, science in the Middle Ages, scientific revolution and modern science, contemporary science: neo-positivism, K. Popper, S. Kuhn, P. Feyerabend, ...) 3. Systematics of science and classification of kinanthropology 4. Development and concept of kinesiology 5. Development and concept of kinanthropology 6. Subject of kinanthropology (sport, physical activity, movement art, movement recreation, physical rehabilitation, physical education, ...) 7. Kinanthropology as a science, subdisciplines of kinanthropology 8. Kinanthropological professions 9. Ethics in Kinanthropology (mission of kinanthropology, ethics of physical activities, research and kinanthropology professions, ethical codes and commissions (Ethical Committee for Research at MU )) 10. Kinanthropological organizations
OBJECTIVES: A compulsory course of Kinanthropology is an introduction to the study of this scientific discipline. The aim is to build a knowledge base in the whole range of kinanthropological research.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: oral examination
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/kinantropologie/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the course students will be able to
    - use scientific terminology
    - understand the development of scientific thinking
    - to formulate research questions in the field of kinanthropology based on different paradigms
    - distinguish subject and theory of kinanthropology, kinesiology, sports sciences, and other related disciplines
    - to evaluate the subject of kinanthropology based on the broad knowledge
    - define different dimensions of kinanthropology as a science
    - to analyze and defend a wide range of kinanthropological professions
    - understand and share ethical principles in kinanthropology
    - include their own research topic in subdisciplines of kinanthropology
LITERATURE:
HAMILTON, Nancy, Wendi WEIMAR a Kathryn LUTTGENS. Kinesiology : scientific basis of human motion. 12th ed. New York, N.Y.: McGraw-Hill, 2012, xv, 622. ISBN 9780071086431. info
        KLAVORA, Peter. Introduction to kinesiology : a sociocultural and behavioral perspective. Toronto: Kinesiology Books Publisher, 2010, ix, 342. ISBN 9780920905319. info
        KLAVORA, Peter. Introduction to kinesiology : a biophysical perspective. Toronto: Sport Books Publisher, 2009, ix, 418. ISBN 9780920905272. info

NAME: Quantitative Research Methodology
TEACHERS: Zháněl, J. - Prof. Alexander Ferrauti - Prof. Erich Muller
SYLLABUS:
General structure of scientific work
    Quantitative / qualitative research
    Research options (methods)
    Research problem, research question
    Research objective, hypotheses
    Research Methods (Measurement Procedures)
    Statistical Data Analysis
OBJECTIVES: Learning outcomes of the course unit The aim of the course is to acquaint students with basic principles and characteristics of quantitative research, to identify differences between quantitative and qualitative approaches and to enable students to orientate themselves in quantitative research methods necessary to create their own project.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Prerequisites and co-requisites Basic orientation in methodology of quantitative final thesis and methods of statistical data processing at the dissertation level.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Exam: oral defense of a quantitative research project, project evaluation in terms of structure and content, written test.
TEACHING_METHODS: Block seminar, text work, group teaching, project teaching, e-learning
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/metodologie-kvantitativniho-vyzkumu/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Upon successful completion of this course, students should be able to characterize and apply (1) basic concepts: science, scientific research, types of research, scientific work, structure of scientific work, literary research, etc. (2) To develop a project of quantitative research in accordance with methodological principles, to adequately use data analysis methods (descriptive and analytical statistical methods).

NAME: Anthropomotorics and sports anthropology
TEACHERS: Čuta, M. - Zvonař, M.
SYLLABUS: Human motorics and its characters Motor skills and skills - new knowledge Motodiagnostics - methods, examples 1. Fundamentals of human motorics, essence of motor abilities and skills with videomaterials during motor learning of chosen skill. 2. Video materials demonstrating the development of selected skills during ontogenesis. 3. Motodiagnostics, processing of research measurements. Examples of new test batteries and demonstration of the latest instruments for laboratory measurement of motor manifestations. 4. Properties of motor tests, video material verification of reliability and objectivity of motor tests. 5. Seminars to students' projects with their presentations. sp.antr. 1. Introduction to sports anthropology. 2. Relationship between somatic development and motor performance. 3. Impacts of physical stress on somatic development. 4. Anthropometry - basic indicators and their evaluation. Reference values. 5. Weight and height, relevant indices 6. Body height in children - development and its evaluation relative to age, sexual differences. Growth disorders - low and high growth - familial and pathogenic factors. Bone growth and physical load. 7. Length and circumferential parameters of hull and limbs, respective indices. 8. Body composition - definitions, models, methods of body components determination (Pařízková, Matiegka, electroimpedance methods BodyStat and * InBody). 9. Somatotype (Shledon, Heath and Carter) 10. Biological age - "proportional age", development of sexual signs, dentition, skeletal maturity (TW20 method). Sexual differences. 11. Prediction of final body height - indications, methods, reliability and accuracy. 12. Specific anthropological issues of selected sports - optimal somatic parameters, selection of talented youth for intensive preparation for state representation
OBJECTIVES: Learning outcomes of the course unit The aim of the course is to provide students with advanced information about motor skills, motor skills and to introduce: - definition of different authors, relations and intersection of individual ss. - motor learning - theory, examples of video projections. - movement skills, movement programs according to Schmidt, production of motor skills. - motor test properties. - motor ontogenesis, examples of video projections from different ages. - Demonstration of modern instrumentation for diagnostics of motor abilities - anthropomotoric disposition of athletes and methods of their identification
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Knowledge of anthropomotorics and anatomy in the scope of bachelor and master studies of TVS
ASSESMENT_METHODS: written test, oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Block seminar with video clips, student presentations, E-learning material
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/antropomotorika-ka6/
    http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/sportovni-antropologie/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: To deepen the knowledge of the fundamentals of human motor skills, motor skills and skills. The peculiarities of "production of movement skills" according to Schmidt theory "(using a foreign expert). To know the development of motor skills in ontogenesis. To deepen the knowledge of motodiagnostics and to process the results of research measurements, to verify the properties of motor tests. The seminar will discuss with students the peculiarities of their projects in terms of anthropomotorics. At the end of the course the student will be able to explain the essence of motor skills, peculiarities in the production of motor skills and their development by motor learning. They will be able to correctly process and interpret the results of research measurements. SPORT.ANTR. Students will understand the anthropometric dispositions of athletes. Students know basic anthropometric methods of examination of athletes. Students should be able to interpret the results of a standard anthropometric examination of an athlete. They are able to apply their knowledge in the realization of their dissertation. Students will be able to plan, perform and evaluate anthropometric measurements in research projects using state-of-the-art equipment.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Biomechanics of human
TEACHERS: Kasović, M. - Zvonař, M.

Examples of the use of various kinematic and dynamic methods in statics and dynamics of human intentional movement, in sports activities, etc. 7. Methods of biomechanical research results evaluation 8. Possible results in pedagogical theory and practice

LEARNING_OUTCOMES: To ensure that the student is able to: - understand and explain the patterns of empirical methods, the essence of the experiment in the general and specific biomechanical plane; - apply biomechanical methods in experimental research of synergistic biological-physical systems; - to draw adequate conclusions for biomechanical theories and practices; - predict the area under investigation (performance, abilities) - create new hypotheses and new research conclusions

NAME: Philosophy of sports
TEACHERS: Hurych, E.
SYLLABUS:
Introduction to the narrower approach to the topic of philosophical kinanthropology (sphere of interests, the most prominent contemporary world and Czech representatives, the most significant organizations and events, professional journals and monographs).
    Philosophical kinanthropology, socio-cultural kinanthropology and other related disciplines.
    Body, corporeality and human movement.
    Faust’s question in the world of sport.
    Recreology, non-performance-focused sphere of movement and its philosophical anchoring.
    Arete, kalokagathia, Olympism.
    Spirituality of movement.
    Ethical aspects of sport and movement.
    Other philosophical aspects of the contemporary society within its relationship to sport and movement.
    Philosophical framework of dissertation and possible approaches to it.

NAME: Kinanthropology
TEACHERS: Reguli, Z.
SYLLABUS: 1. Scientific terminology (science, hypothesis, theory, methods, paradigm, ...) 2. Evolution of science (ancient science, science in the Middle Ages, scientific revolution and modern science, contemporary science: neo-positivism, K. Popper, S. Kuhn, P. Feyerabend, ...) 3. Systematics of science and classification of kinanthropology 4. Development and concept of kinesiology 5. Development and concept of kinanthropology 6. Subject of kinanthropology (sport, physical activity, movement art, movement recreation, physical rehabilitation, physical education, ...) 7. Kinanthropology as a science, subdisciplines of kinanthropology 8. Kinanthropological professions 9. Ethics in Kinanthropology (mission of kinanthropology, ethics of physical activities, research and kinanthropology professions, ethical codes and commissions (Ethical Committee for Research at MU )) 10. Kinanthropological organizations
OBJECTIVES: A compulsory course of Kinanthropology is an introduction to the study of this scientific discipline. The aim is to build a knowledge base in the whole range of kinanthropological research.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: oral examination
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/kinantropologie/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the course students will be able to
    - use scientific terminology
    - understand the development of scientific thinking
    - to formulate research questions in the field of kinanthropology based on different paradigms
    - distinguish subject and theory of kinanthropology, kinesiology, sports sciences, and other related disciplines
    - to evaluate the subject of kinanthropology based on the broad knowledge
    - define different dimensions of kinanthropology as a science
    - to analyze and defend a wide range of kinanthropological professions
    - understand and share ethical principles in kinanthropology
    - include their own research topic in subdisciplines of kinanthropology
LITERATURE:

NAME: Anthropomotorics and Sports Anthropology
TEACHERS: Zvonař, M.
SYLLABUS: Human motorics and its characters Motor skills and skills - new knowledge Motodiagnostics - methods, examples 1. Fundamentals of human motorics, essence of motor abilities and skills with videomaterials during motor learning of chosen skill. 2. Video materials demonstrating the development of selected skills during ontogenesis. 3. Motodiagnostics, processing of research measurements. Examples of new test batteries and demonstration of the latest instruments for laboratory measurement of motor manifestations. 4. Properties of motor tests, video material verification of reliability and objectivity of motor tests. 5. Seminars to students' projects with their presentations. sp.antr. 1. Introduction to sports anthropology. 2. Relationship between somatic development and motor performance. 3. Impacts of physical stress on somatic development. 4. Anthropometry - basic indicators and their evaluation. Reference values. 5. Weight and height, relevant indices 6. Body height in children - development and its evaluation relative to age, sexual differences. Growth disorders - low and high growth - familial and pathogenic factors. Bone growth and physical load. 7. Length and circumferential parameters of hull and limbs, respective indices. 8. Body composition - definitions, models, methods of body components determination (Pařízková, Matiegka, electroimpedance methods BodyStat and * InBody). 9. Somatotype (Shledon, Heath and Carter) 10. Biological age - "proportional age", development of sexual signs, dentition, skeletal maturity (TW20 method). Sexual differences. 11. Prediction of final body height - indications, methods, reliability and accuracy. 12. Specific anthropological issues of selected sports - optimal somatic parameters, selection of talented youth for intensive preparation for state representation
OBJECTIVES: Learning outcomes of the course unit The aim of the course is to provide students with advanced information about motor skills, motor skills and to introduce: - definition of different authors, relations and intersection of individual ss. - motor learning - theory, examples of video projections. - movement skills, movement programs according to Schmidt, production of motor skills. - motor test properties. - motor ontogenesis, examples of video projections from different ages. - Demonstration of modern instrumentation for diagnostics of motor abilities - anthropomotoric disposition of athletes and methods of their identification
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Knowledge of anthropomotorics and anatomy in the scope of bachelor and master studies of TVS
ASSESMENT_METHODS: written test, oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Block seminar with video clips, student presentations, E-learning material
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/antropomotorika-ka6/
    http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/sportovni-antropologie/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: To deepen the knowledge of the fundamentals of human motor skills, motor skills and skills. The peculiarities of "production of movement skills" according to Schmidt theory "(using a foreign expert). To know the development of motor skills in ontogenesis. To deepen the knowledge of motodiagnostics and to process the results of research measurements, to verify the properties of motor tests. The seminar will discuss with students the peculiarities of their projects in terms of anthropomotorics. At the end of the course the student will be able to explain the essence of motor skills, peculiarities in the production of motor skills and their development by motor learning. They will be able to correctly process and interpret the results of research measurements. SPORT.ANTR. Students will understand the anthropometric dispositions of athletes. Students know basic anthropometric methods of examination of athletes. Students should be able to interpret the results of a standard anthropometric examination of an athlete. They are able to apply their knowledge in the realization of their dissertation. Students will be able to plan, perform and evaluate anthropometric measurements in research projects using state-of-the-art equipment.

NAME: Sports Pedagogy

SYLLABUS: - Sports Pedagogy in the System of Science. - The Conception of Sports Pedagogy and Physical Education. - Educational, Psychological, Sociological and Philosophical Determination of Sports Pedagogy. - Concept and Content of Sports Pedagogy (Slovakia, German, USA, CZ). - Empirical and Normative Concept of Sports Pedagogy. - Research Methodology for Sports Pedagogy. - Basics Areas of Sport Education. - Aims of School Sports. - Educational Aspects of Recreational Sports. - Educational Problems of Competitive Sports. - Coach – Building a Coaching Career. - Research of Coaches. - Educational diagnostics in Sport Education. - Sport and Social Education. - Aims of Sport Education in the EU.
OBJECTIVES: The main objectives of the course are the following: mastering the professional terminology of sports pedagogy; understanding the humanistic concept of contemporary sports pedagogy; analysis of sports education; methodological aspects of sports pedagogy.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completed subject Sports pedagogy in a master's degree. If the course has not been completed, it is necessary to master its content – see subject np/nk2104 in the IS, more information is available at http://www.fsps.muni.cz/~juva/PedSportu.htm.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: 1. Study of basic literature on sport pedagogy (Jansa et al., Svoboda, Sekot, Jūva). 2. Excerpt (18 000 characters) selected foreign publication on sport pedagogy (we recommend to specify it with the teacher). 3. Summary of the relationship between the dissertation and the pedagogy of sport (1 standard page). 4. Discussion on points in the course syllabus and on written materials (materials must be sent in advance in the electronic form to the teacher).
TEACHING_METHODS: Seminar, discussion groups, studies of the basic literature, project
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/pedagogika-sportu/
    Vážení studenti. Před vlastním kolokviem doporučuji využít osobní konzultaci, a to zvláště v případech, kdy nebyl absolvován předmět Pedagogika sportu v magisterském studiu. Je možno dále konzultovat elektronicky (např. o výběru zahraniční literatury pro excerptum). Vladimír Jůva
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course students should be able to: - understand and explain the modern trends of sports education; - interpret the result of the empirical researches of sports education; - analyze sports offers from various institutions; - evaluate sports education programs; - apply research methods of sports pedagogy.

NAME: Biomechanics of Human
TEACHERS: Zvonař, M.
SYLLABUS: 1. Basic patterns of living organisms and human mechanics 2. Muscle strength as the root cause of human movement 3. Synergetic relationships of biological and physical systems 4. Kinematic analysis and kinematic chains 5. Dynamic analysis 6. Examples of the use of various kinematic and dynamic methods in statics and dynamics of human intentional movement, in sports activities, etc. 7. Methods of biomechanical research results evaluation 8. Possible results in pedagogical theory and practice
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course will be to provide students with the knowledge of: - synergy of selected biological and physical systems of human movement, - complex relationships between mechanics and human movement, - empirical and theoretical schemes of biological and physical systems - advanced methods of human movement analysis
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: basic knowledge of biomechnical methods and physical laws
ASSESMENT_METHODS: seminar work written or oral exam
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/biomechanika-cloveka/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course students should be able to: - to recognize and understand the synergy of selected biological and physical systems of human movement, - Explain the complex relationships of mechanics and human movement -create empirical and theoretical schemes of biological and physical systems, and apply them in pedagogical practice - Using a foreign expert to ensure that students are able to: explain and apply basic biomechanical laws (on human movement, sports equipment, sports equipment and tools) to orientate in basic and combined methods of biomechanics
LITERATURE:
