        KLAVORA, Peter. Foundations of kinesiology : studying human movement and health. Toronto: Sport Book Publisher, 2008, xiii, 578. ISBN 9780920905074. info
        ACSM's advanced exercise physiology. Edited by Charles M. Tipton. Philadelphia: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2006, xi, 684. ISBN 0781747260. info
        GREENE, David Paul a Susan L. ROBERTS. Kinesiology : movement in the context of activity. 2nd ed. St. Louis: Elsevier-Mosby, 2005, xvi, 250. ISBN 0323028225. info

NAME: School Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J. - Jůva, V. - Sliacky, J. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
1. Development of the school as institution – historical perspective. Important school reforms. Role and functions of school in society. Theories of schooling. School as learning environment. Cooperation of school and society. School and other educational institutions (leisure time institutions, cultural institutions, sports institutions).
    2. School culture. School development. Safety in schools. Classroom. Classroom climate. Primary prevention: bullying, drug prevention, etc.
    3. Educational policy and curricular policy (Strategy of Educational Policy 2030+). Curricular documents (Framework Educational Programme, School Educational Programme). Aims of education. Curriculum. Content of education and content transformation.
    4. Instruction – theory and practice: designing, implementing, evaluating instruction. Setting instructional goals (cognitive, affective, psychomotoric). Blooms’ taxonomy of educational aims. Forms of classroom organisation. Phases of instruction. Didactical principles. Didactical tools and media. Quality of instruction.
    5. Teaching approaches and methods (definition, choice, categorisation, characteristics). Transmissive and constructivist teacher belief regarding teaching methods.
    6. Teacher (teaching profession, professional competencies, professional development, teachers’ belief, teaching style, reflective practitioner, teachers’ authority).
    7. Pupil (learning, learning theories, learning styles and strategies, students’ preconceptions, achievements, competencies). Homogeneity, heterogeneity, diversity among pupils. Motivation to learn. Discipline. Moral education.
    8. Classroom communication (forms, written communication, feedback).
    9. Pedagogical diagnostics (subject, process, categorization).
    10. Assessment of learning and of achievements (functions of assessment, forms of assessment). Assessment criteria. Formative assessme nt. Exams, marks / grades.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to provide orientation in important issues of school pedagogy and reflect these issues in school practice. Because this course is situated in 1. semester of Master study programme for teachers, its’ another aim is to initiate and support students when developing their professional competencies, which will be fostered in other pedagogical courses and during teaching practice.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: No prerequisites.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Completing particular tasks, mandatory attendance at the seminar teaching (absence from the seminar teaching block must be duly excused), preparing and presenting portfolio tasks, written test, oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, individual work, group work, discussion, role playing, simulation-based learning, problem solving. In on-line teaching, various applications for activating students will be used, oral/written feedback regarding individual tasks.
TEACHER_INFO: Výuka a veškeré informace k ukončení předmětu jsou součástí interaktivní osnovy předmětu. https://is.muni.cz/auth/el/fsps/podzim2024/nk4112/index.qwarp
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After finishing the course, students are able to characterise important historical milestones of the development of school as institution, to explain the role and functions of school in the society, to outline basic principles of educational policy and its reflection in the school practice. Further, students are able to reflect the influence of various factor on school culture, school climate and on safety in schools. Students are able to define the concept of curriculum and they can use their knowledge when they work with curriculum a when they design instruction. They are able to analyse lesson structure and its’ determinants. They are able to reason about criteria of instructional quality. They can classify methods of instruction and are able to propose, how to use methods in the school practice. Students acknowledge the teaching profession, professional development and (self)reflection. They are able to design instruction with regard to individual learning situation and achievements of pupils and of the whole class. They use descriptive language when they provide feedback to pupils. Students are able to differentiate various types of assessment and they reflect their strengths and weaknesses in the school practice.

NAME: Psychology for Teachers
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: - The subject of educational psychology, links with other disciplines, education - Relationship: development - maturation - learning - education - The learning process and its contexts - Effective learning, motivation - Emotions and conflict in the learning process - The student - parent - teacher relationship - Psychology of teaching (training), relationship to success and failure. Failure as a stressful situation - Learning styles and strategies, inclusive, parallel, separate educational environments - Basics of conflict mediation - Psychohygiene, stress, burnout syndrome - Basics of classroom/team work
OBJECTIVES: To broaden students' knowledge and skills needed for pedagogical practice in schools and leisure settings, with an emphasis on communication skills, effective conflict and emotionally challenging situations resolution, giving feedback and working with a team. All of this with consideration for the individuality and needs of others as well as one self's.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: there are no pre-requisits for the course
ASSESMENT_METHODS: - Group project - Final (written) test
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with IT information, seminars, self-learning.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: On completion of the course the learner will be able to - Describe the subject of educational psychology, its basic concepts and links with other disciplines. - Listen empathically to a person's feelings, identify their needs - Analyse and effectively resolve conflicts in the educational environment. - To evaluate in a reflective way one's own pedagogical practice and its impact on the individual. - Use role plays and thought experiments to enhance empathy and communication. - Use feedback to modify own teaching, as well as for personal growth. - Describe the signs of stress, burnout and basic work with them. - Understand the fundamentals of the mediation approach. - Describe the basics of group dynamics, its development and ways of influencing it.
LITERATURE:
Kohoutek, R. (1996). Základy pedagogické psychologie. Brno: Cerm.

NAME: Didactics of Physical Education
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J. - Jůva, V. - Sliacky, J.
SYLLABUS:
1. Didactics of Physical Education and its position in the structure of pedagogical sciences.
    2. Relationship of Didactics of Physical Education and some related scientific disciplines.
    3. Historical development of Physical Education as a school subject in Czech schools.
    4. Designing the curriculum of Physical Education at primary and secondary schools.
    5. Educational process in Physical Education.
    6. Teacher – pupil (student) interaction.
    7. Teaching activities of the teacher.
    8. Learning activities of the pupil (student).
    9. Evaluation of the results of the educational process.
    10. The environment and conditions of the educational process in Physical Education.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the Didactics of Physical Education is to systematically develop the prerequisites for effective planning, leadership, management and evaluation of the educational process of pupils in Physical Education. This main objective is gradually fulfilled by explaining the inclusion of Didactics of Physical Education in the field of pedagogy and general didactics and relations to other related scientific disciplines, by describing significant periods and moments of historical development of Physical Education, and above all by analyzing and interpreting the course of the educational process, its elements (pupil, teacher, curriculum, conditions of the education) and stages. Students are supported in the reflection of acquired knowledge and skills, their synthesis in solving problem situations and in the discussion of specific impacts on their own pedagogical activity.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completion of the course in the 1st semester Mgr. together with the subject Introduction to Pedagogical Practice.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
- mandatory attendance at the seminar teaching (absence from the seminar teaching block must be duly excused)
    - evaluation of partial outputs (written work, presentation output)
    - written test
    - oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS:
- lecture
    - seminar (group work, discussion, work with text, written work, presentation)
    - individual theoretical preparation

NAME: Theory and Didactics of Basketball and Volleyball
TEACHERS: Marek, O. - Vencúrik, T. - Vencúrik, T.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures from basketball and volleyball:
    - requirements for successful completion of the subject,
    - history,
    - rules,
    - systematics,
    - physical and physiological demands,
    - other forms of basketball and volleyball.

    Practical seminars from basketball and volleyball:
    - Methodological demonstrations of the students on the given topic.
OBJECTIVES:
The main objective of the course is to prepare students to lead the teaching unit in physical education classes of basketball and volleyball.
    Students will improve didactic principles and rules during the course by means of specified methodical demonstrations from the given sport.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS:
Students practically master the basketball and volleyball individual skills and understand the rules of the game.
    Obligatory completion of courses bp4015 and bp4010.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. 90% attendance.
    2. basketball and volleyball e-learning test.
    3. practical test from the given methodological demonstration.
    4. handing in the seminar work (preparation for teaching unit).
    The resulting mark will be determined on the basis of the individual parts.
TEACHING_METHODS:
Lecture
    Practical seminars (methodical demonstrations of students)
    Self-study
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/didaktika-basketbalu-a-volejbalu/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
When successfully completing the course, the student will be able to:
    - prepare a written form of the training unit,
    - to lead a teaching unit according to the correct didactic principles and rules,
    - to teach pupils of primary and secondary schools the basics of basketball and volleyball according to the methodical principles of given sports.

    Determinants swimming performance
    Development of swimming techniques.

    Water games
    Methodology training methods of swimming.
    Rules of swimming, planning teaching units in the water.
    First aid in school facilities.
OBJECTIVES: Students will acquire basic theoretical knowledge and practical skills of swimming sport from the point of view of its development, importance for human health, swimming education and the first aid from the point of view of their future pedagogical practice.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Basic swimming skills, techniques of swimming methods of breaststroke, backstroke and crawl.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
The course is completed after:
    - completion of the methodological output
    - submission of the final report on swimming lessons for preschool children
    - fulfilling the required attendance in practical and theoretical teaching
    - successful completion of the final exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical training in the form of exercises and theoretical lectures.

OBJECTIVES: The major aims of the subject are: to explain to students the importance of philosophical thinking, to develop their critical thinking ability and enable them to gain basic overview in the next major fields: philosophical groundings of sport and the importance for the questions of terminology, the problem of body and corporeality, olympism, recreology, ethical vissues in sport, spirituality of sport, the phenomenon of competition and philosophical aspects of health.

Min. 80% attendance in seminar lessons

    - essey about the selected topic
    - assesment interview (according to the situation)
TEACHING_METHODS: lectures, presentation of selected topics, homework, discussion.

NAME: Reflection on Practice 1
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J. - Novotná, A.
PREREQUISITES: předp. ( nk4111 || n4111 ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )
SYLLABUS:
1. Methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection of teaching (reflective model ALACT, reflective methodology 3A, case study, analysis of video of teaching).
    2. Procedural aspects of reflection and self-reflection (conditions, factors).
    3. Feedback and rules of its provision.
    4. Competence framework of the graduate teacher.
    5. Formulation of professional development objectives and setting of evaluation criteria.
OBJECTIVES: The main objective of the subject is to actively involve students in reflecting on the teaching or observed teaching and to develop their diagnostic, evaluative, self-assessment and communicative competences. The main objective is fulfilled through defining methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection, perceiving the procedural aspect of reflection and self-reflection, setting basic rules for giving feedback, and above all, having to concrete experience with reflective teaching.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: A prerequisite for enrolment in the subject is previous completion of n4111 Introduction to Teaching Practice. Since the subject is linked in content to the parallel pedagogical practice, it can be taken only if the student is also taking n4120 Pedagogical Practices 1.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Compulsory attendance at seminars, formative feedback within activities in the classroom and on the basis of the analysis of submitted documents, criterial evaluation.
TEACHING_METHODS: Discussion and dialogical methods, group teaching, independent work, brainstorming, critical thinking, video-based training.
TEACHER_INFO: Výuka probíhá v seminárních blocích, přičemž pro studující je povinná účast na každém takovém bloku výuky. Výuka a veškeré požadavky pro ukončení předmětu jsou uvedeny v interaktivní osnově předmětu. https://is.muni.cz/auth/el/fsps/jaro2025/nk4121/index.qwarp
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completion of the subject, students will:
    ­define the different methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection of teaching
    ­characterise the process aspects of reflection and self-reflection
    ­define the rules for giving feedback
    ­gives feedback in an appropriate way
    ­sets a specific objective for reflection and respects the necessary conditions for reflection, the factors involved and the necessary rules
    ­explain the importance of reflection for further professional development
    ­formulate objectives for their further professional development on the basis of reflection
    ­sets criteria for evaluating to fulfilling of their professional development objectives

NAME: Personal and Social Development
TEACHERS: Pačesová, P. - Soják, P. - Soják, P. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    1. Mature personality of the teacher as prerequisite for healthy development of pupils: self-concept.
    2. Communication – forms and influence. Manipulation in communication. Respectful communication. Descriptive language. Criteria for quality of instruction. Accountability and improvement. Formative assessment. Interview in difficult situation.
    3. Stress-management: stress and response in/to stress – body reaction in stress situation, eustress, distress, perception of stress; methods and instruments of stress-management.
    4. Teachers authority: definition of the concept, various forms of authority. Factors influencing authority. Developing authority.
    5. Time management: definition of the concept, task prioritising, setting goals (SMART), strategies for planning and executing activities.
    6. Experiential pedagogy – how to use in Physical Education.
    Course:
    1. introductory and self-experiencing activities
    2. group dynamics, working with teams
    3. timemanagement
    4. stressmanagement
    5. soft skills and development, SWOT analysis
    6. feedback and reflection
OBJECTIVES: At the theoretical level, the course aims to develop students’ knowledge of selected topics of personal and social development. It then acquaints students with specific tools that they can use in their professional development in connection with these topics. At the practical level, the goal is to develop students' personal and social competencies based on a thorough (self) reflection.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: completing tasks, creating portfolio, active participation during the course
TEACHING_METHODS: lecture, group work, individual work, discussion, role playing, simulation-based learning
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course, the student characterizes the essential components of personality. The student analyzes interpersonal communication and actively uses descriptive language. The student describes the body's response to stress and uses a suitable tool to manage it. It identifies the sources of natural authority and proposes appropriate solutions for natural authority development based on the analysis of practical examples. The student analyzes his time possibilities and organizes his time appropriately. The student identifies experiential pedagogy principles and chooses appropriate procedures with regard to the pedagogical situation/goal during group work. Within the course, he applies the acquired theoretical knowledge in model situations and reflects the chosen procedure.
LITERATURE:
NOVÁČKOVÁ, Jana a Dobromila NEVOLOVÁ. Respektovat a být respektován : cesta k sebeúctě a zodpovědnosti. Přepracované vydání. Praha: PeopleComm, 2020, 367 stran. ISBN 9788087917503. info

NAME: Theory and Didactics of Football, Ice-Hockey and Figure Skating
TEACHERS: Bokůvka, D. - Nykodým, J. - Bokůvka, D. - Lipčák, A. - Lipková, L. - Nykodým, J.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bp4028 || bk4028 || bp2251 || bk2251 || bp1251 || bk1251 && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_brus )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_fotbal )
SYLLABUS: Active participation in lessons, classification of metodics demonstration, written test.
OBJECTIVES: Lední hokej a krasobruslení: Student je po absolvování vzdělávací jednotky schopen definovat základní metodickou řadu bruslení a rozšířenou metodickou řadu bruslení, rozumí principům skladby vyučovací jednotky a umí sestavit didaktický výstup na zadané téma včetně praktické ukázky. Fotbal: hlavním cílem je, aby byl student seznámen se skladbou vyučovací jednotky v hodinách školní tělesné výchovy. Studentům je prezentováno, jak sestavit didaktický výstup, jak vhodně využívat jednotlivé didaktické formy vyučovacího procesu a zhodnotit herní výkon v utkání. Studenti jsou dále seznámeni se základními pravidly a principy řízení utkání ve fotbale.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Studenti ovládají praktické dovednosti ze základů bruslení a rozšířené didaktické řady bruslení, které budou ověřeny praktickým testem a mají teoretické znalosti z teorie fotbalu a ovládají praktické herní dovednosti z fotbalu. U fotbalu se konkrétně jedná o útočné a obranné herní činnosti jednotlivce a útočné a obranné herní kombinace, které budou ověřeny vstupním praktickým testem v první vyučovací hodině. Teoretické znalosti budou ověřeny písemným testem ještě před začátkem praktické výuky.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation in lessons, classification of metodics demonstration, written test
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/didaktika-fotbalu-ledniho-hokeje-krasobrusleni/

NAME: Special Education
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: * Special pedagogy - therm, subject, objectives, interdisciplinary relations, classification, terminology. * Legislation, integration, inclusion - therm, terminology, forms and possibilities of integration, curricular documents, individual educational plan. * Diagnostics and pedagogical-psychological counseling system. * Physical disability - characterization, classification, etiology, treatment options, education, DMO, appropriate physical activity and sports, inclusion of pupil with physical disability * Mental disability - characterization, WHO classification, etiology, education, Down syndrome, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of a mentally disabled disciple in the PE * Autism - characteristics, etiology, possibilities of education, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of a pupil with autism into PE * Visual impairment - characterization, classification, etiology, treatment options, possibilities of education, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of the pupil with visual impairment into PE * Hearing impairment - characterization, classification, etiology, possibilities of education, prothetics, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of the pupil with hearing impairment into PE. * Alternative and augmentative communication - characteristics, individual systems. * Specific Learning Disabilities - Characteristics, Classification, Etiology, Remedy, Training Options, Appropriate Physical Activities and Sports, Inclusion of Student with SPecif. learning disabilities to PE * Behavioral disorders - characterization, classification, possibilities of correction, equipment. * Therapy in special pedagogical care - canistherapy, hippotherapy.
OBJECTIVES: To acquire basic information on individual types of disability, the possibilities of education of people with disabilities. To inform about current legislation in inclusive education, especially in physical education and sport. As part of project Innovation 24 - the cooperation with colleagues (schoolmates) from the study program and applied Sports Education for Security Bodies.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Closing of the subject - be active on seminars, or online platforms, make a seminar work of proposed topic, exam. Creating learning materials and presentations in lessons - the topic is communication and specific approach for people with special needs More in Interactive syllabi.
TEACHING_METHODS: Project education - students in cooperation with students from the study program Applied Sport Education for Security Bodies, subject Special pedagogy, nk 4710, will create interactive learning materials for.class discussion, online version by the MS teams Tasks for self-study: study of recommended literature Monitors tasks: week in the credit
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: - to be orientated on the issues of individual types of disability. - to describe what learning opportunities people with special needs have. - to grasp the legislative framework of inclusive education including the counseling system - to analyze the possibilities of inclusive education for different types of disabilities - to design an individual educational plan for a pupil with special needs - to design opportunities for movement and sports activities for people with different types of disability within and outside of the inclusive. - to apply the basics and principles of communication with people with specific needs. - As part of the project Innovation 24 - to collaborate on the creation of educational materials on the issue of communication with persons with specific needs
LITERATURE:
SKOTÁKOVÁ, Alena. Aplikovaná tělesná výchova. Online. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014, s. nestránkováno, 49 s. ISBN 978-80-210-7350-0. URL info

NAME: Sport Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Jůva, V.
SYLLABUS:
01. Definitions and features of sports education. National and global documents on sports and sport education
    02. Elements of the sport education process (goals, participants, conditions, resources)
    03. Origin and beginnings of sport pedagogy
    04. Development and current concept of sport pedagogy
    05. Sport pedagogy in the science system. Concept and content of sport pedagogy in the Czech Republic and abroad (e.g. Slovakia, Germany, USA)
    06. Empirical, normative and critical concepts of sport pedagogy and their importance for sport educators
    07. Basic areas of sport education in terms of educational institutions, age, performance levels, integration and inclusion
    08. Objectives, content and importance of school sport. Sport and development of community school
    09. Educational aspects of leisure sport – sport and leisure (function, features, meaning)
    10. Pedagogical problems of competitive sport. Dual career
    11. Sport educator (PE teacher, coach, trainer, leisure time teacher, ...). Coach education. Project AEHESIS
    12. Pedagogical competence of sport educators
    13. Pedagogical diagnostics and self-diagnostics in sport education
    14. Application of pedagogical principles in sport education
    15. Gradation of sports educators. How do sports educators learn?
    16. The possibilities of sport in solving global problems. Project Sport and Development
    17. Sports and environmental education
    18. Sports and multicultural education
    19. Sport education and European Union (project EYES 2004, European week of sports, EUPEA, ...)
OBJECTIVES: The main objectives of the course are the following: acquainting students with the terminology of the sports pedagogy; making students aware of human conception of the modern sports pedagogy; analyzing the sports education in the modern world.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Pedagogy, Didactics, Didactics of Physical Education.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation, preparation and presentation of the individual home work, written test, oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, group discussion, individual consultations, individual home work
TEACHER_INFO:

    Cíle a obsah výuky a veškeré požadavky na ukončení předmětu jsou uvedeny v rámci interaktivní osnovy.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course students should be able to: understand and explain the modern trends of the sport education; interpret the result of the empirical researches of sport education; interpret the sports educational program of the various institutions; make high-quality program of the sports education.

NAME: School Management and Counselling
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J. - Sliacky, J. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
1. Historical overview of theories in the field of management, their reflection in the field of school management.
    2. Basic concepts in management (vision, setting aims, planning, managing, leadership, human resources, decision making, organizing, controlling, levels of management, school management, classroom management). Motivation (internal, external, Maslow’s hierarchy of needs).
    3. Educational policy in the Czech Republic, Strategy of Educational Policy 2030+, Framework Educational Programmes and School Educational Programmes, Education law.
    4. School founders, types of schools, school autonomy, the school system, right to education, obligatory school attendance in the Czech Republic.
    5. School culture, Public Relations, presenting school (www, social media, information systems), classroom climate.
    6. External and internal school evaluation. Czech School Inspectorate. Functions of external and internal school evaluation. Annual School Reports.
    7. School headmaster and deputy headmaster – their role in management and leadership of schools. School financing. Additional school activities.
    8. The organizational structure in the school, after-school childcare, interest and leisure activities, school counselling system, working groups of teachers. Boards of schools.
    9. Legislation for teachers (occupational health and safety, GDPR, children’s law), specific legislation and requirements for Physical Education (evaluation of students), school rules, operational code for the gym, playing area, etc.
    10. Legislation for employees in schools (job searching, selection procedure, on-boarding), rights and duties of employees, instructions for employees, lesson planning. Supervision and mentoring. Professional development and further education of teachers.
    11. Other/additional functions of pedagogical workers: class teacher, counsellor, prevention specialist, school psychologist, remedial teacher, teacher assistant, coordinator of the school curriculum, ICT coordinator, etc.
    12. School documents (school educational program, class register, school register, pupil’s record book, individual educational plan).
    13. System of counselling in the Czech Republic (pedagogical-psychological counselling, special pedagogical centers) and other institutions. Counselling system in schools. Legislation for counselling in schools.
    14. Actors of counselling in schools – prevention specialist, school psychologist, remedial teacher, teacher assistant. Cooperation with parents and with other counselling institutions. Individual educational plan, measures for supporting children with special needs.
OBJECTIVES: The course aims to develop students’ knowledge from the field of school management and counselling. The students will understand the underlying principles of the school as a specific organization. The course aims to develop students’ competencies for solving problems in the teaching profession.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Compulsory attendance at seminars, completing particular tasks, preparing and presenting thematic papers, written test, oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, discussion, team work, individual work. During on-line sessions the activity of students will be stimulated using instructional applications.
TEACHER_INFO: Výuka a veškeré požadavky k ukončení předmětu jsou uvedeny v interaktivní osnově. https://is.muni.cz/auth/el/fsps/jaro2025/nk4140/index.qwarp
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course, the student is able: - to define basic concepts in the field of school management - to explain basic concepts in the field of general management - to describe the structure of the educational system in the Czech Republic - to identify important factors influencing school culture - to discuss various possibilities of school evaluation - to distinguish functions of pedagogical workers - to analyze the organizational structure of the school - to apply knowledge on legislation into labor-law relations in schools - to analyze school documents and its’ role in school education - to describe the system of counselling in the Czech Republic - to identify relevant actors of counselling in schools - to explain their roles and opportunities for cooperation with parents.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Psychomotricity
TEACHERS: Gregorovič, G. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
Introduction - terms, history, psychomotor props, forms and methods
    Introductory activities - icebreakers
    Warm-up activities
    Psychomotor parachute
    Newspaper sheets
    Joghurt cups
    Sensomotor activities
    Juggling
    PET tops
    Relaxation, massage
OBJECTIVES: The goal of this course is to introduce the students into the psychomotor physical activities, including the theoretical background, into the possibilities of use of these activities with different groups and with psychomotor tools, props and material.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
-Active participation in lessons
    -Practical presentation of a psychomotor activity with a specific target group + lesson plan (including the title of the activity, goals, props, age group, etc.)
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical seminar, physical activites and games
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of this course students should be able to:
    - interpret the term "psychomotricity" and describe the specific characteristics of psychomotor movement activities
    - use the information about the psychomotor scientific discipline and classify it within the system of other disciplines (kinanthropology, pedagogy, psychology, sociology, etics, philosophy)
    - understand the experience character of psychomotor activities and games
    - understand and practically apply psychomotor game rules
    - make a psychomotor lesson plan (including introductory and warm-up activities, activities with specific psychomotor props as well as relaxation activities) and to adapt it for specific needs of a particular target group
LITERATURE:

NAME: Sociology of Sport
TEACHERS: Svoboda, A. - Svobodová, Z. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: Sociological Relevance of Sport; Modern Sport; Sport and Popular Culture; Sport and Mass Media; Commercial Sport; Sport, Politics and Nation-States; Sport as a Means of Resistance; Sport and Sport Subcultures; Alternative Sports; Sport and Socialization; Sport and Social Cohesion; Sport and Development: 'Sport as a Tool' 1; Sport and Development: 'Sport as a Tool' 2
OBJECTIVES: Sociology is very helpful when it comes to studying sports as a social phenomenon. It provides concepts, theoretical approaches, and research methods to describe and understand behaviour and social interactions as they occur in particular social and cultural contexts. Just qualitative changes in sports have updated new concepts as physical recreation, professional sport, high-performance sport, elite sport etc. Becoming involved and staying in sports occurs in connection with the general socialization process in the lives of people. The phenomenon of sport has been strongly transformed during the past two or three decades, mostly as a consequence of the process of commercialisation and medialization of elite professional sports, mostly to a global extent. The main objective of the lesson is to properly understand the mutual relations of sport and society in local, regional and global contexts.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completion of the course Introduction to Sociology hology
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Regular term of the final exam - written test - will be held in written form in a classroom with a PC at the faculty - remedial term - oral exam - participation in seminars, student seminar presentations
TEACHING_METHODS: Lectures based on recomended literature. Sekot, A: Sociologie sportu, 2006 Sekot, A. Aktuální problémy sociologie sportu, 2008
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Main output from the perspective of knowledge of the students is deeper understanding of mutual relations os society and sport in the context of sedentary, postindustrial, consumerist society.
LITERATURE:
SEKOT, Aleš. Sociologie sportu. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita a Paido, 2006, 412 s. Pedagogická edice. ISBN 80-210-4201-X. info

NAME: Didactics of Adapted Physical Education
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Skotáková, A. - Kubíčková, V.

SYLLABUS: Inclusion in Physical Education - Legislation, Liberation, Relaxation in Physical Education. Physical impairment - appropriate exercises and physical activities, possibilities of self-realization in the field of sport (sitting volleyball, basketball on a cart, handbikes), inclusion of a pupil with physical disabilities into common physical education - modification of sports activities, principles, specifics Mental disability - appropriate exercises and exercise games, mentally handicapped sport, Special Olympics, inclusion of a pupil with mental disabilities into common physical education Autism - characteristics, possibilities of education, appropriate exercises, specifics of pupil inclusion with autism to PE. Visually impairment - practice of spatial orientation, appropriate exercises and movement games, appropriate sports (Showdown, Goalball, sound shooting), inclusion of the pupil with visual impairment into common PE, compensation tools. Hearing impairment - appropriate exercises and movement games to develop tactile and visual perception and space orientation, appropriate sports, communication in the commmon PE with a pupil with hearing impairment. ADHD, ADD - didactic principles during exercise, appropriate exercises in physical education
OBJECTIVES: To obtain basic theoretical information about the possibilities of sport and physical activity of children, youth and adults with special needs. To inform about the possibilities of inclusion of people with disabilities in the field of physical activity and about appropriate physical activities in relation to specific disabilities. To allow practical experience and use theoretical knowledge to work with pupils with special educational needs in school physical education.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Closing of subject - be active on on exercises, presentation of metodical scene.
TEACHING_METHODS: practice exercises Tasks for self-study: study of recommended literature Monitors tasks: week in the credit
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: - Know appropriate sports and physical activities for people with different types of disabilities - to propose an individual educational program for physical education for pupils with special educational needs - to design and plan the possibilities of including a pupil with different types of disability into common physical education

NAME: Sports Psychology and Coaching
TEACHERS: Humpolíček, P. - Jůva, V. - Pačesová, P.
SYLLABUS: Sport psychology, historical development, recent situation. psychologie sportu • Professiography, psycho-sportography. Laterality. • Personality of the athlete, diagnostic process, classification. Temperament. • Motivation, basic theories. Need for achievement. Assessment. Aspiration. • Sociální skupina a sport - charakteristika, utváření, působení, dynamika Social groups, teams. Characteristics, features, dynamic development. Social influence: innovation, conformity, authority, decision making. Stages of the group development. The regulations, norms. • Individual and the team. Roles. Leader. • Executive functions, motor intellect. • Psyche and top achievement. Self-awareness, the goals, activation - relaxation. • Psyche and top achievement. stress, fear, anxiety and competition. Emotion, aggression, dynamic processes and sports. • Motor learning, specific theories. Faces, plato, process of the forgetting. Flow. Asertivity and sports activities. • Coaching: the goals, principles, means. Dyadic interaction, team interaction. • Team management, atmosphere in the team. Team atmosphere. Team regulations and norms. Personal development of the athletes. Principles of spiritual hygiene.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to reserve the basic information focuses on psychology knowledge into sport setting: recreation, top competitive, physical education. The aim is oriented on issues linked with psychical processes in mentioned environment within dyadic and team network. Next aim is to present the topics from coaching domain as the mean of the development personality and the team.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: 80 % - participation in seminars home-works - assessed with points Written test - open questions.
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with support of IT, seminars, self-study, class discussion.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After the course student is able to - use the knowledge in the field practice, - to analyze the personality features and behavior (athlete, coach), - recognize learning processes and motor learning, - demonstrate the regulation of psychic level in relation in sports loading, - to solve conflict situation in the team, - to analyze team atmosphere, - to apply basic coaching skills.

NAME: Teambuilding
TEACHERS: Soják, P. - Šíp, R. - Gregorovič, G. - Soják, P. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
Theoretical background of teambuilding
    Team diagnostics, group diagnostics, identification of need
    Working with a group - group dynamics, team roles
    Reflexion and supervision
    Communication with a client, preparation of a teambuilding programme
    Dramaturgy before the event
    On site dramaturgy
    - Conflict within the team
    - Coaching

OBJECTIVES:
The goal of this course is to introduce students into the large variety of activities, programmes and principles that are commonly denominated Teambuilding.
    In their practice students may encounter teambuilding programmes not only from the point of view of a participant, but also of a submitter. Therefore, it is necassary for the students to know the theoretical background of team work, as well as practical applications of various types of teambuilding programmes and activities.

-active participation in lectures and seminars
    -group project
    -written test

    - address specific situations in teamwork, to reveal a crisis in the team and be able to find the right help to revitalize the team work

    - start work on multidisciplinary teams (and project)

NAME: Social Aspects in Sport
TEACHERS: Hurych, E. - Palka, J.
SYLLABUS:
Philosophical reflection of sport.
    Philosophical platform for sport terminology.
    Body, mind, movement.
    Health, naturality.
    Culture, physical culture, nature.
    Problems of culture (civilization) and problems of physical culture (sport).
    Sport as a socio-cultural phenomenon.
    Elite sport versus recreational sport.
    Socialization of human by sport.
    Sport and mass media.
    Sport mobility and migration.
    Violence in sport.
    Gender problems of sport.
    Future perspectives of sport.
OBJECTIVES: The major aims of the subject are: to provide to students some basic philosophical and sociological backgrounds for the complex approach to sport. Sport is presented as a social-cultural phenomenon reflecting the dynamics of changes in the world of values within interests and activities of the mankind. Philosophy of sport presents a major platform of thinking, sociology of sport faces the task to describe and explain socially and culturally conditioned position of sport in modern society. Main objective of the lesson is to properly understand mutual relations of sport and society in local, regional and global context.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Min. 80% attendance in seminar lessons
    written test - 15 questions (min. 50% needed to pass)
    - essey about the selected topic
    - assesment interview (according to the situation)

    Structure and behavior of the musculoskeletal system
    Determination of the basic parameters of the human body, its segments and the center of gravity of the body
    Rheology (rheological models), mechanical properties of the tissues forming the passive and active subsystem of the locomotor apparatus (stiffness, elasticity, hardness, relaxation and creep, material fatigue, load and deformation relationship, muscle tone gradation, hysteresis curve, Hill's three-element model, parameters of muscle contraction)
    Mechanical principle of movement of the human body (biomechanics of musculoskeletal system): biomechanics of joints, spine, long and short bones and muscle biomechanics
    Diagnosis of mechanical loading of the musculoskeletal system in sport
    Mechanics of basic human locomotive movements
    Seminars:
    In the seminars, students will present methods of motion analysis of the human body and its mechanical load in sports practice based on the study of professional publications
OBJECTIVES: Outcomes of the course is to acquaint the student with the mechanical properties of the locomotive apparatus and to explain the principle of the mechanical loading of the individual body parts, further to clarify how this knowledge can be applied in the analysis of the human body movement as well as in the sports conditioning preparation.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: • In seminars an active presentation of students on topics dealing with methods of diagnosing the movement of the human body and its mechanical load in sports practice • Oral examination to prove knowledge corresponding to the lectured issue • The final mark will reflect the mark of the oral exam and the level of the presentation in the seminars
TEACHING_METHODS: theoretical lectures; study of scientific texts; presentation
TEACHER_INFO:
http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/biomechanika
    jméno: visitor heslo: p1l0t
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of biomechanics studies the student will be able to: • explain basic mechanical laws and principles of human body movement, • define the mechanical properties of the locomotor system tissues, • synthesize this knowledge with previously acquired knowledge about selected biological subsystems, • to clarify the mechanical load of the locomotive apparatus in basic locomotive movements as well as in sports movements.
LITERATURE:
Kalichová, M., Baláž, J., Bedřich P. & Zvonař, M. (2011). Základy biomechaniky tělesných cvičení. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita. 193 s.
        Janura, M. (2003). Úvod do biomechaniky pohybového systému člověka. 1. vyd. Olomouc: Univerzita Palackého v Olomouci. 84 s.
        Valenta, J. & Konvičková, S. (1996). Biomechanika člověka. Díl 1, Svalově kosterní systém. Praha: Vydavatelství ČVUT.
        Vaverka, F. (1997). Základy biomechaniky pohybového systému člověka. 2. vyd. Olomouc: Vydavatelství Univerzity Palackého v Olomouci. 40 s.
        Herman, I. P. (2007). Physics of the human body. Berlin: Springer, 2007.
        Brinckmann, P., Frobin, W. & Leivseth, G. (2002). Musculoskeletal biomechanics. Stuttgart: New York: Thieme.
        Nordin, M. & Frankel, V. H. (2001). Basic biomechanics of the musculoskeletal system. Philadelphia: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins.

ASSESMENT_METHODS: The credit is composed of two parts. NAME: Regeneration and Rehabilitation in Sports Practice
TEACHERS: Horák, V. - Kapounková, K. - Komzák, M. - Struhár, I. - Struhár, I. - Ševčíková, B. - Šimonová, M. - Čechová, O.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    1. Function of limbic system
    2. Optimal placement of joint position
    3. Cortical functions and their significance
    4. The Importance of Recovery for Athletic Performance
    5. Examination of dynamic stereotypes
    6. The role of active and passive rest in the regeneration of an athlete
    7. The use of selected forms of hydrotherapy in athlete´s regeneration
    8. Effect of hydrostatic pressure on the efficiency of selected procedures in hydrotherapy
    9. The influence of water temperature and its application in hydrotherapy
    10. The use of compression garments in relation to performance and athlete´s regeneration
    11. Sleep deprivation and sports performance
    12. Athlete´s regeneration in relation to the use of Finnish, infrared sauna and steam bath
    Seminars:
    1. Standing body assessment
    2. Examination of stereotypic movements
    3. Examination of cortical functions
    4. Training process with using balance equipment
    5. Dynamic neuromuscular stability and optimal athletic performance
    6. Practical use of regeneration forms in relation to biochemical and performance indicators
OBJECTIVES: The main aim of the subject is to extend the student´s knowledge about the technique of training positions and the analysis of individual movement activities. Another objective of the course is to provide the student with the theoretical and practical knowledge in the field of athlete´s regeneration which is one of the main determinants of performance.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. Attendance (one absence is permitted)
    2. Regularly preparation at seminars
    3. Case study
    4. Exam. Pass the final written test- at least 70%
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the course the student is able to:
    1. define the physiological settings of joints and body segments
    2. analyze the training program in terms of the optimal physiological adjustment of joints and body segments

    4. create an appropriate regeneration program based on physical activity
    5. evaluate changes before and after application of athlete´s regeneration to biochemical and performance indicators

NAME: Strength Training and Conditioning in Specific Groups
TEACHERS: Cacek, J. - Kapounková, K. - Bazalová, P. - Cacek, J. - Vomáčková, K.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_kondcvic )
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    Biology effect of physical activities on organism (cardiovascular system, metabolism, motion system, endocrinne and immune system),
    Health and physical activity. The consenquences of hypokinese, sdentary lifestyle,
    Origin and activity WHO, medical programs,
    Quality of life related to health (methods of evaluation). Healthy lifestyle (nutrition,physical activity, prevention of harmful habits),
    Determinants of health. Support of health.
    Growth and development of childre and risks their threat.
    External and internal factors influencing the physical development of children,
    Biology of aging (involving processes, sarcopheny,reduction of cognitive function, vegetative dysbalance....)
    Pathological condition nascent with physical activity

    Seminars:
    Basic of precription of effective programs of physical activity (intensity, frequency, time of lasting, kind of physical activity),
    Prescription of pphysical activity like prevence of civilization diseases in children,
    prescription of physical activity in individual kinds of weakeninig (diabetes, hyphertense, ischemic diseases, obesity)
    Specification of conditional training in seniors.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the subject is provide knowlede about analyse of datas related to relationship between external and internal factors of health and to use results of methods (biochemical parametres, genetics, loading examinations) for creation of individual conditional programs.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Compulsory attendance in lessons. The student prepares a seminar paper. Practical output on the topic of seminar work during seminars (One continuous test). Activity during the seminars will be scored. It is finished by oral exam.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completion of this subject student will be able to::
    to analyse results of loading tests and laboratory examinations,
    to suggest conditional program related to health,
    to analyse conditional programs in view of biology effect of physical activities.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Motor Recovery Techniques
TEACHERS: Vaculíková, P.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_reg_techniky )
SYLLABUS:
1. Pilates - history, principles, practical exercises
    2. Pilates - warm up exercises
    3. Pilates - exercises for beginners suitable to main part of the class
    4. Spiral stabilisation - history, principles, practical exercises
    5. Spiral stabilisation - 6 base exercises
    6. Spiral stabilisation - 6 base exercises
    7. Power yoga - history, principles, practical exercises
    8. Power yoga - Sun Salutation
    9. Power yoga - list of asanas
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of the subject is: - familiarizing the student with the characteristics of Pilates exercises
    - to introduce the base list of Pilates exercises
    - to introduce the characteristic of Spiral stabilization
    - to introduce the base list of Spiral stabilization exercises
    - to introduce the characteristic of Power Yoga (PY)
    - to introduce the base list of Power yoga exercises
    - to introduce the base of fascial training
    all in terms of correct implementation, methodical and didactic program
    - to meet how to provide the constructive feedback
    - to enhance the communication skills in this type of physical activities
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
In case of full teaching:
    - 2 absences
    - 3x microteaching (spiral stabilisation, pilates, yoga) during the semester
    videos 1 chosen units (spiral stabilisation, pilates, yoga)
    - assessment of 2 videos (Peer assessment in IS)
TEACHING_METHODS: practical exercises with the theoretical part
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Upon completion of the course the student will be able to:
    - apply the acquired skills in the preparation and implementation of an adequate interventional physical program.
    - form a Pilates Exercise Unit, Power Yoga unit, Spiral Stabilization unit for beginners
    - provide the feedback

NAME: Special Education
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Skotáková, A.
SYLLABUS: Basic therms - special pedagogy (therm, subject, objectives, interdisciplinary relations, classification, terminology), Legislation and integration, inclusion, therapy, physical activity of people with special needs. Diagnostics and pedagogical-psychological counseling system. Physical disability- characteristics, communication of people with physical disabilities, appropriate exercises and physical activities, possibilities of self-realization in the field of sport (sitting volleyball, basketball on the wheelchair, handbikes) Mental disability - characteristics, appropriate exercises and movement games, mental handicapped, communication of people with mental disabilities. Autism - characteristics, possibilities of education. Visual impairment - characteristics, space orientation exercises, appropriate exercises and movement games, appropriate sports (Showdown, Goalball, sound shooting), communication of visually impaired people. Hearing impairment - characteristics, appropriate exercises, movement games and sports, communication of hearing impaired persons. ADHD, ADD - didactic principles during exercise, appropriate exercises. Etopedy - contemporary conception of emotional and behavioral disorders, segregation tendencies, today's terminology, constitutional and protective education Therapy in special pedagogical care - canistherapy, hippotherapy.
OBJECTIVES: The aim is to acquire competencies in working with people with disabilities. Emphasis is placed on the issue of ethopedy and communication with people with special needs. Students cooperate with colleagues from the study program Secondary School Teacher Training in Physical Education.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Credit requirements active participation in seminars, preparation of seminar work on the topic, creation of methodical materials and their presentation in lessons about communication and specific approaches of people with special needs oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Project learning - students in cooperation with students from the TV Teaching study program, subject Integrative special education, nk 4133, will create interactive materials for learning. Lecture, practical seminar. The lectures will include lectures by external practitioners. Self-study tasks: study of recommended literature Task control: in the credit week
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: - to be oriented on the issues of individual types of disabilities. - to describe what learning opportunities people with specific needs have. - to design opportunities for movement and sports activities for people with different types of disabilities. - to Apply the basics and principles of communication with people with special needs. - to be oriented in the system of education of pupils with behavioral and emotional disorders - cooperate on the creation of educational materials on the issue of communication with persons with special needs
LITERATURE:
SKOTÁKOVÁ, Alena. Speciální pedagogika. Online. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014, s. nestránkováno, 81 s. ISBN 978-80-210-6996-1. URL info
        VOJTOVÁ, Věra. Úvod do etopedie. 1. vydání. Brno: Paido, 2008, 128 s. pedagogická literatura. ISBN 978-80-7315-166-9. info

SYLLABUS: 1. Evolution of self-defence a) fighting and martial arts in self-defence b) modern self-defence systems c) evolution of self-defence theory in Czech Republic d) Alogodika 2. Characteristics of self-defence 3. Taxonomy of self-defence 4. Self-defence and law 5. Self-defence situation 6. Characteristics of attack and defence 7. Theory of combat 8. Pain in self-defence 9. Differences between selfl-defence and combat sports 10. Psychology in self-defence 11. Tactics in self-defence 12. Technique in self-defence 13. Reaction time in self-defence

NAME: Physiology for Security Bodies
TEACHERS: Kapounková, K. - Vomela, J. - Bernaciková, M. - Grün, V. - Juříková, J. - Mazúr, J. - Řehoř, A. - Kopečková, B. - Sebera, M.
SYLLABUS:
Syllabus of lectures:
    Introduction to ASEBS Physiology, Response and Adaptation to Load
    Metabolic Performance Characteristics - Response and Adaptation to Load
    Functional Performance Characteristics - Reaction and Adaptation to Load
    Somatic Characteristics of Athlete - Response and Adaptation to Load
    Stress reaction
    Physiology of fatigue
    Human Physiology and Pathophysiology in Extreme Conditions:
    - thermoregulation (the reaction and adaptation of the body to heat and cold)
    - stay in a mountainous environment (reaction and adaptation of the organism)
    - Diving (reactions and adaptation of the body to high pressure)
    - gravitational overload (reaction and adaptation of the organism)
    - fasting, dehydration, stress
    Introduction to forensic medicine (drowning, suffocation)
    Testing in a laboratory and field (theory)

    Syllabus of Seminars:
    Introduction to Physiology ASEBS
    Sports Performance Factors
    Metabolic performance characteristics
    Functional performance during performance
    Specific adaptations of the organism to the load
    Stress tests - introduction, performance characteristics of the athlete
    Determination of thresholds (ventilation, lactate, circulating), Conconi test
    Spiroergometry
    PWC170
    Selected tests of anaerobic assumptions (Jump ergometry, Wingate test)
    Somatic Characteristics of an Athlete
    Somatotype
    Health risks of combative sports
OBJECTIVES: Cílem předmětu je získat znalosti o funkci lidského těla na úrovni předmětu Fyziologie zátěže a aplikovat je na vybrané úpolové sporty a související technické činnosti. Přednášky se konají - po dobu epidemie - distanční formou!
TEXT_PREREQUISITS:
The basic prerequisite for the beginning of Physiology studies are:
    - Regular registration of the subject and successful completion of the so-called prerequisites in the bachelor's study program at FSpS (Anatomy - bp4008, Physiology - bp4013).
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Written final exam. Elaborated worksheets and protocols. The final test usually contains 50 questions from   lectured courses. For a successful test, you must have at least 70% of the correct answers.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture and practice. The exercises are both theoretical and practical. Teaching methods: presentation, discussion, filling of worksheets and protocols, demonstration of tests, practical measurements, homework.
LITERATURE:
Bernaciková, Martina. Fyziologie ASEBS. http://www.fsps.muni.cz/inovace-SEBS-ASEBS/elearning/fyziologie/uvod
        Fyziologie tělesné zátěže 1 :obecná část. Edited by Ladislava Havlíčková. Dotisk. Praha: Univerzita Karlova - Vydavatelství Karolinum, 1994, 180 s. ISBN 80-7066-506-8. info

NAME: Biomechanics for Security Bodies
TEACHERS: Kalichová, M. - Zvonař, M. - Kalichová, M.
SYLLABUS:
Definition of biomechanics, importace, history.
    Physical base of biomechanics of martial arts:
    Kinematics - distance, velocity, acceleration, straight motion, accelerated motion, cirgular motion, motions in field of gravity of Earth, describing motion with graphs.
    Dynamics: force, Newton's Laws, effects of force, deformations, momentum and its conservation, impulse, centripetal force, inertial force.
    Mechanics of rigid body: moment of force, principle of moments, centre of gravity, equilibrium positions, statics, frictional force, air resistance force, inclined plane, lever systems.
    Mechanical energy, work, power, conservation of energy.
    Forensic biomechanics.
    Biological base of biomechanics of martial arts: mechanics load and deformation of tissues.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the subject is: to clarify the mechanical basis of selected physical activities, especially martial arts and combat sports; to approach the issue of forensic biomechanics; explain how the mechanical properties of the musculoskeletal system limit the tolerance to the extreme mechanical load of the body
ASSESMENT_METHODS: seminar work, oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: theoretical presentations, practical application in examples
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/inovace-SEBS-ASEBS/elearning/biomechanika/inovace
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of this course, students should be able: to explain the fundamental mechanics laws and principles of martial arts and combat sports, to apply the bases of this synergetic discipline to human motion system in terms of extreme mechanical load; to orient in the basic methods used by forensic biomechanics
LITERATURE:
KALICHOVÁ, Miriam, Josef BALÁŽ, Petr BEDŘICH a Martin ZVONAŘ. Základy biomechaniky tělesných cvičení. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2011, 193 s. ISBN 978-80-210-5551-3. info
        JANURA, Miroslav. Úvod do biomechaniky pohybového systému člověka. 1. vyd. Olomouc: Univerzita Palackého, 2003, 84 s. ISBN 8024406446. info
        Přehled středoškolské fyziky. Edited by Emanuel Svoboda. 3. vyd. Praha: Prometheus, 1998, 497 s., ob. ISBN 80-7196-116-7. info
        ARUS, Emeric. Biomechanics of human motion : applications in the martial arts. Edited by Lester Ingber. Boca Raton: CRC Press, 2013, xxxiv, 525. ISBN 9781466563230. info
        SACRIPANTI, Attilio. Advances in judo biomechanics research : "modern evolution on ancient roots". Saarbrücken: VDM Verlag Dr. Müller, 2010, 356 s. ISBN 9783639105476. info
        SPRAGUE, Martina. Fighting science : the laws of physics for martial artists. Hartford: Turtle Press, 2002, 269 s. ISBN 9781880336724. info

NAME: Theory and Didactics of Climbing
TEACHERS: Vít, M. - Kubíčková, V. - Možná, T. - Možná, T. - Rajfová, L.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_horo )
SYLLABUS:
Basic equipment for sport and traditional climbing, including specifics for individual disciplines. Use of equipment in practice.
    Introduction to the terminology of individual disciplines, climbing biomechanics, and explanation of basic concepts (fall factor, normalized fall, etc.). Climbing performance difficulty rating scale.
    Theoretical foundations and didactics of sport climbing, bouldering, and rock climbing. Styles of sport climbing.
    Basic belay knots. Safe belaying of a partner (first climber, second climber, top belay) with various belay devices (semi-automatic devices, cups, half boat knot).
    Climbing a route in the position of the first climber involves risks and progressive belaying. Safe belaying and catching the first climber's fall.
    Correct and incorrect technical execution. Correction of incorrect technical execution. Developing exercises with regard to the target group of students/clients.
    Altitude climbing and expedition mountaineering. Ice climbing.
OBJECTIVES: The course aims to teach students the theoretical foundations, terminology, and orientation in the issues within selected mountaineering disciplines. Furthermore, the course teaches students basic belaying techniques. It improves specific practical skills so they can independently and safely climb a route on an artificial wall with progressive belaying in difficulties up to UIAA level 5. A partial aim is to familiarize students with climbing activities within school and extracurricular education or commercial activities.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Final written test usually consists of 30 questions rated 30 body. Minimum of 25 points is required for successfully concluding of the course.
    Practical demonstration: Demonstration of flawless work with belay material, basic belay knots, and the use of correct and safe belaying techniques for a partner (first climber, second climber, with top belay) with various belay devices (semi-automatic devices, cups, half boat knot).
TEACHER_INFO: Praktická výuka se koná na lezecké stěně. Přesné místo výuky je vždy upřesněno pro celý následující semestr s dostatečným časovým předstihem v interaktivní osnově předmětu a je dohledatelné také v aplikaci Rozvrh. Na praktickou výuku si přineste vhodné sportovní oblečení. Pokud máte vlastní vybavení (lezeckou obuv, pytlíky s magnéziem či úvazky), můžete si jej přinést s sebou. Pokud vybavení nemáte, zdarma je možné si ho zapůjčit na místě. Pro praktickou výuku jsou nevhodné dlouhé gelové nehty a zcela nepřípustné jsou šperky na rukách - zejména prsteny.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After successfully completing this course, the student will be able to:
    - describe the basic material equipment for sport and traditional climbing, including the specifics for individual disciplines, and be able to use it correctly.
    - use appropriate terminology and be able to explain selected terms (fall factor, standardized fall, etc.).
    - apply knowledge from the biomechanics of climbing within individual disciplines in practice.
    - explain the differences in the difficulty rating scales of climbing performance and distinguish between styles of sport climbing.
    - demonstrate absolutely flawlessly basic belaying knots on themselves and a fellow climber.
    - safely control the belaying of a partner (first climber, second climber, with top belay) with various belaying devices (semi-automatic devices, cups, half boat knot).
    - be able to turn on progressive belaying when climbing a route in the position of the first climber. At the same time, be able to catch the fall of the first climber when belaying safely.
    - to orientate oneself in the didactics of basic climbing techniques for beginners and intermediate climbers.
    - To identify incorrect technical execution and propose corrections, including improving exercises.
LITERATURE:
LOUKOVÁ, Tereza a Ladislav VOMÁČKO. Motivation for Climbing and Mountaineering. In Turčová I., Andy, M. Outdoor Activities in Educational and Recreatinal Programmes. 1 st edition. Praha: IYNF, Praha, 2009, s. 135-139. ISBN 80-903577-6-8. info
        BALÁŠ, Jiří, Barbora STREJCOVÁ a Ladislav VOMÁČKO. Lezeme a šplháme : 68 her a cvičení na stěně a na nářadí. 1. vyd. Praha: Grada, 2008, 113 s. ISBN 9788024722726. info
        VOMÁČKO, Slávek a Soňa BOŠTÍKOVÁ. Lezení na umělých stěnách. 1. vyd. Praha: Grada Publishing a.s., 2003, 127 s. ISBN 80-247-0406-4. info
        VOMÁČKO, Ladislav a Soňa BOŠTÍKOVÁ. Lezení na umělých stěnách : bouldering a obtížnost, bezpečné lezení, trénink, jak s dětmi. 1. vyd. Praha: Grada, 2003, 127 s. ISBN 8024704064. info

NAME: Didactics of Self-Defence
TEACHERS: Bugala, M. - Bugala, M. - Kubíčková, V.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_upoly )
SYLLABUS: 1. Introduction to self-defense didactics - Definition and meaning of self-defense. - Goals and outcomes of self-defense teaching. - Didactic principles in teaching self-defense techniques. 2. Didactic and methodological approaches to teaching self-defense - Teaching methods and their applications (demonstration, drill, model situations, role-playing). - Planning and structure of a training unit/lesson. - Specifics of teaching for different levels of interest groups or clients. 3. Psychology and pedagogy of self-defense - Student motivation and the role of the instructor. - Stress and its influence on performance in self-defense. - Strategies for managing crises. 4. Practical aspects of teaching self-defense - Basics of verbal and non-verbal communication in conflict situations. - Defense techniques (grip, hug, strangulation, punch, kick, in a disadvantaged position on the ground). 5. Model situations and applications in security forces - Simulation of real threats in model situations. - Pair work and teamwork. 6. Evaluation and development of self-defense teaching - Error analysis and feedback in the teaching process. - Injury prevention and safety measures in teaching. - Final evaluation and feedback.
OBJECTIVES: The course aims to equip students with advanced didactic skills to teach personal self-defense effectively. They will learn to apply pedagogical and psychological principles, evaluate teaching, and adapt training to different skill levels. Emphasis is placed on methodology, safety, and adaptation of teaching methods to the specific requirements of personal self-defense. Sub-goals: 1. Didactic and methodological preparation – To familiarize students with modern teaching methods, pedagogical principles, and didactic principles relevant to teaching personal self-defense. 2. Practical application – To acquire skills in conducting training and methodological analysis of self-defense techniques for various target groups. 3. Psychology and pedagogy in self-defense – To understand the psychological aspects of stressful situations, decision-making, and motivation of students/clients in the process of learning self-defense skills. 4. Adaptation to a specific environment – ​​To learn to adapt training methods to the specific conditions of the target group and their real personal/work situations. 5. Evaluation and improvement of teaching – The ability to analyze, evaluate, and improve the process of teaching self-defense concerning effectiveness and safety aspects.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The student: - is physically and co-ordinately fit for self-defense training, - is able to master and apply self-defense techniques, - is familiar with the issues of self-defense and combat sports, - knows the basic strategic, tactical, and technical principles of self-defense, - knows the legal aspects of self-defense (necessary defense, extreme emergency, authorization to use a weapon).
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The assessment will include theoretical knowledge, practical skills, and didactic skills of students. 1. Continuous assessment - Activity and involvement in teaching (discussion, practical exercises). - Quality of execution of self-defense techniques and their methodological teaching. - Analysis of model situations and ability to apply knowledge in practice. 2. Practical exam - Independent teaching of a self-defense lesson (student as instructor). - Demonstration of selected techniques with an emphasis on accuracy, efficiency, and safety. - Ability to adapt teaching to different levels of students and specific conditions. 3. Final teaching project - Preparation and implementation of a teaching block (lesson structure, methodological procedures, analysis). Assessment criteria The assessment will be based on a point system and a qualitative analysis of the student's performance. 1. Practical part (50% of the total grade) - Technical execution of self-defense techniques (speed, control, and correctness of technique). - Didactic skills in teaching (understandability, safety, adaptation to the level of students). - Ability to resolve crises during teaching. 2. Final teaching project (50% of the total grade) - Structure and methodology of the teaching lesson. - Creativity and ability to adapt to different target groups. - Quality of project defense and response to feedback.
TEACHING_METHODS: The course will combine theoretical knowledge with practical training and application of self-defense techniques in the context of personal self-defense. - Lectures/interactive curriculum: Theoretical basis of didactics, psychology, and legal aspects of self-defense. - Practical exercises: Training and demonstration of self-defense verbal and physical techniques, methodical work with individuals and groups, and creation and role-playing for self-defense teaching/training. - Model situations: Simulation of real conflict scenarios. - Final teaching project: Selected groups of students will prepare and teach a model self-defense lesson including methodological analysis. Teaching methods Using a diverse range of teaching methods to develop not only practical skills but also didactic abilities of students. - Instructional methods: Demonstration of techniques with an explanation of the main principles of movement. - Guided training method: Repetition of techniques in various variations for their mastery. - Problem-based teaching method: Solving situations where students independently seek the optimal solution for a defensive reaction. - Interactive methods: Discussion, brainstorming, and group work for a better understanding of self-defense didactics. - Feedback method: Mutual evaluation of teaching, analysis of errors, and suggestions for improvement. - Simulation and scenario teaching: Practicing self-defense in conditions as close as possible to real situations, role-playing. - Reflective learning: Self-assessment of students and their progress in teaching and didactic skills.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course Didactics of Self-Defense, the student will be able to: 1. Didactic and methodological preparation: - Explain the basic didactic principles and methodological approaches to teaching personal self-defense. - Create and structure preparation for a lesson/lesson/course. 2. Practical application of teaching: - Effectively conduct self-defense lessons and lessons for individuals and groups. - Demonstrate and explain self-defense techniques with an emphasis on correct execution and safety. - Adapt teaching to the individual needs and abilities of students/clients, including crises and stress. 3. Psychological and pedagogical aspects: - Analyze psychological factors influencing the learning process and performance in self-defense. - Apply motivational and communication strategies to improve teaching effectiveness. - Prepare students/clients to manage stressful situations in self-defense situations. 4. Specific applications for teaching personal self-defense: - Adapt self-defense teaching to the specific needs of the interest group and legislation. - Use model situations and scenarios to simulate real threats and crises. 5. Evaluation and improvement of teaching: - Critically analyze the effectiveness of the teaching process and implement feedback to improve the methodology. - Identify and eliminate errors in the technical execution of self-defense techniques. - Design strategies for skill development and injury prevention during teaching/lessons and training.
LITERATURE:
REGULI, Zdenko, Miroslav ĎURECH a Michal VÍT. Teorie a didaktika úpolů ve školní tělesné výchově. Vydání první. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, Fakulta sportovních studií, 2007, 87 stran. ISBN 9788021043183. info

        NÁCHODSKÝ, Zdeněk. Nebojte se bránit. Vyd. 1. Praha: Armex, 2006, 336 s. ISBN 8086795438. info

NAME: Psychology for Security Bodies
TEACHERS: Pačesová, P. - Šíp, R. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
-Emotion (general), specific: fear, aggression, conflicts solving.
    -Motivation, need for achievement, development, regulation.
    - Personality, experience - behavior regulation.
    - Group processes in relation with specific environment (family, institutions, etc.).
    - Authority, team management, good - bad approaches.
    -Communication with marginal groups, influence of those groups.
    - psychical and physical loading: description, prevention, coping (stress, frustration, burnt-out, fall situations).
    -Posttraumatic stress disorder.
    -Basic information from the domain of the victimology.
    - Spiritual hygiene.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to present basic approaches, topics and issues relevant to potential profession of the graduates. E.G.: coping emotions (self-awareness and opposed site), communication (including marginal groups), coping crisis situation, team cooperation. next aim is to link the theoretical knowledge with skills practice and self-reflection.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Assessment in points - active participation in lectures (20%) Assessment in points - active participation in the seminars, filled tasks (30%) Written test - prerequisit Oral exam (50%)
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with IT support, seminars and demonstrations, examples of the good - fall practice, self-study, students presentations
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After the passing the course student should be able to: - understand basic terminology and principles of functioning human psyche in situations of the crisis, - adequate communication according the population group and situation, - analyze the reasons and consequences of the crises situations, - adequate apply the knowledge and skills within practice.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Management and Marketing in Security Bodies
TEACHERS: Racek, O. - Reguli, Z. - Racek, O. - Vyroubal, M.
SYLLABUS:
1. Management and its development trends
    2. Planning
    3. Organization
    4. Leadership
    5. Check
    6. Strategic management
    7. Marketing - definition, development, types
    8. Marketing environment
    9. Targeted marketing
    10. Purchasing behavior of the consumer
    11. Marketing mix
    12. Marketing research
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to acquaint students with the issues of marketing and its use in organizations typical of the security sector.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
645/5000 The final exam is written.
    Students will be admitted to the exam if they properly present and submit a seminar paper (ie 60% - 100%). The evaluation of the seminar paper and its presentation is a third of the final evaluation.

    Rating:
    A - 100% - 90%
    B - 89% - 85%
    C - 84% - 75%
    D - 74% - 70%
    E - 69% - 60%

    If a student commits any disciplinary offense, this behavior will be deemed not to meet the conditions for terminating the subject. The lecturer enters the exam (assessment) in the IS with a mark "F" and the dean initiates disciplinary proceedings, resulting in the completion of studies.
TEACHING_METHODS:
Teaching is conducted in the form of lectures and seminars.
    In the seminars the current case studies will be dealt with, the discussion of the issue is expected.
    The student will prepare and present a seminar paper.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
- define concepts of management and marketing
    - Explain the essence of planning
    - Describe basic types of organizational structures
    - to enumerate and explain the essence of the basic styles of leadership
    - Explain the functions and process of the control process
    - Apply strategic analysis techniques
    - to enumerate and explain the factors of the marketing environment
    - Describe individual parts of the marketing mix
    - Apply marketing mix elements in practice
    - Understand the purchasing behavior of the consumer
LITERATURE:
