SYLLABUS: 1. Evolution of self-defence a) fighting and martial arts in self-defence b) modern self-defence systems c) evolution of self-defence theory in Czech Republic d) Alogodika 2. Characteristics of self-defence 3. Taxonomy of self-defence 4. Self-defence and law 5. Self-defence situation 6. Characteristics of attack and defence 7. Theory of combat 8. Pain in self-defence 9. Differences between selfl-defence and combat sports 10. Psychology in self-defence 11. Tactics in self-defence 12. Technique in self-defence 13. Reaction time in self-defence
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to obtain knowledge about different approaches in professional selfdefense, tactics and modern self-defence systems.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: None
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Theoretical test
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course student should - know different approaches in professional selfdefense - know different modern professional systems - be able to evaluate conditions for professional tactics solution
LITERATURE:
KREML, Antonín, Martin HELEBRANT a František NOVOTNÝ. Zbraně a sebeobrana. 1. vyd. Praha: Goldstein + Goldstein, 1997, 329 s. ISBN 8086094235. info
        STOCZEK, Jindřich. Sebeobrana v mezinárodním právu. Edited by Vladislav David. 1982, 44 l. info

NAME: Methodology
TEACHERS: Zháněl, J.
SYLLABUS: Methodology: • 1 Introduction to science methodology • 2 Quantitative research • 2.1 Variants (types, methods) Research • 2.2 Research problem, research objective, research question, hypotheses • 2.3. Methodology (research ensemble, methods, design, etc.) • 3 qualitative research • 3.1 Basic characteristics of design of quality research plan • 3.2 Qualitative study project • Statistics: • 4. Descriptive statistics • 4.1 data sorting, processing and graphical representation • 4.2 Masters positions • 4.3 Variability rates • 4.4 Dependence rates • 5. Inferential statistics • 5.1 Statistical hypotheses testing • 5.1.1 tests for independent files • 5.1.2 Tests for dependent files • 5.1.3 tests for nominal, ordinal, respectively. metric variable
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the subject is to acquire a set of knowledge and skills leading to the successful elaboration of the research project and subsequently the final (master's) work in the context of relevant methodological-statistical procedures.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Knowledge of the basic concepts of science methodology (quantitative and qualitative research, structure and types of research) and descriptive statistics (measuring scales, position levels, variability, dependence). Knowledge of their application in research data analysis.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Credit: Active participation in teaching in seminars (1 x apologized absence), presentation and submission of the project of the final thesis. Lectures: participation in teaching, fulfillment of continuous check tests in teaching: Test 1 (after completion of the Methodology block), test 2 (after the block of statistics). When the tests are not fulfilled, the credit test is written at the end of the semester. The exam consists of 1) oral part: presentation of DP work (A-F) project, 2) Written parts: Online test (30 questions, fulfilled when gaining 22 points and more).
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, seminar, theoretical preparation, work on the project of diploma thesis, statistical data analysis.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the subject, students are able to: - to define the basic concepts of science methodology, quantitative and qualitative research; name the research problem and choose a suitable type of research; cite relevant knowledge of the studied literature; explain the objective objective, formulate research questions/hypotheses; describe the research file and the method of selection; characterize the structure of scientific work; use methodological knowledge in the creation of a research project; - define the basic concepts of measurement theory, methods of descriptive and inference statistics; analyze research data by descriptive statistics methods; calculate position, variability and dependence rates; test research hypotheses by inference statistics methods; to formulate research conclusions; summarize the content of research work in the abstract.
LITERATURE:
ZHÁNĚL, Jiří, Vladimír HELLEBRANDT a Martin SEBERA. Metodologie výzkumné práce. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014, 65 s. 1. ISBN 978-80-210-6875-9. info

NAME: Research Trends in Kinanthropology
TEACHERS: Zvonař, M.
SYLLABUS:
1. Basic terminology of project challenges
    2. Overview and characteristics of grant agencies providing grants for research projects

NAME: Ethics and Social Responsibility
TEACHERS: Moudr, V. - Moudr, V.
SYLLABUS: 1. Ethics as part of philosophy and its contemporary cooperation with empirical sciences (neurosciences, evolutionary biology, cognitive psychology..). Basic thesis of empirical ethics. 2. Elemental concepts and their connections. 3. Origin of morality from natural roots, cultural determination of morality, social function of morality. 4. Descriptive ethics, methaethics, normative ethics, aplicated ethics. 5. Theories of normative ethics as ways how to give reasons for moral conviction. 6. Aplicated ethics - sport ethics. 7. Aplicated ethics - business ethics, consumer ethics. 8. Aplicated ethics - ethics of human resources, social responsibility of business organizations, fair trade. 9. Environmental ethics - biocentrism, ecocentrism, deep ecology. 10. Environmental ethics - antropocentrism, zoocentrism, theocentrism. 11. Reasons for refusal of ethics (sociobiology) and environmental ethics (neoliberal economist - Simon, Klaus).
OBJECTIVES: The aim is to acquaint students with basic concepts, knowledges and approaches in ethics, environmental ethics and also with concept of social responsibility.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: written or oral exam
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: On the end of the course student will be able to: understand to genesis and function of morality; know basic concepts, approaches and problems of ethics and environmental ethics; adopt responsibility for himself, his acts and products; comprehend ethics as theoretic discipline which reflects morality and be able to differentiate ways of this reflection (descripive ethics, methaethics, normative ethics, aplicated ethics. Student will be able to: describe elemental problems of business, consumer and environmental ethics; distinguish different approaches in environmental ethics; adopt tool for making decisions in situations of difficult moral dilemmas.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Strength Training and Conditioning 1
TEACHERS: Cacek, J. - Králová, T. - Kumstát, M. - Lipčák, A.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_kondcvic )
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    Ontogenetic basic of children and yoth conditional training
    Sensitive periods of development of individual physical abilities
    Conception of long-term sports training
    Using of pedagogical principles in children conditional training
    Specifics of strength abilities development in children training
    Specifics of speed abilities development in children training
    Specifics of endurance abilities development in children training
    Specifics of coordination abilities development in children training (ideomotoric, gnostic and motoric function)
    Specifics of flexibility abilities development in children training
    Motoric skills, training of technique in children and youth
    Identification of talents
    Selection of talents
    Diferenciation in children and youth conditional training
    Excersise
    Application of development speed abilities´s methods in children and youth training
    Application of development strength abilities´s methods in children and youth training
    Application of development endurance abilities´s methods in children and youth training
    Application of development coordination abilities´s methods in children and youth training
    Application of development flexibility abilities´s methods in children and youth training
    Organization and selection of talents in children
    Testing of motoric abilities in children
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of subject Strength and Conditional training is to teach to interprete basic of strength and conditional training of children and youth, to define and apply forms and methods suitable in conditional training of children. The another goal is provide information about:
    conception of long-term development of fitness
    theory and aplication of identification and selection of talents
    differences of training in individual age categories
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The course is concluded with an oral examination, with a grade of A-F. A written test is required for admission to the oral examination. The test consists of 15 questions (open or closed, closed questions have only one correct answer). A 70% pass rate (i.e. at least 11 questions answered correctly) is considered a pass mark. The test can be repeated a maximum of 3 times.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After succesfull training of this subject student will be able to:
    1. to interprete basic of conditional training of children and youth
    2. to define and apply forms and methods of conditional training suitable for children and youth
    3. to describe and apply base of characteristic of identification process and selection of talents (multidimensional attitude)
    4. to realise conditional training of children and youth
    5. to define differences between conditional training of children and adults
    6. to define basic of actual conception in sports development

NAME: Diagnostics and Locomotor System in Ontogenesis
TEACHERS: Bazalová, P. - Kapounková, K. - Vomáčková, K. - Horák, V. - Kopečková, B.
SYLLABUS:
Diagnostics of locomotor system - spontaneous motorics, reflex motorics, postural tests.
    Prenatal motor evolution and newborn age i n psychomotor development - basic characteristics.
    1-16 month stage of psychomotor development - reflex a spontaneous motorics incl muscle synergies and respiration.
    Toddler, pre-school and school age stage of psychomotor development - specification of advisable physical exertion and mechanisms of adaptation/maladaptation incl. sex specific approaches.
    Adolescence, adult age and senescence - specification of advisable physical exertion and mechanisms of adaptation/maladaptation
OBJECTIVES: Main aim of the subject Diagnostics and locomotor system in ontogenesis is to aknwowledge students with evolution of motor patterns in ontogenesis, with its formative effect on human locomotor system and relation to psychomotor development. The subject serves as an introduction to diagnostics of quality of motor patterns, to definition of ideal motor pattern and to recommendation of advisable physical exertion leading to physiological adaptation and prevention of maladaptation.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: -Attendance in practical seminars (students may be absent twice) -Active approach and completing worhsheets -Short presentation (5-10 mins) of a topic of student's choosing with context in developmental kinesiology -Practical and theoretical exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Frontal type of education with open discussion to presented topics and practical exercises with demonstration of presented topics directly on students.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Students will achieve basic knowledge of ontogenesis of human motorics, ideal motor patterns and related diagnostics. The will know basic characteristics of recommended physical exertion that is aimed at physiological adaptation and prevention of maladaptation in particular age stages.
LITERATURE:
VOJTA, Václav a Annegret PETERS. Vojtův princip : svalové souhry v reflexní lokomoci a motorické ontogenezi. Translated by Denisa Mendelová. 1. vydání. Praha: Grada, 2010, 180 stran. ISBN 9788024727103. info
        OATIS, Carol A. Kinesiology : the mechanics and pathomechanics of human movement. 2nd ed. Baltimore: Lippincott Williams & Wilkins, 2009, xiv, 946. ISBN 9781451108989. info

        VÉLE, František. Kineziologie : přehled klinické kineziologie a patokineziologie pro diagnostiku a terapii poruch pohybové soustavy. 2., rozš. a přeprac. vyd. Praha: Triton, 2006, 375 s. ISBN 8072548379. info
        Pohybový systém a zátěž. Praha: Grada, 1997, 252 s. ISBN 8071692581. info

NAME: Applied Kinesiology
TEACHERS: Bazalová, P. - Vomáčková, K. - Vysoký, R.
SYLLABUS:
Motor control and proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation and inhibition at cortical, subcortical and spinal level.
    Mechanisms of adaptation and maladaptation of soft and hard tissues of motor apparatus to physical exertion - skin, subdermal tissue, fascias, muscles, cartilages, bones.
    Kinesiology of axial organ - dynamic movement, active and passive stability of motor segments of trunk.
    Kinesiology of upper extremity - dynamic movement, active and passive stability of motor segments of upper extremity.
    Kinesiology of lower extremity - dynamic movement, active and passive stability of motor segments of lower extremity.
OBJECTIVES: Main aim of the subject Applied kinesiology is to introduce students to human locomotor system and its central and peripheral control incl. available non-invasive and non-pharmacological interventions. It also deals with soft and hard tissues response to specific work load in a form of adaptation and prevention of maladaptation. The subject also focuses on kinesiology of particular motor segments of human trunk and extremities.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
seminars - attendance (max. 2 absences - inform the teacher by email) + student presentation on the chosen topic
    final assessment - oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Frontal type of education with open discussion to presented topics and practical exercises with demonstration of presented topics.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Students will achieve basic knowledge of human locomotor control incl. available therapeutic interventions. They will know basic tissue mechanisms of adaptation to physical exertion. The students will also get oriented in basic topographic anatomy and physiology of particular motor segments of human body.
LITERATURE:
KAPANDJI, Adalbert Ibrahim. The physiology of the joints. 6th ed. Edinburgh: Churchill Livingstone, 2011, ix, 323. ISBN 9780702039423. info

NAME: Stress Testing
TEACHERS: Zvonař, M. - Bernaciková, M. - Struhár, I. - Grün, V. - Mazúr, J. - Řehoř, A.
SYLLABUS:
1. Purposes of the stress tests. Choosing of the suitable stress test. Feature of the stets.
    2. Overview of the stress sources. Physical loading by movement, resistence, position; load volume, intensity, duration, in and out of the laboratory. Ergometers.
    3. Safety conditions of the tests. Healthy contraindications of the tests. Safety monitoring the reaction of people to loading. Reasons for the interruption of the tests. Specific approaches of the testing of children and seniors.
    4. Subjective and objective parameters od the reaction to load: load sensation, respiratory, carculatory, metabolic (biochemic).
    5. Tests and indicators of the anaerobic ATP-CP system: Margaria – Kalamen sprint test on stairs. Jump ergometry. Wingate test (maximal and average power, work, fatigue index).
    6. Tests and indicators of the anaerobic – glykolytic system: Spiroergometry (maximal oxygen debt, maximal oxygen deficit).
    7. Dynamometry on bicycle ergometers and bicycles – measuring of forces on pedals.
    8. Tests and indicators of the aerobic system I: Spiroergometry - maximal minute oxygen intake, oxygen half-time, pulse oxygen.
    9. Tests and indicators of the aerobic system II: Ergometries (W170, W150, W130), Cooper 12 min test, Harvard and YMCA step-tests, Ruffier test, Two km walking test.
    10. Pulse and muscle oxymetry.
    11. Tests and indicators of the aerobic system III: Anaerobic threshold - definition, meaning and ways of determination. Lactate threshold, ventilátory threshold.
    12. Assessment of energy expenditury during human movement (indïrect calorimetry, accelerometry, monitoring and tables of energy demands). Energetic economy of the human movement (running).
    13. Tests of complete tiredness/exhaustion – analysis of heart rate variability, biochemical a imunological indicators.
    14. Test of diving reflex.
    15. Stress tests of choosen patients (diabetics, astmatics, cardiacs, hypertonics)
OBJECTIVES:
The subject is focused on aeducation in field of human physiological stress tests.
    Aims fo the subject - to acquire knowledge and ability at next fields:
    1. Choice and methodology of tests for the diagnostics of physiological reaction and adaptation to physical loading, and diagnostics of ability to physical performance.
    2. Analysis and interpretation of the test results, and its using in planning of physical activity, sport training etc.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: In the subject a knowledge of human anatomy and physiology is supposed, first of all a knowledge of exercise physiology.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. attendance (one absence is permitted)
    2. Creation of the seminar work (presentation by PowerPoint or Word) and its defence.
    The seminar works will be focused on chosen test for certain persons (athletes or patients) for management their physical activity, including interpretation of test results.
    3. Final test, min.70%
TEACHING_METHODS:
Theoretical lectures.
    Practical seminars: demonstration of the tests in laboratory and gym.
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/~novotny/
LITERATURE:
Novotný, J. (2013). Biologické ukazatele odezvy a adaptace na zátěž, únavy a regenerace sil. In: Regenerace a výživa ve sportu.(pp.m35-75). Brno, Česko: Fakulta sportovních studií MU.

NAME: Strength Training and Conditioning 2
TEACHERS: Cacek, J. - Králová, T. - Helis, L. - Kumstát, M.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_kondcvic )
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    Specifics of the training evidence in context of sport disciplines and sport perfomance level of athletes,
    Analysis of the training in context with cycles of preparation,
    Overtraining, recoverable processes and training,
    The models of tapering and peaking sport perfomance,
    The models of tapering and peaking sport perfomance in endurance activities,
    The models of tapering and peaking sport perfomance in speed and strength activities,
    The models of tapering and peaking sport perfomance in activities with high demands on the coordination component,
    The models of tapering and peaking sport perfomance in team sports,
    Postactivation potantiation and sports perfomance,
    Biorhytms and time zones,
    The effect of altitude, humidity, equipement and temperature on sports perfomance,
    Seminars:
    The planning and periodization of the tapering and peaking sport perfomance
    The evidence of the preparation on basis with biorhytms, time zones, altitude and fatique
    The realization of excersises to achieve optimal postactivation potentiation.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of subject is educate the students about evidence of the training, analysis of training parametres and progress of fitness. The another aim of subject is to aquire knowledge to effective leading of training. It is about the effects of biorhytms, influence of moving between time zones, tapering and peaking sport perfomance, optimalization of training based on recoverable parametres (creatinkinase, heart rate and other), overtraining, influence of altitude, effect of equipment and humidity on sport perfomance.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completion of subject Strength and Conditioninig Training 1.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: To work and consign the evidence of selected training cycle in chosen sport discipline on sports perfomance level. To work strategy for tapering and peaking sports perfomance in chosen sport disciplines. The subject will be finished by oral exam and defense above analysis and strategies.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After succesfull completion of the subject "Periodization and Planning of the training" student will be able:
    1. to interprete basic of tapering and peaking sport perfomance,
    2. to realise evidence of the training,
    3. to realise analysis of training parametres and to optimalize training programs on their basis,
    4. to suggest analysis of training recomendation for leading sports training on the basis of information about biorhytms, time zones, tapering and peaking sport perfomance, optimalization of training based on recoverable parametres (creatinkinase, heart rate and other), influence of altitude, effect of equipment and humidity on sport perfomance,
    5.to work with ovetraining on basis of optimalization of the training.

NAME: Social Psychology in Sport
TEACHERS: Pačesová, P. - Pačesová, P.
SYLLABUS:
The subject - social psychology definition, the subject development.
    Social group and sport - characteristics, team formation, development, dynamics.
    Social influence within the team: innovation, decision making, conformity, authority, leadership.
    The stages of the team formation, regulations, norms. Individuals, dyad, team.
    Basic principles of the coaching. the content, methods.
    Social perception: attitudes - labeling - stereotypes - attribution.
    Conflicts, prevention, coping, solving.
    personality - teams with the phenomenon "different". Communication, development, leading.
    Group//team relations: goals, roles, team atmosphere, team performance.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to understand social processes in the sports environment and to obtain knowledge of sport psychology issue in the practice. The course content is focused on deepness of communicative skills as well as improvement of interactive abilities with individuals and the teams. The aim is to present basic principles with the individuals or groups with the phenomenon "the other, different", too.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: 80% active participation at seminars and written test - open questions, 65% of correct answers is needed to pass.
TEACHING_METHODS: class discussion, lectures, theoretical preparation, model situations.

NAME: Nutritional Counselling
TEACHERS: Hlinský, T. - Beníčková, M. - Wagner, A. - Hrnčiříková, I. - Kumstát, M.
SYLLABUS:
1. Introduction
    2. Basic terminology
    3. Client history
    4. Methods of assessing nutritional status, dietary habits and other indicators of health or lifestyle
    5. Nutritional recommendations in practice
    6. Recommendations for physical activity, sleep and other aspects of lifestyle
    7. Specific population groups
    8. Nutrition in prevention
    9. Nutrition for the debilitated
    10. Nutrition in support of athletic performance
    11. Bioactive substances, dietary supplements and pharmacotherapy
    12. Alternative nutritional guidelines
    13. Current nutritional trends
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to get acquainted with general methods of working with clients in the field of nutrition and lifestyle counselling. To provide a comprehensive overview of current trends in nutrition used in lifestyle change. The graduate of this course will be able to develop a lifestyle change plan for clients from the general population, athletes, and according to the specific needs of population groups. In addition, the student can use therapeutic approaches to intervene with the client. The graduate will also be able to evaluate whether the intervention was successful.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Students are graded A-F based on meeting the prerequisites below:
    1. Active participation in seminars (2 absences allowed).
    2. Completion of a portfolio, which is a condition for admission to the examination, in the following range:
    a) Semester project in the form of a comprehensive text document according to the template. The content will be an analysis and evaluation of the nutritional status and dietary habits of the selected case study, along with a draft recommendation;
    b) Completion of the Semester Project Peer Review;
    c) Continuous completion of sub-assignments of independent work as assigned in the interactive curriculum.
    The portfolio contributes a weight of 20% to the final grade.
    3. Intermediate tests verifying knowledge of the areas studied (3 in total). Tests are taken at seminar time every fourth week of the semester. The maximum number of points obtained in all tests is 30. At least 70% of the maximum score (at least 21 points) is required for admission to the examination. The midterm tests contribute a weight of 20% to the final grade.
    4. Passing the oral examination (Students draw one examination topic and present this in the context of a related case study). The oral examination accounts for 60% of the final mark.
LITERATURE:
BERNACIKOVÁ, Martina, Jan CACEK, Lenka DOVRTĚLOVÁ, Iva HRNČIŘÍKOVÁ, Tomáš HLINSKÝ, Kateřina KAPOUNKOVÁ, Jitka KOPŘIVOVÁ, Michal KUMSTÁT, Dagmar MOC KRÁLOVÁ, Jan NOVOTNÝ, Petr POSPÍŠIL, Jana ŘEZANINOVÁ, Michal ŠAFÁŘ a Ivan STRUHÁR. TEACHERS: Kotas, J. - Racek, O. - Racek, O. - Sedláček, T.
SYLLABUS:
Business, Businessman.
    Physical and legal person, trade and business corporation.
    Start of business activities, legislative requirements, registration requirements.
    Accounting and tax requirements.
    Employer and employee.
    Business plan, its compilation and evaluation.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to prepare students theoretically and practically for the possibility of realization in the business environment of the Czech Republic.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Credit is awarded for attendance, seminar activity and successful business plan.
    Attendance - the student is allowed to absent during the semester once without excuse. Students must be prepared theoretically for the seminar, otherwise they will be evaluated as absent.
    If the student commits any disciplinary offense, this behavior will be considered as not fulfilling the conditions for terminating the subject. The teacher enters the credit with the "F" rating and the dean initiates disciplinary proceedings, which may result in completion of studies.
    Entrepreneurship in sport - final project
    Content
    - Specification of the legal form of business - offer of services - customer analysis - competitor analysis - forms of promotion - risk assessment - budgeting (cost/benefit or expenditure/income) - Lean canvas - SWOT - SMART objectives
    General conditions
    - Czech legislative framework
TEACHING_METHODS:
Teaching is conducted in the form of lectures and seminars.
    In the seminars the current case studies will be dealt with, the discussion of the issue is expected.

NAME: Alternative Trends in Athlete Regeneration
TEACHERS: Hlinský, T. - Struhár, I. - Krajňák, J. - Lipková, L. - Puda, D. - Struhár, I. - Šimonová, M. - Vomáčková, K.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the subject is to extend students' knowledge in the field of alternative forms of regeneration. After successful finishing, the student gains not only the orientation of current athletic regeneration trends but is also able to undergo a critical assessment of the use of the practice.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Successful completion of subjects Applied Kinesiology, Regeneration and Rehabilitation in Sport Practice, Stress testing
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. Attendance (one absence is permitted)
    2. Regularly preparation at seminars
    3. Test. Test comprises 30 questions. When a student answers a question correctly, he/she is awarded a point for it. To pass the test, the student must reach the score of at least 21 points.
    4. Seminars - presentation on the chosen topic
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completing the course the student is able to:
    1. determine alternative forms of athlete´s regeneration with regard to their practical applicability in sport practice
    2. identify key points in each form of regeneration that have a direct impact on the athlete's performance
    3. interpret data from spectral analysis of heart rate variability
    4. practice exercises with the use of foam rollers
    5. apply Schultz's autogenous training and Jacobson's progressive relaxation into the training process
    6. evaluate the real use of dietary supplements for athletes and non-athletes

NAME: School Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Sliacky, J. - Sliacky, J.
SYLLABUS:
1. Development of the school as institution – historical perspective. Important school reforms. Role and functions of school in society. Theories of schooling. School as learning environment. Cooperation of school and society. School and other educational institutions (leisure time institutions, cultural institutions, sports institutions).
    2. School culture. School development. Safety in schools. Classroom. Classroom climate. Primary prevention: bullying, drug prevention, etc.
    3. Educational policy and curricular policy (Strategy of Educational Policy 2030+). Curricular documents (Framework Educational Programme, School Educational Programme). Aims of education. Curriculum. Content of education and content transformation.
    4. Instruction – theory and practice: designing, implementing, evaluating instruction. Setting instructional goals (cognitive, affective, psychomotoric). Blooms’ taxonomy of educational aims. Forms of classroom organisation. Phases of instruction. Didactical principles. Didactical tools and media. Quality of instruction.
    5. Teaching approaches and methods (definition, choice, categorisation, characteristics). Transmissive and constructivist teacher belief regarding teaching methods.
    6. Teacher (teaching profession, professional competencies, professional development, teachers’ belief, teaching style, reflective practitioner, teachers’ authority).
    7. Pupil (learning, learning theories, learning styles and strategies, students’ preconceptions, achievements, competencies). Homogeneity, heterogeneity, diversity among pupils. Motivation to learn. Discipline. Moral education.
    8. Classroom communication (forms, written communication, feedback).
    9. Pedagogical diagnostics (subject, process, categorization).
    10. Assessment of learning and of achievements (functions of assessment, forms of assessment). Assessment criteria. Formative assessme nt. Exams, marks / grades.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to provide orientation in important issues of school pedagogy and reflect these issues in school practice. Because this course is situated in 1. semester of Master study programme for teachers, its’ another aim is to initiate and support students when developing their professional competencies, which will be fostered in other pedagogical courses and during teaching practice.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: No prerequisites.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Completing particular tasks, preparing and presenting portfolio tasks, written test, oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, individual work, group work, discussion, role playing, simulation-based learning, problem solving. In on-line teaching, various applications for activating students will be used, oral/written feedback regarding individual tasks.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After finishing the course, students are able to characterise important historical milestones of the development of school as institution, to explain the role and functions of school in the society, to outline basic principles of educational policy and its reflection in the school practice. Further, students are able to reflect the influence of various factor on school culture, school climate and on safety in schools. Students are able to define the concept of curriculum and they can use their knowledge when they work with curriculum a when they design instruction. They are able to analyse lesson structure and its’ determinants. They are able to reason about criteria of instructional quality. They can classify methods of instruction and are able to propose, how to use methods in the school practice. Students acknowledge the teaching profession, professional development and (self)reflection. They are able to design instruction with regard to individual learning situation and achievements of pupils and of the whole class. They use descriptive language when they provide feedback to pupils. Students are able to differentiate various types of assessment and they reflect their strengths and weaknesses in the school practice.
LITERATURE:
JANÍKOVÁ, Marcela. Základy školní pedagogiky. 1. vydání. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2009, 119 stran. ISBN 9788021048799. info

NAME: Psychology for Teachers
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: - The subject of educational psychology, links with other disciplines, education - Relationship: development - maturation - learning - education - The learning process and its contexts - Effective learning, motivation - Emotions and conflict in the learning process - The student - parent - teacher relationship - Psychology of teaching (training), relationship to success and failure. Failure as a stressful situation - Learning styles and strategies, inclusive, parallel, separate educational environments - Basics of conflict mediation - Psychohygiene, stress, burnout syndrome - Basics of classroom/team work
OBJECTIVES: To broaden students' knowledge and skills needed for pedagogical practice in schools and leisure settings, with an emphasis on communication skills, effective conflict and emotionally challenging situations resolution, giving feedback and working with a team. All of this with consideration for the individuality and needs of others as well as one self's.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: there are no pre-requisits for the course
ASSESMENT_METHODS: - Group project - Final (written) test
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with IT information, seminars, self-learning.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: On completion of the course the learner will be able to - Describe the subject of educational psychology, its basic concepts and links with other disciplines. - Listen empathically to a person's feelings, identify their needs - Analyse and effectively resolve conflicts in the educational environment. - To evaluate in a reflective way one's own pedagogical practice and its impact on the individual. - Use role plays and thought experiments to enhance empathy and communication. - Use feedback to modify own teaching, as well as for personal growth. - Describe the signs of stress, burnout and basic work with them. - Understand the fundamentals of the mediation approach. - Describe the basics of group dynamics, its development and ways of influencing it.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Didactics of Physical Education
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Jůva, V. - Sliacky, J.
SYLLABUS:
1. Didactics of Physical Education and its position in the structure of pedagogical sciences.
    2. Relationship of Didactics of Physical Education and some related scientific disciplines.
    3. Historical development of Physical Education as a school subject in Czech schools.
    4. Designing the curriculum of Physical Education at primary and secondary schools.
    5. Educational process in Physical Education.
    6. Teacher – pupil (student) interaction.
    7. Teaching activities of the teacher.
    8. Learning activities of the pupil (student).
    9. Evaluation of the results of the educational process.
    10. The environment and conditions of the educational process in Physical Education.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the Didactics of Physical Education is to systematically develop the prerequisites for effective planning, leadership, management and evaluation of the educational process of pupils in Physical Education. This main objective is gradually fulfilled by explaining the inclusion of Didactics of Physical Education in the field of pedagogy and general didactics and relations to other related scientific disciplines, by describing significant periods and moments of historical development of Physical Education, and above all by analyzing and interpreting the course of the educational process, its elements (pupil, teacher, curriculum, conditions of the education) and stages. Students are supported in the reflection of acquired knowledge and skills, their synthesis in solving problem situations and in the discussion of specific impacts on their own pedagogical activity.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completion of the course in the 1st semester Mgr. together with the subject Introduction to Pedagogical Practice.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
- evaluation of partial outputs (written work, presentation output)
    - written test
    - oral exam
TEACHING_METHODS:
- lecture
    - seminar (group work, discussion, work with text, written work, presentation)

NAME: Theory and Didactics of Basketball and Volleyball
TEACHERS: Marek, O. - Vencúrik, T. - Vencúrik, T.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures from basketball and volleyball:
    - requirements for successful completion of the subject,
    - history,
    - rules,
    - systematics,
    - physical and physiological demands,
    - other forms of basketball and volleyball.

    Practical seminars from basketball and volleyball:
    - Methodological demonstrations of the students on the given topic.
OBJECTIVES:
The main objective of the course is to prepare students to lead the teaching unit in physical education classes of basketball and volleyball.
    Students will improve didactic principles and rules during the course by means of specified methodical demonstrations from the given sport.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS:
Students practically master the basketball and volleyball individual skills and understand the rules of the game.
    Obligatory completion of courses bp4015 and bp4010.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
1. 90% attendance.
    2. basketball and volleyball e-learning test.
    3. practical test from the given methodological demonstration.
    4. handing in the seminar work (preparation for teaching unit).
    The resulting mark will be determined on the basis of the individual parts.
TEACHING_METHODS:
Lecture
    Practical seminars (methodical demonstrations of students)
    Self-study
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/didaktika-basketbalu-a-volejbalu/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
When successfully completing the course, the student will be able to:
    - prepare a written form of the training unit,
    - to lead a teaching unit according to the correct didactic principles and rules,
    - to teach pupils of primary and secondary schools the basics of basketball and volleyball according to the methodical principles of given sports.

NAME: Didactics of Swimming
TEACHERS: Bátorová, M. - Kodešová, S.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bp4014 || bk4014 || bp2083 || bk2083 || bp2036 || bk2036 && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_plav )
SYLLABUS:
Structure swimming sports.
    Swimming instruction at various levels.
    Specifics of swimming lessons for children and adults, fear and motivation in learning to swim
    Determinants swimming performance
    Development of swimming techniques.
    Technique of swimming methods.
    Water games
    Methodology training methods of swimming.
    Rules of swimming, planning teaching units in the water.
    First aid in school facilities.
OBJECTIVES: Students will acquire basic theoretical knowledge and practical skills of swimming sport from the point of view of its development, importance for human health, swimming education and the first aid from the point of view of their future pedagogical practice.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Basic swimming skills, techniques of swimming methods of breaststroke, backstroke and crawl.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
The course is completed after:
    - completion of the methodological output
    - submission of the final report on swimming lessons for preschool children
    - fulfilling the required attendance in practical and theoretical teaching
    - successful completion of the final exam
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical training in the form of exercises and theoretical lectures.
TEACHER_INFO: Povolené jsou 2 neomluvené absence a 1 neaktivní účast ve vodě s náhradním úkolem. Náhrada absence jen po domluvě s vyučujícím.

NAME: Philosophy of Sport
TEACHERS: Hurych, E. - Palka, J.
PREREQUISITES: předp. ! e058 || ( NOW ( e058 ))&& bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )
SYLLABUS:
Different foundations and conceptions of philosophy and philosophy of sport.
    Dispute over terminology.
    Human, body, mind, movement.
    Health, nature.
    Faustical topic in the sphere of sport
    Spirituality of human movement.
    Ethical issues in sport.
    Principles of Olympism (areté, kalokagathia).
    Recreology and non-performance sphere of movement.
    Competition as a phenomenon.
    The narrative approach to sport.
    Hermeneutics and basic ideas of phenomenology in sport analyses.
OBJECTIVES: The major aims of the subject are: to explain to students the importance of philosophical thinking, to develop their critical thinking ability and enable them to gain basic overview in the next major fields: philosophical groundings of sport and the importance for the questions of terminology, the problem of body and corporeality, olympism, recreology, ethical vissues in sport, spirituality of sport, the phenomenon of competition and philosophical aspects of health.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Min. 80% attendance in seminar lessons
    written test - 15 questions (min. 50% needed to pass)
    - essey about the selected topic
    - assesment interview (according to the situation)
TEACHING_METHODS: lectures, prezentations of selected topics, homework, discussion.
LITERATURE:
RYALL, Emily. Philosophy of sport : key questions. London: Bloomsbury, 2016, vii, 264. ISBN 9781408181393. info

        Philosophy of sport : core readings. Edited by Jason Holt. Peterborough: Broadview Press, 2014, x, 313. ISBN 9781554811465. info

NAME: Reflection on Practice 1
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J.
PREREQUISITES: předp. ( np4111 || n4111 ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )
SYLLABUS:
1. Methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection of teaching (reflective model ALACT, reflective methodology 3A, case study, analysis of video of teaching).
    2. Procedural aspects of reflection and self-reflection (conditions, factors).
    3. Feedback and rules of its provision.
    4. Competence framework of the graduate teacher.
    5. Formulation of professional development objectives and setting of evaluation criteria.
OBJECTIVES: The main objective of the subject is to actively involve students in reflecting on the teaching or observed teaching and to develop their diagnostic, evaluative, self-assessment and communicative competences. The main objective is fulfilled through defining methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection, perceiving the procedural aspect of reflection and self-reflection, setting basic rules for giving feedback, and above all, having to concrete experience with reflective teaching.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: A prerequisite for enrolment in the subject is previous completion of n4111 Introduction to Teaching Practice. Since the subject is linked in content to the parallel pedagogical practice, it can be taken only if the student is also taking n4120 Pedagogical Practices 1.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Formative feedback within activities in the classroom and on the basis of the analysis of submitted documents, criterial evaluation.
TEACHING_METHODS: Discussion and dialogical methods, group teaching, independent work, brainstorming, critical thinking, video-based training.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After completion of the subject, students will:
    ­define the different methods and procedures of reflection and self-reflection of teaching
    ­characterise the process aspects of reflection and self-reflection
    ­define the rules for giving feedback
    ­gives feedback in an appropriate way
    ­sets a specific objective for reflection and respects the necessary conditions for reflection, the factors involved and the necessary rules
    ­explain the importance of reflection for further professional development
    ­formulate objectives for their further professional development on the basis of reflection
    ­sets criteria for evaluating to fulfilling of their professional development objectives
LITERATURE:
JANÍK, Tomáš a Petr NAJVAR. Fred A. J. Korthagen - Jak spojit praxi s teorií: didaktika realistického vzdělávání učitelů. 1. vyd. Brno: Paido, 2011, 294 s. ISBN 978-80-7315-221-5. info

NAME: Personal and Social Development
TEACHERS: Pačesová, P. - Soják, P. - Soják, P. - Šíp, R. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
Lectures:
    1. Mature personality of the teacher as prerequisite for healthy development of pupils: self-concept.
    2. Communication – forms and influence. Manipulation in communication. Respectful communication. Descriptive language. Criteria for quality of instruction. Accountability and improvement. Formative assessment. Interview in difficult situation.
    3. Stress-management: stress and response in/to stress – body reaction in stress situation, eustress, distress, perception of stress; methods and instruments of stress-management.
    4. Teachers authority: definition of the concept, various forms of authority. Factors influencing authority. Developing authority.
    5. Time management: definition of the concept, task prioritising, setting goals (SMART), strategies for planning and executing activities.
    6. Experiential pedagogy – how to use in Physical Education.
    Course:
    1. introductory and self-experiencing activities
    2. group dynamics, working with teams
    3. timemanagement
    4. stressmanagement
    5. soft skills and development, SWOT analysis
    6. feedback and reflection
OBJECTIVES: At the theoretical level, the course aims to develop students’ knowledge of selected topics of personal and social development. It then acquaints students with specific tools that they can use in their professional development in connection with these topics. At the practical level, the goal is to develop students' personal and social competencies based on a thorough (self) reflection.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: completing tasks, creating portfolio, active participation during the course
TEACHING_METHODS: lecture, group work, individual work, discussion, role playing, simulation-based learning
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course, the student characterizes the essential components of personality. The student analyzes interpersonal communication and actively uses descriptive language. The student describes the body's response to stress and uses a suitable tool to manage it. It identifies the sources of natural authority and proposes appropriate solutions for natural authority development based on the analysis of practical examples. The student analyzes his time possibilities and organizes his time appropriately. The student identifies experiential pedagogy principles and chooses appropriate procedures with regard to the pedagogical situation/goal during group work. Within the course, he applies the acquired theoretical knowledge in model situations and reflects the chosen procedure.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Didactics of Track and Field
TEACHERS: Hlavoňová, Z. - Hlavoňová, Z.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_atlet )
SYLLABUS:
Methodology and practice of Track and Field events:
    running and hurdle running,
    high jump,
    long jump,
    pole vault,
    javelin,
    discus throw,
    shot put,
    kids athletics,
    recreational athletics.
OBJECTIVES:
The aim of this subject is:
    provide theoretical knowledge about teaching related to Track and Field events,
    practical application of teaching styles, procedures, methods and principles in lessons,
    compliance with rules and safety on PE lessons in the school,
    preparation of students to planning and organization competition on schools.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: The correct technique of Track and Field disciplines
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Final grade is average of two grades - practical teaching lesson (A to F) and final oral exam (A to F).
TEACHING_METHODS: Lectures are focusing on the history, technique, didactics and rules of individual Track and Field events, practical lessons focuses on teaching methods of Track and Field events and the course finishes with final oral exam.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After successful completion of the subject Didactics of Track and Field student will be able to:
    demonstrate didactic series of Track and Field events,
    define methodology of training of Track and Field events,
    to prepare for a lesson and manage to teach lesson and athletic training children and young people according to new trends,
    student will take a role of a teacher in selected athletic discipline,
    realization of cross country running (Run for the dean´s cup FSpS MU),
    pass an exam of this subject.

NAME: Theory and Didactics of Football, Ice-Hockey and Figure Skating
TEACHERS: Bokůvka, D. - Nykodým, J. - Bokůvka, D. - Nykodým, J.
PREREQUISITES: předp. bp4028 || bk4028 || bp2251 || bk2251 || bp1251 || bk1251 && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_brus )&& bozp_ok ( bozp_fsps_fotbal )
SYLLABUS:
Studenti si v semestru osvojují práci s metodickými výstupy na zadané téma v hodinách. Základní bruslařský nácvik dle metodické řady, zvládnutí techniky: jízda vpřed, zastavení, jízda vzad, jízda v zatáčkách, překládání vpřed i vzad, oblouky vpřed ven a dovnitř, obraty, poskoky a hry na ledě, využití strečinku při bruslení jako prevence proti zranění (úrazům), kruhy vpřed ven a dovnitř, průpravná osma, trojkové obraty, trojkový skok, váha, pirueta na dvou nohách. Lední hokej - herní činnosti jednotlivce v ledním hokeji: výcvik hokejové jízdy, výcvik techniky hole - driblink, přihrávání a střelba, organizace družstva a vlastní hra, průpravné hry, formy rozcvičení na ledě. Součástí výstupu je zvládnutí rozcvičení, uvolňovací a protahovací cvičení a upozornění na zásady bezpečnosti při výuce bruslení.
    Fotbal: Témata přednášek : - historie a pravidla fotbalu - systematika fotbalu, - další formy fotbalu, - zásady bezpečnosti při výuce fotbalu, požadavky pro úspěšné absolvování předmětu. Témata praktických cvičení : - didaktické výstupy zaměřené na nácvik herních činností jednotlivce ( přihrávání a zpracování míče, vedení míče a obcházení soupeře, střelba, výběr místa, obsazování soupeře a prostoru, činnosti brankáře ) a na nácvik herních kombinací ( kombinace založená na přihrávce a nabíhání, kombinace založená na výměně místa, na přebírání hráčů, na zesíleném obsazování )spojené vždy s řízením a rozhodováním utkání.
OBJECTIVES: Lední hokej a krasobruslení: Student je po absolvování vzdělávací jednotky schopen definovat základní metodickou řadu bruslení a rozšířenou metodickou řadu bruslení, rozumí principům skladby vyučovací jednotky a umí sestavit didaktický výstup na zadané téma včetně praktické ukázky. Fotbal: hlavním cílem je, aby byl student seznámen se skladbou vyučovací jednotky v hodinách školní tělesné výchovy. Studentům je prezentováno, jak sestavit didaktický výstup, jak vhodně využívat jednotlivé didaktické formy vyučovacího procesu a zhodnotit herní výkon v utkání. Studenti jsou dále seznámeni se základními pravidly a principy řízení utkání ve fotbale.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Studenti ovládají praktické dovednosti ze základů bruslení a rozšířené didaktické řady bruslení, které budou ověřeny praktickým testem a mají teoretické znalosti z teorie fotbalu a ovládají praktické herní dovednosti z fotbalu. U fotbalu se konkrétně jedná o útočné a obranné herní činnosti jednotlivce a útočné a obranné herní kombinace, které budou ověřeny vstupním praktickým testem v první vyučovací hodině. Teoretické znalosti budou ověřeny písemným testem ještě před začátkem praktické výuky.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation in lessons, classification of metodics demonstration, written test
TEACHER_INFO: http://www.fsps.muni.cz/impact/didaktika-fotbalu-ledniho-hokeje-krasobrusleni/
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: -Plan and prepare a written preparation for the unit of instruction; -to apply the teaching styles, procedures, methods and principles of the teaching process while adhering to safety rules; - able to lead and evaluate the teaching unit, - able to teach pupils of primary and secondary schools the basics of football, ice hockey and figure skating according to the methodological principles " - able to manage and decide matches according to the basic rules of football and ice hockey.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Special Education
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A.
SYLLABUS: * Introductory reflection on the exercise program, which took place in September as a continuation of Project Education from previous semesters *Special pedagogy - therm, subject, objectives, interdisciplinary relations, classification, terminology. * Legislation, integration, inclusion - therm, terminology, forms and possibilities of integration, curricular documents, individual educational plan. * Diagnostics and pedagogical-psychological counseling system. * Physical disability - characterization, classification, etiology, treatment options, education, DMO, appropriate physical activity and sports, inclusion of pupil with physical disability * Mental disability - characterization, WHO classification, etiology, education, Down syndrome, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of a mentally disabled disciple in the PE * Autism - characteristics, etiology, possibilities of education, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of a pupil with autism into PE * Visual impairment - characterization, classification, etiology, treatment options, possibilities of education, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of the pupil with visual impairment into PE * Hearing impairment - characterization, classification, etiology, possibilities of education, prothetics, appropriate physical activities and sports, inclusion of the pupil with hearing impairment into PE. * Alternative and augmentative communication - characteristics, individual systems. * Specific Learning Disabilities - Characteristics, Classification, Etiology, Remedy, Training Options, Appropriate Physical Activities and Sports, Inclusion of Student with SPecif. learning disabilities to PE * Behavioral disorders - characterization, classification, possibilities of correction, equipment. * Therapy in special pedagogical care - canistherapy, hippotherapy. * For all topics, we refer to the students' experiences from the project teaching given in the previous semester, based on which the Adaptation Day at Veslařská took place in September (cooperation with ZŠ speech therapy)
OBJECTIVES: To acquire basic information on individual types of disability, the possibilities of education of people with disabilities. To inform about current legislation in inclusive education, especially in physical education and sport.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Closing of subject - be active on seminars, or mS teams, do the seminar work of proposed topic, tests.
TEACHING_METHODS: Project learning - completion of project from the previous semester - reflection, evaluation, analysis class discussion. In online style MS teams Tasks for self-study: study of recommended literature Monitors tasks: week in the credit
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: - to be orientated on the issues of individual types of disability. - to describe what learning opportunities people with special needs have. - to grasp the legislative framework of inclusive education including the counseling system - to analyze the possibilities of inclusive education for different types of disabilities - to design an individual educational plan for a pupil with special needs - to design opportunities for movement and sports activities for people with different types of disability within and outside of the inclusive. - to apply the basics and principles of communication with people with specific needs. - reflect and analyze the application of the exercise program for persons with special educational needs (SEN)
LITERATURE: SKOTÁKOVÁ, Alena. Speciální pedagogika. Online. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014, s. nestránkováno, 81 s. ISBN 978-80-210-6996-1. URL info

NAME: Sport Pedagogy
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Jůva, V.
SYLLABUS:
01. Definitions and features of sports education. National and global documents on sports and sport education
    02. Elements of the sport education process (goals, participants, conditions, resources)
    03. Origin and beginnings of sport pedagogy
    04. Development and current concept of sport pedagogy
    05. Sport pedagogy in the science system. Concept and content of sport pedagogy in the Czech Republic and abroad (e.g. Slovakia, Germany, USA)
    06. Empirical, normative and critical concepts of sport pedagogy and their importance for sport educators
    07. Basic areas of sport education in terms of educational institutions, age, performance levels, integration and inclusion
    08. Objectives, content and importance of school sport. Sport and development of community school
    09. Educational aspects of leisure sport – sport and leisure (function, features, meaning)
    10. Pedagogical problems of competitive sport. Dual career
    11. Sport educator (PE teacher, coach, trainer, leisure time teacher, ...). Coach education. Project AEHESIS
    12. Pedagogical competence of sport educators
    13. Pedagogical diagnostics and self-diagnostics in sport education
    14. Application of pedagogical principles in sport education
    15. Gradation of sports educators. How do sports educators learn?
    16. The possibilities of sport in solving global problems. Project Sport and Development
    17. Sports and environmental education
    18. Sports and multicultural education
    19. Sport education and European Union (project EYES 2004, European week of sports, EUPEA, ...)
OBJECTIVES: The main objectives of the course are the following: acquainting students with the terminology of the sports pedagogy; making students aware of human conception of the modern sports pedagogy; analyzing the sports education in the modern world.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Pedagogy, Didactics, Didactics of Physical Education.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Active participation, preparation and presentation of the individual home work, written test, oral exam.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, group discussion, individual consultations, individual home work
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: At the end of the course students should be able to: understand and explain the modern trends of the sport education; interpret the result of the empirical researches of sport education; interpret the sports educational program of the various institutions; make high-quality program of the sports education.

NAME: School Management and Counselling
TEACHERS: Sliacky, J. - Sliacky, J.
SYLLABUS:
1. Historical overview of theories in the field of management, their reflection in the field of school management.
    2. Basic concepts in management (vision, setting aims, planning, managing, leadership, human resources, decision making, organizing, controlling, levels of management, school management, classroom management). Motivation (internal, external, Maslow’s hierarchy of needs).
    3. Educational policy in the Czech Republic, Strategy of Educational Policy 2030+, Framework Educational Programmes and School Educational Programmes, Education law.
    4. School founders, types of schools, school autonomy, the school system, right to education, obligatory school attendance in the Czech Republic.
    5. School culture, Public Relations, presenting school (www, social media, information systems), classroom climate.
    6. External and internal school evaluation. Czech School Inspectorate. Functions of external and internal school evaluation. Annual School Reports.
    7. School headmaster and deputy headmaster – their role in management and leadership of schools. School financing. Additional school activities.
    8. The organizational structure in the school, after-school childcare, interest and leisure activities, school counselling system, working groups of teachers. Boards of schools.
    9. Legislation for teachers (occupational health and safety, GDPR, children’s law), specific legislation and requirements for Physical Education (evaluation of students), school rules, operational code for the gym, playing area, etc.
    10. Legislation for employees in schools (job searching, selection procedure, on-boarding), rights and duties of employees, instructions for employees, lesson planning. Supervision and mentoring. Professional development and further education of teachers.
    11. Other/additional functions of pedagogical workers: class teacher, counsellor, prevention specialist, school psychologist, remedial teacher, teacher assistant, coordinator of the school curriculum, ICT coordinator, etc.
    12. School documents (school educational program, class register, school register, pupil’s record book, individual educational plan).
    13. System of counselling in the Czech Republic (pedagogical-psychological counselling, special pedagogical centers) and other institutions. Counselling system in schools. Legislation for counselling in schools.
    14. Actors of counselling in schools – prevention specialist, school psychologist, remedial teacher, teacher assistant. Cooperation with parents and with other counselling institutions. Individual educational plan, measures for supporting children with special needs.
OBJECTIVES: The course aims to develop students’ knowledge from the field of school management and counselling. The students will understand the underlying principles of the school as a specific organization. The course aims to develop students’ competencies for solving problems in the teaching profession.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Completing particular tasks, preparing and presenting thematic papers, written test, oral exam including application in practice.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lecture, discussion, team work, individual work. During on-line sessions the activity of students will be stimulated using instructional applications.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: After completing the course, the student is able: - to define basic concepts in the field of school management - to explain basic concepts in the field of general management - to describe the structure of the educational system in the Czech Republic - to identify important factors influencing school culture - to discuss various possibilities of school evaluation - to distinguish functions of pedagogical workers - to analyze the organizational structure of the school - to apply knowledge on legislation into labor-law relations in schools - to analyze school documents and its’ role in school education - to describe the system of counselling in the Czech Republic - to identify relevant actors of counselling in schools - to explain their roles and opportunities for cooperation with parents.
LITERATURE:

NAME: Psychomotricity
TEACHERS: Gregorovič, G.
SYLLABUS:
Introduction - terms, history, psychomotor props, forms and methods
    Introductory activities - icebreakers
    Warm-up activities
    Psychomotor parachute
    Newspaper sheets
    Joghurt cups
    Sensomotor activities
    Juggling
    PET tops
    Relaxation, massage
OBJECTIVES: The goal of this course is to introduce the students into the psychomotor physical activities, including the theoretical background, into the possibilities of use of these activities with different groups and with psychomotor tools, props and material.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
-Active participation in lessons
    -Practical presentation of a psychomotor activity with a specific target group + lesson plan (including the title of the activity, goals, props, age group, etc.)
TEACHING_METHODS: Practical seminar, physical activites and games
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of this course students should be able to:
    - interpret the term "psychomotricity" and describe the specific characteristics of psychomotor movement activities
    - use the information about the psychomotor scientific discipline and classify it within the system of other disciplines (kinanthropology, pedagogy, psychology, sociology, etics, philosophy)
    - understand the experience character of psychomotor activities and games
    - understand and practically apply psychomotor game rules
    - make a psychomotor lesson plan (including introductory and warm-up activities, activities with specific psychomotor props as well as relaxation activities) and to adapt it for specific needs of a particular target group

NAME: Sociology of Sport
TEACHERS: Svoboda, A. - Svobodová, Z. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS: Sociological Relevance of Sport; Modern Sport; Sport and Popular Culture; Sport and Mass Media; Commercial Sport; Sport, Politics and Nation-States; Sport as a Means of Resistance; Sport and Sport Subcultures; Alternative Sports; Sport and Socialization; Sport and Social Cohesion; Sport and Development: 'Sport as a Tool' 1; Sport and Development: 'Sport as a Tool' 2
OBJECTIVES: Sociology is very helpful when it comes to studying sports as a social phenomenon. It provides concepts, theoretical approaches, and research methods to describe and understand behaviour and social interactions as they occur in particular social and cultural contexts. Just qualitative changes in sports have updated new concepts as physical recreation, professional sports, high-performance sports, elite sports etc. becoming involved and staying in sports occurs in connection with the general socialization process in the lives of people. The phenomenon of sport has been strongly transformed during the past two or three decades, mostly as a consequence of the process of commercialisation and medialization of elite professional sports, mostly in a global extent. The main objective of the lesson is to properly understand the mutual relations of sport and society in local, regional and global contexts.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: Completion of the course Introduction to Sociology hology
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Regular term of the final exam - written test - will be held in written form in a classroom with a PC at the faculty - remedial term - oral exam, - participation in seminars, student seminar presentations.
TEACHING_METHODS: Lectures based on recomended literature. Sekot, A: Sociologie sportu, 2006 Sekot, A. Aktuální problémy sociologie sportu, 2008
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Main output from the perspective of knowledge of the students is deeper understanding of mutual relations os society and sport in the context of sedentary, postindustrial, consumerist society.
LITERATURE:
SEKOT, Aleš. Sociologie sportu. 1. vyd. Brno: Masarykova univerzita a Paido, 2006, 412 s. Pedagogická edice. ISBN 80-210-4201-X. info

NAME: Didactics of Adapted Physical Education
TEACHERS: Skotáková, A. - Skotáková, A.
PREREQUISITES: předp. PřF:XS080 || np4133 || nk4133 && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud ) && bozp_ok ( bozp_po_stud_fsps )
SYLLABUS: Inclusion in Physical Education - Legislation, Liberation, Relaxation in Physical Education. Physical impairment - appropriate exercises and physical activities, possibilities of self-realization in the field of sport (sitting volleyball, basketball on a cart, handbikes), inclusion of a pupil with physical disabilities into common physical education - modification of sports activities, principles, specifics Mental disability - appropriate exercises and exercise games, mentally handicapped sport, Special Olympics, inclusion of a pupil with mental disabilities into common physical education Autism - characteristics, possibilities of education, appropriate exercises, specifics of pupil inclusion with autism to PE. Visually impairment - practice of spatial orientation, appropriate exercises and movement games, appropriate sports (Showdown, Goalball, sound shooting), inclusion of the pupil with visual impairment into common PE, compensation tools. Hearing impairment - appropriate exercises and movement games to develop tactile and visual perception and space orientation, appropriate sports, communication in the commmon PE with a pupil with hearing impairment. ADHD, ADD - didactic principles during exercise, appropriate exercises in physical education
OBJECTIVES:
To obtain basic theoretical information about the possibilities of sport and physical activity of children, youth and adults with special needs. To inform about the possibilities of inclusion of people with disabilities in the field of physical activity and about appropriate physical activities in relation to specific disabilities. To allow practical experience and use theoretical knowledge to work with pupils with special educational needs in school physical education. To know how to make an Individual education plan for pupils with SEN to PE and to know how to work with pupils with SEN in the common lessons of PE. In groups, create and implement teaching units for invited students from the "paragraph" school. Use cross-curricular cooperation - Psychomotorics.
    Be able to reflect on the IEP for a specific student within the framework of peer evaluation in the IS.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: Closing of subject - be active on on exercises, presentation of metodical scene. Realization of the unit for invites school, create IEP as specified.
TEACHING_METHODS: practice exercises Tasks for self-study: study of recommended literature Monitors tasks: week in the credit Project teaching - create and implement a teaching unit for pupils from a "paragraph" school. Collaborate on the creation with the teacher of the subject Psychomotorics, use knowledge and experience from this subject. Simulation teaching - based on the most specific idea of ​​a pupil with SEN (an imaginary pupil, or students can use a pupil from practice), create an IEP (including anamnesis, initial motor diagnostics, the most accurate diagnosis), enter it into the IS and perform a mutual evaluation.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES: Student will be able to: - Know appropriate sports and physical activities for people with different types of disabilities - to propose an individual educational program for physical education for pupils with special educational needs - to design and plan the possibilities of including a pupil with different types of disability into common physical education - reflect on IEP within the framework of peer evaluation - be aware of the overlaps and permeability of individual areas and subjects in working with students with SEN
LITERATURE:
SKOTÁKOVÁ, Alena. Aplikovaná tělesná výchova. Online. Brno: Masarykova univerzita, 2014, s. nestránkováno, 49 s. ISBN 978-80-210-7350-0. URL info

NAME: Sports Psychology and Coaching
TEACHERS: Jůva, V. - Pačesová, P. - Humpolíček, P. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
Sport psychology, historical development, recent situation. psychologie sportu
    Professiography, psycho-sportography. Laterality.
    Personality of the athlete, diagnostic process, classification. Temperament.
    Motivation, basic theories. Need for achievement. Assessment. Aspiration.
    Sociální skupina a sport - charakteristika, utváření, působení, dynamika Social groups, teams. Characteristics, features, dynamic development. Social influence: innovation, conformity, authority, decision making. Stages of the group development. The regulations, norms.
    Individual and the team. Roles. Leader.
    Executive functions, motor intellect.
    Psyche and top achievement. Self-awareness, the goals, activation - relaxation.
    Psyche and top achievement. stress, fear, anxiety and competition. Emotion, aggression, dynamic processes and sports.
    Motor learning, specific theories. Faces, plato, process of the forgetting. Flow. Asertivity and sports activities.
    Coaching: the goals, principles, means. Dyadic interaction, team interaction.
    Team management, atmosphere in the team. Team atmosphere. Team regulations and norms. Personal development of the athletes. Principles of spiritual hygiene.
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to reserve the basic information focuses on psychology knowledge into sport setting: recreation, top competitive, physical education. The aim is oriented on issues linked with psychical processes in mentioned environment within dyadic and team network. Next aim is to present the topics from coaching domain as the mean of the development personality and the team.

ASSESMENT_METHODS: 80 % - participation in seminars home-works - assessed with points Written test - open questions
TEACHING_METHODS: Seminars, lectures, class exercises and class discussion

NAME: Management and Marketing of Sports Events and Clubs
TEACHERS: Kozáček, L. - Racek, O. - Strachová, M. - Štědroň, B. - Kozáček, L. - Racek, O. - Kubíčková, V.
SYLLABUS:
1. Sports club, sporting events and globalization of sport
    2. Schedule sporting sports events
    3. Realization of a sports event and its evaluation
    4. Management of the sports club
    5. Legal aspects of club management
    6. Marketing research
    7. Consumer buying behavior - participants
    8. Purchasing consumer behavior - viewers
    9. Sports brand
    10. Relationship marketing
OBJECTIVES: The aim of the course is to acquaint students with the issues of management and marketing of sports events and clubs. To use acquired theoretical knowledge in practice in the preparation of sporting events and in the management of the sports club.
ASSESMENT_METHODS: The course ends with a final test (the student must obtain a minimum of 60 points). The student will be admitted to the examination if he/she actively participates in the seminars, properly presents and submits the seminar work on time (i.e., obtains a minimum of 51 points in the seminars - all information on the seminar requirements is included in the study materials). If a student commits any disciplinary infraction, that action will be considered a failure to meet the course requirements. The instructor will close the exam (credit) with a grade of "F" in IS and the Dean will initiate disciplinary action, which may result in termination.
TEACHING_METHODS:
Teaching is conducted in the form of lectures and seminars.
    In the seminars the current case studies will be dealt with, the discussion of the issue is expected.
    The student develops and presents seminar paper.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
Student will be able to:
    - Create a plan of sporting events with all the essential aspects
    - Understand the principles of management and management of a sports club or facility
    - Know the issues of marketing research in sport
    - To be able to carry out marketing research
    - use the knowledge of consumer buying behavior when designing a marketing plan of a sports organization
    - Explain the strategy of developing and developing a sports brand on the market
    - Discuss the issue of relationship marketing

NAME: Teambuilding
TEACHERS: Soják, P. - Šíp, R. - Soják, P. - Šíp, R.
SYLLABUS:
Theoretical background of teambuilding
    Team diagnostics, group diagnostics, identification of need
    Working with a group - group dynamics, team roles
    Reflexion and supervision
    Communication with a client, preparation of a teambuilding programme
    Dramaturgy before the event
    On site dramaturgy
    - Conflict within the team
    - Coaching
    - Group dynamic
OBJECTIVES:
The goal of this course is to introduce students into the large variety of activities, programmes and principles that are commonly denominated Teambuilding.
    In their practice students may encounter teambuilding programmes not only from the point of view of a participant, but also of a submitter. Therefore, it is necassary for the students to know the theoretical background of team work, as well as practical applications of various types of teambuilding programmes and activities.
TEXT_PREREQUISITS: prerequisite of this course is Teambuilding course
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
-active participation in lectures and seminars
    -group project
    -written test
TEACHING_METHODS: interactive lectures and seminars, group discussion
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
At the end of this course students should be able to:
    - address specific situations in teamwork, to reveal a crisis in the team and be able to find the right help to revitalize the team work
    - work with conflict within the team
    - know basic framework of coaching
    - know basics of group dynamic
    - know the means of supervision to detect deficiencies in teamwork
    - start work on multidisciplinary teams (and project)

NAME: Social Aspects in Sport
TEACHERS: Hurych, E. - Palka, J.
SYLLABUS:
Philosophical reflection of sport.
    Philosophical platform for sport terminology.
    Body, mind, movement.
    Health, naturality.
    Culture, physical culture, nature.
    Problems of culture (civilization) and problems of physical culture (sport).
    Sport as a socio-cultural phenomenon.
    Elite sport versus recreational sport.
    Socialization of human by sport.
    Sport and mass media.
    Sport mobility and migration.
    Violence in sport.
    Gender problems of sport.
    Future perspectives of sport.
OBJECTIVES: The major aims of the subject are: to provide to students some basic philosophical and sociological backgrounds for the complex approach to sport. Sport is presented as a social-cultural phenomenon reflecting the dynamics of changes in the world of values within interests and activities of the mankind. Philosophy of sport presents a major platform of thinking, sociology of sport faces the task to describe and explain socially and culturally conditioned position of sport in modern society. Main objective of the lesson is to properly understand mutual relations of sport and society in local, regional and global context.
ASSESMENT_METHODS:
Min. 80% attendance in seminar lessons
    written test - 15 questions (min. 50% needed to pass)
    - essey about the selected topic
    - assesment interview (according to the situation)
LITERATURE:

NAME: Management in Disability Sport
TEACHERS: Kocůrek, V. - Strachová, M.
SYLLABUS:
LECTURES:
    - Approaches to "normality" and minority groups, terminology.
    - Charasteristics of charity and humanitary projects.
    - Contact theory, approaches and motivation to sports events.
    - Communication and modification of projects for the disabled
    - Sports federation of the disabled: local and international level
    - Management of separative, parallel and inclusive programmes. Scheme according to age, handicap type, content of activity and performance level.
    - Persons with disabilities as participants of management.
    - Management stages in general and particular events.
    - Volunteering.
    - Ambassadorship.

OBJECTIVES: The goals of this course is to introduce the students into the basic approaches and issues related to a successful sport event managerial work in the are of people with disabilities. In order to fulfil the course goal it is necessary to cover topics such as "being different" as well as possibilities of charity and humanitary sport events management.

Point evaluation for active participation in lectures (75%)
    Point evaluation for active participation in seminars and tasks provision (80 %)
    Point evaluation of the proposed project.
    Feed back scheme procession and active participation in the feed-back session.
TEACHING_METHODS: Interactive lectures with the use of IT information, seminars, self-study, presentation of required tasks (3), projecting.
LEARNING_OUTCOMES:
After the course completion the students will be able to:

    - apply the principles of management and marketing to the implementation of a real event
    - be aware of the network of sports federations of disability sport and volunteering
    - communication with the disabled
    - self-reflexion of ones behaviour in a specific background.
